original: yang na bsrungs pa zhes bya ba ni tshal za dag gis bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsrungs pa zhes bya ba ni tshal za dag gis bzlog pa'o //

original: shin tu bsrungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po rang nyid kyis bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu bsrungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po rang nyid kyis bzlog pa'o //
translated: “Well-protected” means that the king himself prevents it.

original: ster bar sla ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i 'os su bde blag tu mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ster bar sla ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i 'os su bde blag tu mi byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Not easy to give” means that it is not easy to make it an object of giving.

original: phyung ste zhes bya ba ni khrod nas phyung ste'o //
analyzed: phyung ste zhes bya ba ni khrod nas phyung ste'o //

original: bcad cing zhes bya ba ni thad kar bcad cing ngo //
analyzed: bcad cing zhes bya ba ni thad kar bcad cing ngo //
translated: “Having cut” means having cut straight.

original: gshegs nas zhes bya ba ni chu tshal du gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs nas zhes bya ba ni chu tshal du gshegs pa'o //
translated: “Having gone” means having gone to the water’s edge.

original: 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba ni khyer bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba ni khyer bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To lead” means to carry.

original: mkhar gyi phyi lam zhes bya ba ni khor khor yug tu rjes su 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir ra ba'i drung thog dag tu lam @38b gtod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhar gyi phyi lam zhes bya ba ni khor khor yug tu rjes su 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir ra ba'i drung thog dag tu lam @38b gtod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “The outer path of the city” should be understood as the path that is set out in front of the wall for the purpose of going around the perimeter.

original: nyul ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: nyul ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: “To wander” means to go around.

original: thong mi pa zhes bya ba ni gsod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: thong mi pa zhes bya ba ni gsod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “To kill” means to desire to kill.

original: chom rkun pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: chom rkun pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod 'phrog pa'o //
translated: “Robbers” are those who steal possessions.

original: dgra bo zhes bya ba ni 'khon gyi sha glan par 'dod pa'i dgra'o //
analyzed: dgra bo zhes bya ba ni 'khon gyi sha glan par 'dod pa'i dgra'o //
translated: “Enemies” are those who wish to avenge past wrongs.

original: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems 'phar ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems 'phar ba'o //
translated: “Fear” is a trembling of the mind.

original: sdangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bslad pa'am 'dar ba'o //
analyzed: sdangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bslad pa'am 'dar ba'o //
translated: “Terror” is a disturbance or trembling of the body.

original: spu zing zhes byed pa zhes bya ba ni spu gyen du 'greng bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: spu zing zhes byed pa zhes bya ba ni spu gyen du 'greng bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Hairs standing on end” is when the hairs of the body stand up.

original: de skad mchi'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ji skad brjod pa de skad mchi'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skad mchi'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gis ji skad brjod pa de skad mchi'o zhes bya'o //
translated: “They say” is what they tell me.

original: 'phags so zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags so zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa'o //
translated: “Noble one” is a term of respect.

original: bsdad do zhes bya ba ni 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: bsdad do zhes bya ba ni 'khod pa'o //
translated: “Stay” is to remain.

original: ma sbran pa zhes bya ba ni ma bos pa'o //
analyzed: ma sbran pa zhes bya ba ni ma bos pa'o //
translated: “Without warning” is without being told.

original: aa rog gya zhes byas te zhes bya ba ni nad med par gyur cig ces bya ba'i shis pa brjod de'o //
analyzed: aa rog gya zhes byas te zhes bya ba ni nad med par gyur cig ces bya ba'i shis pa brjod de'o //
translated: “Saying ‘Arogya’ ” is saying “May you be well,” which is a blessing.

original: blang du zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya bar ro //
analyzed: blang du zhes bya ba ni bdag gir bya bar ro //
translated: “Take” is to make one’s own.

original: rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug ces bya ba ni rgyal srid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug ces bya ba ni rgyal srid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang phyug ste /
translated: The phrase “the sovereignty of the kingdom” means the sovereignty that is the defining attribute of a kingdom.

original: nor dang bcas pa nyid do //🔽mnga' bdag tu zhes bya ba ni rang dbang can nyid du'o //
analyzed: nor dang bcas pa nyid do // mnga' bdag tu zhes bya ba ni rang dbang can nyid du'o //
translated: It is the possession of wealth.🔽The phrase “the status of a lord” means the status of an independent ruler.

original: mnga' ba zhes bya bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur bar gyur nas te rab tu bzhag nas so //🔽mnga' ris zhes bya ba ni phebs pa na ste /
analyzed: mnga' ba zhes bya bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur bar gyur nas te rab tu bzhag nas so // mnga' ris zhes bya ba ni phebs pa na ste /
translated: The phrase “having been consecrated” means having been anointed.🔽The phrase “the dominion” means the territory.

original: yul 'khor na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: yul 'khor na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: It means the country.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni rigs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “ascetic or brahmin” means one who has gone forth or one who belongs to a priestly class.

original: rang bzhin bzang por grags pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa nyid du grags pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin bzang por grags pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa nyid du grags pa'o //
translated: The phrase “who is renowned for his good nature” means one who is renowned as a holy person.

original: deng phyin chad ces bya ba ni de nas so //
analyzed: deng phyin chad ces bya ba ni de nas so //
translated: The phrase “from this day forward” means “from now on.”

original: khyu mchog gi bka' zhes bya ba ni khyu mchog dang 'dra ba'i bka' ste /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi bka' zhes bya ba ni khyu mchog dang 'dra ba'i bka' ste /
translated: The phrase “the command of the bull” means the command of one who is like a bull.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “the words of one who is fearless.”

original: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni yul yangs pa'o //🔽gcig tu dang du bzhes shig ces bya ba ni ci bder spyod cig ces bya ba la gcig tu nges par brten cing ngo //
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni yul yangs pa'o // gcig tu dang du bzhes shig ces bya ba ni ci bder spyod cig ces bya ba la gcig tu nges par brten cing ngo //
translated: Vast means a large area.

original: 'khor gyi nang du zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba'i tshig gi nang du'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba'i tshig gi nang du'o //
translated: Accept it means use it as you wish. In the midst of the assembly means in the midst of the Victor's words.

original: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni rigs par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhes bya ba ni rigs par ro //
translated: Correctly means appropriately.

original: seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs par sgra bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs par sgra bsgrags pa'o //
translated: The lion's roar means the fearless roar.

original: yongs su ma bzung ba la zhes bya ba ni bdag gir ma byas pa la'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma bzung ba la zhes bya ba ni bdag gir ma byas pa la'o //
translated: Not appropriated means not made one's own.🔽Thinking means intending.

original: bsams te zhes bya ba ni dgongs te'o / lha re zhig yongs su ma bzung ba gang lags pa de la lha ci zhig bgyir mchis @39a * //
analyzed: bsams te zhes bya ba ni dgongs te'o / lha re zhig yongs su ma bzung ba gang lags pa de la lha ci zhig bgyir mchis @39a * //
translated: What can be done with that which is not appropriated, O Lord?

original: zhes bya bas ni yongs su ma bzung ba la bdag nyid la yang nyes pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su gnang ba yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ci bder spyod cig ces bya ba don med pa yin no zhes go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni yongs su ma bzung ba la bdag nyid la yang nyes pa med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su gnang ba yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ci bder spyod cig ces bya ba don med pa yin no zhes go bar byed pa'o //
translated: This shows that it is meaningless to say, “Use it as you will,” because there is no fault in not accepting it, and because it is not proper to give permission.

original: 'phral rtse gsum zhes bya ba ni mdung rtse gsum pa dang 'dra ba'i yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral rtse gsum zhes bya ba ni mdung rtse gsum pa dang 'dra ba'i yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: “Triangular” means having three parts like a trident.

original: khro gnyer zhes bya ba ni smin ma 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khro gnyer zhes bya ba ni smin ma 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Frowning” means to knit the eyebrows.

original: bzhin 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyams pa ste /🔽rang gi rang bzhin las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyams pa ste / rang gi rang bzhin las nyams pa'o //
translated: “Changing the face” means to distort it.🔽“Changing the eyes” means to change the natural state of the eyes.

original: mig bgrad de zhes bya ba ni gdangs te'o //
analyzed: mig bgrad de zhes bya ba ni gdangs te'o //
translated: “Staring” means to open the eyes wide.

original: lag mthil gnyis 'dril zhing zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig drud cing ngo //
analyzed: lag mthil gnyis 'dril zhing zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig drud cing ngo //
translated: “Rubbing the palms together” means to rub one against the other.

original: gtum pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa'o //🔽brtun ngas pa zhes bya ba brtad skyen pa ste /
analyzed: gtum pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa'o // brtun ngas pa zhes bya ba brtad skyen pa ste /
translated: “Fierce” means to be agitated.🔽“Impatient” means to be quick to anger.

original: rtsol ba la gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtsol ba la gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means to be devoted to striving.

original: drag shul che ba zhes bya ba ni zhe gnag pa la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: drag shul che ba zhes bya ba ni zhe gnag pa la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Fierce” means “delighting in cruelty.”

original: tsham tshom med pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa sngon du mi gtong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tsham tshom med pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa sngon du mi gtong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Without hesitation” means “without prior reflection.”

original: tshig snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med pa ste /
analyzed: tshig snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu med pa ste /
translated: “Without substance” means “without result.”

original: gsad pa'i rigs la khyod ces smras la ma bsad par btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsad pa'i rigs la khyod ces smras la ma bsad par btang ba'i phyir ro //

original: spyos te zhes bya ba ni bsdigs te'o //
analyzed: spyos te zhes bya ba ni bsdigs te'o //
translated: “Having rebuked” means “having threatened.”

original: skad po che'i skad phyung zhing zhes bya ba ni skad chen por smras pa ni skad chen po ste /🔽skad chen po'i skad de phyung zhing ngo //
analyzed: skad po che'i skad phyung zhing zhes bya ba ni skad chen por smras pa ni skad chen po ste / skad chen po'i skad de phyung zhing ngo //

analyzed: sgra mthon po zhes bya ba ni sgra'i gsang mtho ba'o //
translated: “Loudly” means “with a loud sound.”

original: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni klag cor gyi sgra ste /
analyzed: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni klag cor gyi sgra ste /
translated: “Greatly” means “with a loud noise.”

original: snga ma ni rgyu'i tshig yin la phyi ma ni 'bras bu'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni rgyu'i tshig yin la phyi ma ni 'bras bu'i tshig yin no //
translated: The former is a causal term, the latter a resultant term.

translated: “With a loud noise” means with a loud sound of shouting.🔽“With a loud cry” means with a loud sound of weeping.🔽“With a loud shout” means with a loud sound of shouting.🔽“With a loud exclamation” means with a loud sound of wailing.

original: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni klag cor gyi sgra'o / gyod ces bya ba ni yan lag bcad pa'o //🔽srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsad pa'o //🔽lam po che zhes bya ba ni shin rta'i lam mo //
analyzed: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni klag cor gyi sgra'o / gyod ces bya ba ni yan lag bcad pa'o // srog dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni bsad pa'o // lam po che zhes bya ba ni shin rta'i lam mo //
translated: “With a loud wailing” means with a loud sound of wailing.🔽“With a loud lamentation” means with a loud sound of lamenting.

original: srang zhes bya ba ni lam dogs pa'am tshong khang gi bar ro //🔽bzhi mdo zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bzhi mdo'o //
analyzed: srang zhes bya ba ni lam dogs pa'am tshong khang gi bar ro // bzhi mdo zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bzhi mdo'o //

original: sum mdo zhes bya ba ni lam gyi sum mdo'o //
analyzed: sum mdo zhes bya ba ni lam gyi sum mdo'o //
translated: “With a loud cry of grief” means with a loud sound of crying out in grief.🔽“With a loud cry of distress” means with a loud sound of crying out in distress.🔽“With a loud cry of anguish” means with a loud sound of crying out in anguish.🔽“With a loud cry of sorrow” means with a loud sound of crying out in sorrow.🔽“With a loud cry of grief” means with a loud sound of crying out in grief.🔽“With a loud cry of distress” means with a loud sound of crying out in distress.🔽“With a loud cry of anguish” means with a loud sound of crying out in anguish.🔽“With a loud cry of sorrow” means with a loud sound of crying out in sorrow.🔽“With a loud cry of grief” means with a loud sound of crying out in grief.🔽“With a loud cry of distress” means with a loud sound of crying out in distress.🔽“With a loud cry of anguish” means with a loud sound of crying out in anguish.🔽“With a loud cry of sorrow” means with a loud sound of crying out in sorrow.🔽“With a loud cry of grief” means with a loud sound of crying out in grief.

original: bka' 'dogs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni sgrogs pa'i gnas so //🔽grong rdal ba dag ces bya ba ni grong khyer na gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: bka' 'dogs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni sgrogs pa'i gnas so //🔽grong rdal ba dag ces bya ba ni grong khyer na gnas pa dag go //
translated: “With a loud cry of distress” means with a loud sound of crying out in distress.🔽“With a loud cry of anguish” means with a loud sound of

original: yul mi dag ces bya ba ni yul na @39b gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: yul mi dag ces bya ba ni yul na @39b gnas pa dag go //
translated: “People of the country” are those who live in the country.

original: nor can dag ces bya ba ni tshong pa dag go //
analyzed: nor can dag ces bya ba ni tshong pa dag go //
translated: “Wealthy people” are merchants.

original: tshong dpon dag ces bya ba ni tshong ba'i gtso bo dag go //
analyzed: tshong dpon dag ces bya ba ni tshong ba'i gtso bo dag go //
translated: “Merchants” are the leaders of the merchants.

original: ma sha ka lnga zhes bya ba ni pa na 'gron bu brgyad cu'i rin gyi tshad lnga'o //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga zhes bya ba ni pa na 'gron bu brgyad cu'i rin gyi tshad lnga'o //
translated: “Five māsakas” is the value of eighty paṇas.

original: ma sha ka lnga las lhag pas zhes bya ba ni pa na lnga las lhag pas sos //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga las lhag pas zhes bya ba ni pa na lnga las lhag pas sos //
translated: “More than five māsakas” is more than five paṇas.

original: bdag dang bzod ces bya ba ni bdag de'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bzod ces bya ba ni bdag de'o //
translated: “One’s own” is one’s own.

original: ma byin pa gang yin pa de rku ba'i grangs su gtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni ma byin pa ni rku ba grangs su chud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byin pa gang yin pa de rku ba'i grangs su gtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni ma byin pa ni rku ba grangs su chud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “That which is not given is included in the category of theft” means that that which is not given is included in the category of theft.

original: de yang rkub bdag gir byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rku sems yin par bstan pa'i sar smos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rkub bdag gir byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rku sems yin par bstan pa'i sar smos par shes par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood as stated in the section on the definition of stealing, which is taught to be the intention to steal.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For example” is for the purpose of illustration.

original: rgyal srid la dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid la bzhag pas so //
analyzed: rgyal srid la dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid la bzhag pas so //
translated: The term “anointed” means that he is placed on the throne.

original: de yang rgyal po zhes bya ba ni bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyal po zhes bya ba ni bdag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the term “king” means that he is the lord.

original: rgyal rigs zhes bya ba ni skye dgu bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs zhes bya ba ni skye dgu bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “noble” means that he protects the people.

original: spyi bor dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i steng du bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi bor dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i steng du bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “anointed on the head” means that he is placed above the people.

original: blon po chen po zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: blon po chen po zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The term “great minister” means that he is like the king.

original: blon po zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: blon po zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: The term “minister” means that he follows the king.

original: rtsis mkhan zhes bya ba ni skar mkhan no //
analyzed: rtsis mkhan zhes bya ba ni skar mkhan no //
translated: The term “astrologer” means that he is an astronomer.

original: sna chen po la gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du bskos pa'o //
analyzed: sna chen po la gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du bskos pa'o //
translated: The term “great official” means that he is appointed to a high position.

original: gsang tshig mthun pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni gsang tshig gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gsang tshig mthun pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni gsang tshig gcig pa'o //
translated: The term “living by secret words” means that he has the same secret words.

original: kye zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: kye zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The term “hey you” means that he is a servant.

original: rkun ma zhes bya ba ni 'jab bus rku ba'o //
analyzed: rkun ma zhes bya ba ni 'jab bus rku ba'o //
translated: The term “thief” means that he steals secretly.

original: byis pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term “child” means that he does not know by himself.

original: blun pa zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: blun pa zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term fool refers to one who does not know the scriptures.

original: rku ba zhes bya ba ni mthus rku ba'o //
analyzed: rku ba zhes bya ba ni mthus rku ba'o //
translated: The term stealer refers to one who steals by force.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rdzogs pa'i gnas mya ngan las 'das par khad bsnyen cing mthun par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rdzogs pa'i gnas mya ngan las 'das par khad bsnyen cing mthun par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The term approacher refers to one who approaches and is in accord with the state of nirvana, which is the completion of all perfections.

original: dge slong gi dngos po yang dag par blangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po yang dag par blangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of a monk is the approach to nirvana, which is attained by taking up the precepts.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma la ltos pa'i sgra yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma la ltos pa'i sgra yin no //
translated: The term also refers to the previous.

original: spyi sdom la zhes bya ba ni sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams spyir bsdus pa'i sdom mo //
analyzed: spyi sdom la zhes bya ba ni sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams spyir bsdus pa'i sdom mo //
translated: The term in general refers to the summary of the verses of the summary.

original: yo byad ces bya ba ni rdzas so //
analyzed: yo byad ces bya ba ni rdzas so //
translated: The term requisites refers to substances.

original: lci ba dag ces bya ba ni rin che ba dag go //

analyzed: mngags pas rku ba zhes bya ba ni mngags pa rgyur gyur pa lkog na 'dug pas rku ba'o //

translated: Here, too, the intrinsic natures of both stealing and instigating stealing are taught. The phrase having been sent, he conceals it from place to place refers to the intrinsic nature of stealing.

translated: The third of the first is stated in order to teach that there is no difference in stealing whether it is done by oneself, by another, or in public or in private.

original: gsum pa gsum pa ni rku ba dang bdag gir byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rku sems dang lus dang ngag gi tshol ba dag pham par 'gyur ba'i yan lag nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //

translated: The third of the third is stated in order to teach that the thought of stealing, the act of stealing, and the search by body and speech are branches of the downfall.

original: gsum pa bzhi pa ni mi'i 'gro ba bas bdag gir byas pa nyid pham par 'gyur ba'i yan lag nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //

translated: The third and fifth are stated to show that the perception of taking what is not given by humans is a branch of the defeat.

translated: The word thus is a term indicating existence, free from the extreme of non-existence.🔽 The word necklace refers to a round ornament worn around the neck.🔽 The word bracelet refers to a thin ornament worn on the arm.

translated: The phrase he makes a heavy load refers to the situation in which a person steals the load with the thought, I will steal the load, after he has made it heavy. translated: The path of the measure is the path of the measure

analyzed: rkun shas zhes bya ba ni rul gyi shas so //
translated: The term rotten refers to the rotten part.

analyzed: @43b byis pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis mngon par mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term child refers to one who does not understand by himself.

original: blun pa zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa mngon par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: blun pa zhes bya ba ni lung phog pa mngon par mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term fool refers to one who does not understand what is imparted.

analyzed: mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni sngar shes pa mngon par mi shes pa ste brjed ngas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term unclear refers to one who does not understand what was previously understood; the term means forgetful.

analyzed: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun gyi bye brag la mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: The term unskilled refers to one who is unskilled in the distinctions between things.

original: yang na byis pa dang blun po dang mi gsal ba dang mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab dang / thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang bral ba ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na byis pa dang blun po dang mi gsal ba dang mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab dang / thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang bral ba ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Alternatively, the terms child, fool, unclear, and unskilled refer, respectively, to one who is devoid of the wisdom derived from birth, the wisdom derived from learning, the wisdom derived from reflection, and the wisdom derived from meditation.

original: gya chom zhes bya ba ni ched du ma bsams par glo bur ro //
analyzed: gya chom zhes bya ba ni ched du ma bsams par glo bur ro //
translated: The term haphazard refers to that which is not deliberate, but adventitious.

original: byung rgyal zhes bya ba ni brjod pa de las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: byung rgyal zhes bya ba ni brjod pa de las 'byung ba ste /
translated: “Random” means arising from that expression.

original: de las byung ba de byung rgyal ma yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba de byung rgyal ma yin no //
translated: What arises from that is not random.

original: de las byung ba ma yin pa ni byung rgyal te dngos pos stong pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ma yin pa ni byung rgyal te dngos pos stong pa'o //
translated: What does not arise from that is random, empty of entity.

original: so sor ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni rigs pas ma dpyad par ro //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags par zhes bya ba ni rigs pas ma dpyad par ro //
translated: “Without analysis” means without rational investigation.

original: bya ra gyis shig ces bya ba ni res par blta ba ltar longs shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: bya ra gyis shig ces bya ba ni res par blta ba ltar longs shig ces pa'o //
translated: “Keep watch” means “be on guard” like someone who is watching for something.

original: bag gyis shig ces bya ba ni bya ba gzhan ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bag gyis shig ces bya ba ni bya ba gzhan ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: “Be careful” means “do not do anything else.”

original: shags zhos bya ba ni shags 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: shags zhos bya ba ni shags 'gyed pa'o //
translated: “Quarrel” means to argue.

original: yongs su bskor ba zhes bya ba ni mtha' bskor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba zhes bya ba ni mtha' bskor ba'o //
translated: “Surround” means to encircle.

original: 'og gzu zhes bya ba ni yul mi'i tshogs so//
analyzed: 'og gzu zhes bya ba ni yul mi'i tshogs so//
translated: “The crowd” means a group of people.

original: sbyor ba btang nas zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba btang na'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba btang nas zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba btang na'o //
translated: “Giving up the effort” means giving up the exertion.

original: 'og gzur du zin kyang bla'i grva'i skabs yod pa'i phyir sbyor ba btang na brkus pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: 'og gzur du zin kyang bla'i grva'i skabs yod pa'i phyir sbyor ba btang na brkus pa'i dus yin no //
translated: Even if the crowd is gone, if the effort is given up, it is the time of the theft, because there is an opportunity at the edge.

original: bla'i grva zhes bya ba ni rgyal pos bskos pa'i grva'o //
analyzed: bla'i grva zhes bya ba ni rgyal pos bskos pa'i grva'o //
translated: The “border of the monastery” is the border appointed by the king.

original: dpon po yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ni bdag po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpon po yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyal po ni bdag po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Because he is the master” means because the king is the master.

original: der rgyal na gzhan gyi skabs med pa'i phyir rkus pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: der rgyal na gzhan gyi skabs med pa'i phyir rkus pa'i dus yin no //
translated: “It is the time of theft” means that when he wins, there is no opportunity for others.

original: rtsig pa'i zhes bya ba ni ra ba'o //🔽mtshams kyi sna dang zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi gnas phyi ma shos dang ngo //
analyzed: rtsig pa'i zhes bya ba ni ra ba'o // mtshams kyi sna dang zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi gnas phyi ma shos dang ngo //
translated: “Wall” means a fence.🔽“The end of the border” means the last place of the border.

original: mtshams kyi snar zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi gnas mdun ma shos su'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi snar zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi gnas mdun ma shos su'o //
translated: “The beginning of the border” means the first place of the border.

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: “Unsurpassed wisdom” means complete enlightenment.

original: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni rgya cher ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni rgya cher ro //
translated: “Extensive” means vast.

original: spa dgong sla zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan sla ba'o //
analyzed: spa dgong sla zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan sla ba'o //
translated: “Easy to overwhelm” means easy to overpower.

original: sho gam gzhal dgos pa zhes bya ba ni gzhal bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: sho gam gzhal dgos pa zhes bya ba ni gzhal bar 'os pa'o //
translated: “Worthy of being assessed” means worthy of being measured.

original: rung ngam zhes bya ba ni rigs sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rung ngam zhes bya ba ni rigs sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Is it proper?” means “Is it right?”

original: ltung ba med ces bya ba ni shog ma @44a * //
analyzed: ltung ba med ces bya ba ni shog ma @44a * //
translated: “No offense” means “Come.”

original: gzhal ba dbang ba nyid mi shes pa'i phyir dang rku sems med pa'i phyir ro / sar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sho gam gyi gnas su phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal ba dbang ba nyid mi shes pa'i phyir dang rku sems med pa'i phyir ro / sar phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sho gam gyi gnas su phyin pa'o //
translated: “Having gone to the border” means having gone to the place of the toll.

original: 'gal tshabs can zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'das pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal tshabs can zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'das pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: “With a fine” means with a very great penalty.

original: nyes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: It means with a fault.

original: / de yang kha cig pham par 'gyur ba yang yin //
analyzed: / de yang kha cig pham par 'gyur ba yang yin //
translated: Moreover, some are defeated,

original: kha cig nyes pa sbom po dang ltung byed la sogs par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: kha cig nyes pa sbom po dang ltung byed la sogs par 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: and some have a serious transgression, a downfall, and so on.

original: 'dir ni rku sems kyis rang gi rdzas sho gam gzhal dgos pa bzlas te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rku sems kyis rang gi rdzas sho gam gzhal dgos pa bzlas te /
translated: Here, with a thought of stealing, one’s own goods that are to be assessed as a toll

original: rin thang tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rin thang tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: are concealed, and if the value is complete, there is a defeat.

original: gzhan gyi bzlas na sbom por 'gyur ngo ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi bzlas na sbom por 'gyur ngo ;
translated: If another’s are concealed, there is a serious transgression.

original: / bzla bar mi bya'o zhes bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa las 'das pa ni thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / bzla bar mi bya'o zhes bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa las 'das pa ni thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: When the basis of training is given, “Do not conceal!” all transgressing is a fault.

original: shar ba'i tshal gseb ces bya ba ni smyig mi nyag ma shar ba'i tshal gseb bo //
analyzed: shar ba'i tshal gseb ces bya ba ni smyig mi nyag ma shar ba'i tshal gseb bo //
translated: The grove of the rising sun means the grove of the rising sun's rays.

original: bzo spyong zhes bya ba ni rgyal po des bzo bo'i tshogs bco brgyad po dag la phas bzo slob tu bcug ba las bzo bar gyur pa de'i ming bzo sbong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzo spyong zhes bya ba ni rgyal po des bzo bo'i tshogs bco brgyad po dag la phas bzo slob tu bcug ba las bzo bar gyur pa de'i ming bzo sbong zhes bya'o //
translated: The one skilled in arts means that the king had his son study the eighteen branches of knowledge with a group of teachers, and he became skilled in the arts.🔽The eighteen branches of knowledge are:

original: bzo bo'i tshogs bco brgyad ni tshong pa dang / rdza mkhan pa dang / phreng brgyud dang / chang pa dang / phyugs rdzi dang / 'dreg mkhan dang / 'bru mar mkhan dang / mgar ba mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / phyva pa mkhan dang /
analyzed: bzo bo'i tshogs bco brgyad ni tshong pa dang / rdza mkhan pa dang / phreng brgyud dang / chang pa dang / phyugs rdzi dang / 'dreg mkhan dang / 'bru mar mkhan dang / mgar ba mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / phyva pa mkhan dang /
translated: the arts, pottery, stringing garlands, brewing beer, tending cattle, barbering, oil pressing, blacksmithing, carpentry, leatherworking,

original: tha ga pa dang / ko lpags mkhan dang / nya ba dang / btso blag mkhan dang / smyig ma mkhan dang / shan pa dang / bshed ma dang / shing rta mkhan zhes bya ba bdag ste /
analyzed: tha ga pa dang / ko lpags mkhan dang / nya ba dang / btso blag mkhan dang / smyig ma mkhan dang / shan pa dang / bshed ma dang / shing rta mkhan zhes bya ba bdag ste /
translated: weaving, tanning, fishing, dyeing, basketry, butchering, prostitution, and cartwrighting.

original: de phas bzo sgo bco brgyad po dag la btsud do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phas bzo sgo bco brgyad po dag la btsud do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The father had him study the eighteen branches of knowledge.

original: bden pa dag la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba de kho na nyid dag la'o //
analyzed: bden pa dag la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba de kho na nyid dag la'o //
translated: With regard to the truths means with regard to the reality of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: bkod nas zhes bya ba ni shes pa mi g-yo bas bzhag nas so //
analyzed: bkod nas zhes bya ba ni shes pa mi g-yo bas bzhag nas so //
translated: Having arranged means having established with unwavering cognition.

original: ko sa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul ko sa lang skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ko sa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul ko sa lang skyes pa'o //
translated: Born in Kosala means born in the country of Kosala.

original: gzhon nu'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: The Sutra of the Youth means in the sutra it is said: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das ko sa la dag tu nyu ljongs rgyur gshegs pa na mnyan yod na byon nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ko sa la dag tu nyu ljongs rgyur gshegs pa na mnyan yod na byon nas /
translated: The Blessed One, traveling through the country of Kosala, arrived at Shravasti.

original: mnyan yong na rgyal byed kyi sal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ba ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: mnyan yong na rgyal byed kyi sal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ba ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: He stayed in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anathapindika, in Shravasti.

original: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge sbyong @44b goo ta ma ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs pa na mnyan yod du byon nas mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs shing /
analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge sbyong @44b goo ta ma ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs pa na mnyan yod du byon nas mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs shing /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala heard that the ascetic Gautama, while wandering through Kosala, had arrived in Śrāvastī and was staying in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park.

original: shes ldan goo ta ma de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o zhes thos so //
analyzed: shes ldan goo ta ma de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o zhes thos so //
translated: “The honorable Gautama himself proclaims, ‘I am the unsurpassed, perfect Buddha!’”

original: thos nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: thos nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Having heard this, he went to see the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig mngon du yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam sna tshogs byas te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig mngon du yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam sna tshogs byas te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: When he arrived, he sat down to one side and had a discussion with the Blessed One about the meaning of various topics.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When they had finished their discussion, King Prasenajit of Kosala said to the Blessed One,🔽“Blessed One,

original: kye goo ta ma bdag gis shes ldan go ta ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o zhes thos na /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma bdag gis shes ldan go ta ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o zhes thos na /
translated: “O Gautama, I have heard that you, Gautama, declare that you have fully and perfectly realized unsurpassed, perfect awakening.

original: kye goo ta ma ji lta gang dag ji skad mchi ba de dag de ltar brda sprod par bgyid pa na shes ldan goo ta ma la skur ba 'debs par mi bgyid cing ha cang thal bar bgyid pa dang / de dag shes ldan goo ta mas gsungs pa'i rjes su smra ba dang /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma ji lta gang dag ji skad mchi ba de dag de ltar brda sprod par bgyid pa na shes ldan goo ta ma la skur ba 'debs par mi bgyid cing ha cang thal bar bgyid pa dang / de dag shes ldan goo ta mas gsungs pa'i rjes su smra ba dang /
translated: O Gautama, when those who speak like this are communicating in this way, they do not denigrate you, Gautama, nor do they go too far, and they speak in accordance with what you, Gautama, have said.

original: chos smra ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos brda sprod par bgyid pa dang / gsungs pa'i rjes su smra ba de dag la gzhan las chos dang mthun pas smad pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos 'ga' yang mi mchi ba lags sam /
analyzed: chos smra ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos brda sprod par bgyid pa dang / gsungs pa'i rjes su smra ba de dag la gzhan las chos dang mthun pas smad pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos 'ga' yang mi mchi ba lags sam /
translated: Are there no grounds for others to criticize them in accordance with the Dharma, for those who speak in accordance with what you have said, who speak the Dharma, who communicate the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, and who speak in accordance with what you have said?”🔽“

original: rgyal po chen po gang dag de skad zer ba de dag de ltar brda sprod par byed pa ni kho bo la skur ba 'debs par mi byed cing /

original: 'dun pa las byung ba'i slong mo zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa bskyed pas slong mo bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa las byung ba'i slong mo zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa bskyed pas slong mo bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “Begging” which arises from aspiration is the accomplishment of begging by generating aspiration.

original: zad par zhes bya ba ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: zad par zhes bya ba ni thams cad du'o //
translated: “Extensively” means in all ways.

original: khyab par gyur ces bya ba ni chub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par gyur ces bya ba ni chub par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Pervaded” means completely.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar ro //
translated: “Thus, that Bhagavat” and so on. “Thus” means in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar ston pa yin no //
translated: “That Bhagavat” is the Tathāgata who is revealed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gshegs pa dang / sems can 'dul ba de bzhin du gshegs pa dang / nyes pa bag chags dang bcas pa yang mi 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gshegs pa dang / sems can 'dul ba de bzhin du gshegs pa dang / nyes pa bag chags dang bcas pa yang mi 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin du gshegs pa dang /
translated: “Tathāgata” means one who goes thus to the essence of all things as they are, one who goes thus to the training of sentient beings, and one who goes thus to the non-arising of faults together with their imprints.

original: de'i dang po'i smon lam ji ltar gyur pa de bzhin du mdzad pa ma lus pa mdzad par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dang po'i smon lam ji ltar gyur pa de bzhin du mdzad pa ma lus pa mdzad par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Tathagata because he has accomplished all that he had vowed to accomplish, just as he had vowed.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa'o //🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa'o // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is called Arhat because he is worthy of the offerings of all the world.

original: mi slu ba'i mkhyen pa yang dag pas don mtha' dag rdzogs par thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i mkhyen pa yang dag pas don mtha' dag rdzogs par thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is called Samyak-Sambuddha because he has fully and perfectly awakened to all dharmas through his unerring knowledge.

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum dang / mi slob pa'i lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yang dag par 'tsho ba'i spyod pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum dang / mi slob pa'i lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yang dag par 'tsho ba'i spyod pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is called Vidyacarana-sampanna because he possesses the three knowledges of a non-learner and the non-learner's restraint of body, speech, and livelihood.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni kun du gzigs pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mdzes par gshegs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni kun du gzigs pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mdzes par gshegs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The expression one who has gone to bliss means that he has gone to the beautiful conduct of omniscience, etc.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni sems can 'khor ba thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni sems can 'khor ba thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression one who knows the world means that he has penetrated the world of sentient beings.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jam pa dang rtsub pa dang gnyis ka'i 'dul ba'i rnam pa gsum gyis 'dul ba skyes bu lta bu dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jam pa dang rtsub pa dang gnyis ka'i 'dul ba'i rnam pa gsum gyis 'dul ba skyes bu lta bu dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression the unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained means that he trains beings who are like horses to be tamed in the three ways: by gentle, harsh, and both gentle and harsh methods, and he trains them without error.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin bden pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin bden pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression teacher of gods and humans means that he teaches the truth in a way that accords with reality.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'i gnyid ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa'i gnyid ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression Buddha means that he is free from the sleep of ignorance.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression Blessed One means that he is endowed with the destruction of the four Maras.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa zhes @47a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa zhes @47a * //
translated: The Dharma of the Bhagavat is well-proclaimed.

original: bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: The Dharma of the Bhagavat Buddha is the four noble truths.

original: de ni de'i legs par gsungs pa'i ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i legs par gsungs pa'i ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is well-proclaimed because it is taught without error, just as it is.

original: yang dag par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mthong bas phye ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mthong bas phye ba ste /
translated: It is discerned by right view.

original: yang dag par mthong ba zhes yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa med pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba zhes yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa med pa'i blo ste /
translated: Right view is the uncontaminated knowledge of the path of seeing.

original: des phye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pas mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi chos bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid mthong bas de'i phyir yang dag par mthong bas phye ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des phye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed pas mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi chos bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid mthong bas de'i phyir yang dag par mthong bas phye ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is discerned by that, because it is well-differentiated. At the time of the path of seeing, the Dharma of the Bhagavat, which is the nature of the four noble truths, is seen. Therefore, it is said to be discerned by right view.

original: slu ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slu ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is free from deception.

original: nad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas gdung bar byed pa'i rang bzhin rims nad lta bu dag dang nges par bral bas nad med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nad med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas gdung bar byed pa'i rang bzhin rims nad lta bu dag dang nges par bral bas nad med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Health means being definitely free from the nature of being tormented by the affliction of attachment and so on, which is like a contagious disease.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the Bhagavān’s path.

original: dus chad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir de'i rtsom pa dang mtha' gnyis dus mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: dus chad pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir de'i rtsom pa dang mtha' gnyis dus mnyam pa ste /
translated: The absence of a fixed time means that the beginning and end of the path are simultaneous.🔽Thus, just when the path that focuses on suffering arises, just then the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are abandoned.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i las skye ba de kho na'i tshe sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / gang kho na'i tshe kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa'i lam skye ba de kho na'i tshe kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na'i tshe sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i las skye ba de kho na'i tshe sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / gang kho na'i tshe kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa'i lam skye ba de kho na'i tshe kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: Just when the path that focuses on origin, cessation, and path arises, just then the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, cessation, and path are abandoned.

original: 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba de'i dus phyis dus mnyam pa zhes bya ba ste lam gyi rtsom pa dang 'bras bu'i mtha' gnyis dus mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba de'i dus phyis dus mnyam pa zhes bya ba ste lam gyi rtsom pa dang 'bras bu'i mtha' gnyis dus mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The time when one abandons the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path is called the time of equality, which is to say, the time when the beginning of the path and the end of the result are equal.

original: nye bar gtod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar gtod pa la yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar gtod pa la yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The term “related” means “existing in relation.”

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la nye bar gtod par mdzad pas nye bar gtod pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la nye bar gtod par mdzad pas nye bar gtod pa ste /
translated: The four noble truths are related because they are related to the one who is related to them.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The one who is related is the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: de la yod pa ni nye bar gtod pa la yod pa ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa ni nye bar gtod pa la yod pa ste /
translated: The four noble truths exist in relation to him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos lam gyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The Blessed One’s Dharma is the nature of the path,

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lam skye ba de'i tshe na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la the tshom med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe lam skye ba de'i tshe na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la the tshom med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the path arises, one becomes free of doubt with regard to the four noble truths.

original: 'di mthong ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni shog la ltos shig pa lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di mthong ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni shog la ltos shig pa lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The term “related to this” is like the expression “related to that.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'gro ba rnams la tshur shog la de kho na nyid bzhi po dag la ltos shig ces rung ba nyid kyis smra ba dang 'dra @47b bar 'bod cing ston pas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'gro ba rnams la tshur shog la de kho na nyid bzhi po dag la ltos shig ces rung ba nyid kyis smra ba dang 'dra @47b bar 'bod cing ston pas na /
translated: It is as if one were to say to those who are traveling on the noble path, Come here and look at the four realities!

original: shog la ltos shig pa lta bu zhes byas te /
analyzed: shog la ltos shig pa lta bu zhes byas te /
translated: It is as if one were to say, Come here and look!

original: 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa na de kho na nyid la sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa na de kho na nyid la sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When the noble path arises, it is said that there is no obscuration with regard to reality.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig pa zhas bya ba ni mkhas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes brnyes pa mang po rnams kyis so sor rang gi sems kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig pa zhas bya ba ni mkhas pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes brnyes pa mang po rnams kyis so sor rang gi sems kyis rig par bya ba yin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: The phrase it is to be personally experienced by the wise means that it is to be personally experienced by the wise who have attained supramundane knowledge, not by others.

original: go // bcom ldan 'das kyi chos la lam dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: go // bcom ldan 'das kyi chos la lam dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat's Dharma has the characteristics of a path and a result.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi slob mar rab tu byung ba'i dge 'dun ni mngon par shes pa bul ba dka' ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba dka' ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi slob mar rab tu byung ba'i dge 'dun ni mngon par shes pa bul ba dka' ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba dka' ba dang /
translated: The Saṅgha of the Bhagavat’s śrāvakas is called “well-practiced” because the Saṅgha of disciples who have gone forth under the Bhagavat are engaged in and have undertaken the practice of the path that is difficult and slow in knowledge, difficult and quick in knowledge,

original: mngon par shes pa bul ba sla ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam bsgrub pa la zhugs shing yang dag par brten pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul ba sla ba dang / mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba'i lam bsgrub pa la zhugs shing yang dag par brten pa yin no //
translated: slow and easy in knowledge, and quick and easy in knowledge.

original: rigs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa rigs par 'os pa'i tshogs la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa rigs par 'os pa'i tshogs la zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are called “practiced in what is proper” because they are engaged in the accumulation of what is proper, such as the foundations of mindfulness and the stage of heat.

original: drang por zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gya gyu med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i srol 'phags pa'i lam du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: drang por zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gya gyu med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i srol 'phags pa'i lam du zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are called “practiced in what is straight” because they are engaged in the path of the āryas, the straight path to nirvāṇa, without crookedness.

original: mthun par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bslabs pas mthun pa'am mi slob pas mthun pa'i lam du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bslabs pas mthun pa'am mi slob pas mthun pa'i lam du zhugs pa'o //
translated: They are called “practiced in what is suitable” because they are engaged in the path that is suitable for training or not training.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni chos mya ngan las 'das pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni chos mya ngan las 'das pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos te /
translated: The phrase “engaging in the Dharma that accords with Dharma” means that the Dharma of nirvana is the Dharma that accords with Dharma.🔽

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dang yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba nyid la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa dang lus dang ngag gi sdom pa dang yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba nyid la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “engaging in the Dharma that accords with the Dharma” means that the Dharma that accords with the Dharma of nirvana is the uncontaminated knowledge, the restraint of body and speech, and the correct livelihood.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang sdom pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos lus dang ngag gi sdom
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang sdom pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos lus dang ngag gi sdom
translated: The phrase “practicing the Dharma that accords with the Dharma” means that the Dharma that accords with the Dharma of nirvana is the Dharma that accords with the path of the noble ones. The Dharma that accords with the restraint of the code of rules is the restraint of body and speech.

original: pa dang yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dag la rjes su sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa dang yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dag la rjes su sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Dharma that accords with the correct livelihood is the correct livelihood. The phrase “practicing the Dharma that accords with the Dharma” means that one practices the Dharma that accords with the Dharma of nirvana.

original: de ltar chos kyi rjes su mthun par dpyod pa dag gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir dge 'dun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi rjes su mthun par dpyod pa dag gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir dge 'dun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of those who practice the Dharma that accords with the Dharma, the root text states, “the Saṅgha.”

original: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang na ste den gang zag 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rgyun du @48a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi nang na ste den gang zag 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rgyun du @48a * //

original: zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag kyang yod ces bya ba la rgyun ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag kyang yod ces bya ba la rgyun ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /

analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the ocean of nirvāṇa.

original: der zhugs pa ni rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: der zhugs pa ni rtogs pa ste /
translated: Those who have entered that stream are called “those who have realized the stream.”🔽The result of stream-enterer is the result of stream-entry.
