original: rim gyis mthong ba'i lam gyis khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spang ba'i phyir brtson pa gang dag yin pa dag gam zhes cher 'dod chags dang bral ba bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams drug pa ma spangs pa gang dag🔽yin pa dag go //
analyzed: rim gyis mthong ba'i lam gyis khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spang ba'i phyir brtson pa gang dag yin pa dag gam zhes cher 'dod chags dang bral ba bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams drug pa ma spangs pa gang dag yin pa dag go //
translated: Those who gradually strive to abandon the afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by the path of seeing through the path of seeing are those who are free from attachment to the desire realm and who have not abandoned the sixth stage of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de dag go //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de dag go //
translated: Those who enter the stream are those who have attained the fruit of entering the stream.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag lan cig ces bya ba re zhig mi'i 'gro ba pa'i dper 'gyur zhing lhag pa med pa de dag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ste 'dod
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag lan cig ces bya ba re zhig mi'i 'gro ba pa'i dper 'gyur zhing lhag pa med pa de dag ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ste 'dod
translated: Those who enter to actualize the fruit of once-returner are those who are called once-returners.

original: pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya bdag gi rnam pa drug tu spangs shing mthong ba'i lam las langs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams so //
analyzed: pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya bdag gi rnam pa drug tu spangs shing mthong ba'i lam las langs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams so //
translated: They are the noble individuals who have abandoned the six types of defilements of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and who have arisen from the path of seeing.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Their result is the fruit of once-returner.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa dang 'dod pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa rnams bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag gi rnam pa drug spangs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa dang 'dod pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa rnams bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag gi rnam pa drug spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the defilements of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and the abandonment of the six types of defilements of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ste /
translated: Those who have entered to actualize that are those who have entered to actualize the fruit of once-returner.

original: rim gyis bsgom pa'i lam las rim gyis zhugs pa dang mthong ba'i lam la shas cher 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rim gyis bsgom pa'i lam las rim gyis zhugs pa dang mthong ba'i lam la shas cher 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are those who gradually enter through the path of cultivation, and those who are mostly free from attachment on the path of seeing.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis de'i 'bras bu thob pa dag go //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis de'i 'bras bu thob pa dag go //
translated: “Once-returners” are those who have attained that fruit.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i don du yang phyir mi 'ong bar 'dod @48b pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag gi
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i don du yang phyir mi 'ong bar 'dod @48b pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag gi
translated: “Those who have entered the path to manifest the fruit of non-return” are those who, in order to be reborn in the desire realm, do not return to the desire realm, and who, in order to abandon the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation,

original: rnam pa dgu pa yang spangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa yang spangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: have abandoned the ninth stage of the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ste khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: Their fruit is the fruit of non-return, which is the abandonment of the afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ste /
translated: “Those who have entered the path to manifest the fruit of non-return” are those who have entered the path to manifest the fruit of non-return.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la mthar gyis zhugs pa dang mthong ba'i lam la 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du btang ba dag go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la mthar gyis zhugs pa dang mthong ba'i lam la 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du btang ba dag go //
translated: They are those who enter the path of cultivation gradually and those who are previously detached from the path of seeing.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis de'i 'bras bu thob pa dag go //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis de'i 'bras bu thob pa dag go //
translated: Those who are non-returners are those who have attained that fruit.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: Those who are entering to manifest the fruit of arhatship are those who are entering to manifest the fruit of arhatship.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa nyid do //
translated: Arhatship is the state of being worthy of offerings from all beings.

original: de nyid 'bras bu yin pas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu yin pas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: That itself is the fruit, so it is the fruit of arhatship.

original: khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the complete abandonment of all afflictions to be abandoned by seeing and cultivation in the three realms.

original: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag go //
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dag go //
translated: Those who are entering to manifest that are those who are entering to manifest the fruit of arhatship.

original: ngag dang mthong ba'i mas las langs shing gzugs dang gzugs med pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir lam sgom par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: ngag dang mthong ba'i mas las langs shing gzugs dang gzugs med pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir lam sgom par byed pa dag go //
translated: They are those who rise from the stage of the realm of desire and the stage of the realm of form, and those who rise from the stage of the formless realm, in order to cultivate the path for the sake of being free from attachment to the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: dgra bcom pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis de'i 'bras bu thob pa dag go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag ces bya ba ni gang dag gis de'i 'bras bu thob pa dag go //
translated: Those who are arhats are those who have attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir de ltar de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir de ltar de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the classification of persons, he says, “Thus, those who are of the four pairs of persons,” and so on.

original: skyes bu bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes bu bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four pairs of persons are:

original: zung zhes bya ba ni phrugs te rgyun du zhugs pa dang / de la zhugs pa ni lam gyi rigs mthun pa'i zung gcig go //
analyzed: zung zhes bya ba ni phrugs te rgyun du zhugs pa dang / de la zhugs pa ni lam gyi rigs mthun pa'i zung gcig go //
translated: The pair of the one who has entered the stream and the one who is entering the stream is one pair.

original: lhag ma gsum yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The other three pairs should be understood in the same way.

original: rgyu cher bgrang ba bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu gang zag brgyad yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu cher bgrang ba bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu gang zag brgyad yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the enumeration of the great number of persons, he says, “There are eight types of persons.”

original: gzhan ni zhugs pa yin la gzhan ni 'bras bu la gnas pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir brgyad ces smos te lam tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhugs pa yin la gzhan ni 'bras bu la gnas pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir brgyad ces smos te lam tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word eight is used to show that some are on the path of entry and some are on the path of result, because the paths are different.

original: yon tan 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //🔽ting @49a * //
analyzed: yon tan 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o // ting @49a * //
translated: To show the accomplishment of good qualities, it says that Saṅgha of disciples of the Bhagavān and so on.🔽Having perfect morality means having the morality of training and post-training.

original: nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: Having perfect concentration means having the concentration of training and post-training.

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //🔽rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o // rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having perfect wisdom should be understood in the same way.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i mos pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i mos pa ste /
translated: Having perfect liberation means having the liberation of training and post-training.🔽Having perfect knowledge of the realization of liberation means having the knowledge of liberation of training and post-training.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ni rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ni rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The complete perfection of liberation is the perseverance for the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering of the learner and nonlearner, and that which is concomitant with it and that which possesses it.

original: rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang / mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The complete perfection of the knowledge and vision of liberation is🔽Liberation is the abandonment of the afflictions.🔽The complete perfection of liberation is the complete abandonment of the afflictions.🔽The complete perfection of the knowledge and vision of liberation is

original: rnam par grol ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba na shes pa dang mthong ba skyes pa'am rnam par grol ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba na shes pa dang mthong ba skyes pa'am rnam par grol ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes pa dang mthong ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The complete perfection of the knowledge and vision of liberation is the knowledge and vision that arise when one is liberated or the knowledge and vision concomitant with liberation.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la sogs pa dang / mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la sogs pa dang / mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on, the elimination of contaminants and so forth. Vision is the perseverance for the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so forth and the correct view of the nonlearner and so forth.

original: shes pa dang mthong ba de gnyis dang ldan pa ni rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong ba de gnyis dang ldan pa ni rnam par grol ba'i shes pa dang mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The possession of both this knowledge and this vision is called the perfect knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bsal zhing ngo bo nyid rnam par grol bar smra ba de dag gi lugs la ni slob pa rnam par grol ba med par 'gyur bas dge 'dun thams cad la rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pas khyab par mi 'gyur
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bsal zhing ngo bo nyid rnam par grol bar smra ba de dag gi lugs la ni slob pa rnam par grol ba med par 'gyur bas dge 'dun thams cad la rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pas khyab par mi 'gyur
translated: In the system of those who maintain that the essential nature is liberated by the removal of the stain of the defilements, there would be no learner who is liberated, and the entire Saṅgha would not be pervaded by the perfection of liberation.

original: ba de ni mi rung ngo //🔽kun sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'dod pas chos gos la sogs pa dag gis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba de ni mi rung ngo // kun sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'dod pas chos gos la sogs pa dag gis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is unacceptable.🔽They are worthy of offerings of the world with its gods, because they are worthy of worship with robes, etc. by those who desire the fruit.

original: rab tu sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis de la mchod par bya ba ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu sbyin pa'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i 'bras bu nyid kyis de la mchod par bya ba ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are worthy of the highest offering, because they are worthy of worship that is superior to that.

original: thal mo sbyar ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar bas mchod pa'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar bas mchod pa'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “they are worthy of receiving reverential salutations with one’s palms placed together” means that they are worthy of being worshipped with reverential salutations.

original: phyag bya ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phyag bya ba'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag bya ba'i 'os su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phyag bya ba'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “they are worthy of making obeisance to” means that they are worthy of being bowed down to.

original: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni de bas khyad par 'phags pa'i dge 'dun gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni de bas khyad par 'phags pa'i dge 'dun gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “they are the unsurpassed field of merit” means that there is no other spiritual community that is superior to them.

original: 'jig rten gyi yon gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi yon gyi 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yon gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi yon gyi 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “they are the recipients of offerings from the world” means that they are worthy of receiving offerings from all living beings.

original: chom rkun pa dag ces bya ba ni g-yo sgyu can dag go //
analyzed: chom rkun pa dag ces bya ba ni g-yo sgyu can dag go //
translated: The phrase “thieves and swindlers” means those who are deceitful.

original: bgrod par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni dbang du gyur nas so //🔽@49b sde snod ces bya ba ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa dag la sde snod kyi sgra yod de /
analyzed: bgrod par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni dbang du gyur nas so // @49b sde snod ces bya ba ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang / chos mngon pa dag la sde snod kyi sgra yod de /
translated: The phrase “having gained control over them” means having gained mastery over them.🔽The term “scripture collection” refers to the scriptural collections of the sutras, the discipline, and the clear science.

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir chos smra ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gtam byed nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir chos smra ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gtam byed nus pa'o //
translated: The phrase “they are teachers of the Dharma” means that they are capable of engaging in a discussion of the Dharma.

original: rigs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Possessing the eloquence of reasoning means that he teaches in a manner that is logical.

original: grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni thags thogs med par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni thags thogs med par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Possessing the eloquence of liberation means that he teaches without hesitation.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of the meritorious work means:

original: bsod nams bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba spel ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba spel ba'o //
translated: Meritorious work means the increase of virtue.

original: de'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: The basis of that means the cause.

original: de ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang / sgom pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag go //
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang / sgom pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag go //
translated: That is the three: giving, morality, and meditation.

original: de dag gi bsngags pa brjod cing zhes bya ba ni phan yon bsgrags shing do //
analyzed: de dag gi bsngags pa brjod cing zhes bya ba ni phan yon bsgrags shing do //
translated: Having praised them means having proclaimed their benefits.

original: de dag la bkod nas zhes bya ba ni bzhag nas so //
analyzed: de dag la bkod nas zhes bya ba ni bzhag nas so //
translated: Having established them in those means having placed them in those.

original: rnam par bshad ces bya ba ni rnam par phye ba'o //🔽rin che ba zhes bya ba ni rin thang che ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad ces bya ba ni rnam par phye ba'o // rin che ba zhes bya ba ni rin thang che ba'o //
translated: Having explained them means having analyzed them.🔽Valuable means having great value.

original: che bar 'os pa zhes bya ba ni bkra ba'o //
analyzed: che bar 'os pa zhes bya ba ni bkra ba'o //
translated: Worthy of great value means having great beauty.

original: bar ji srid pa zhes bya ba ni thag ji srid par ro //
analyzed: bar ji srid pa zhes bya ba ni thag ji srid par ro //
translated: As far as the distance means as far as the distance.

original: nad pa'i rkyen dang sman gyi yo byad ces bya ba ni nad pa'i rkyen mkho ba'i yo byad bu ram la sogs pa gang dag yin nga dang / sman gyi zong la sogs pa sman yo byad gang dag yin pa de dag ni nad pa'i rkyen dang sman gyi yo byad dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i rkyen dang sman gyi yo byad ces bya ba ni nad pa'i rkyen mkho ba'i yo byad bu ram la sogs pa gang dag yin nga dang / sman gyi zong la sogs pa sman yo byad gang dag yin pa de dag ni nad pa'i rkyen dang sman gyi yo byad dag ces bya'o //
translated: The conditions and medicines for the sick are the conditions for the sick, the requisites such as molasses, etc., and the medicines such as the requisites for medicine, etc.

original: thugs las chung ngu zhes bya ba ni bsam mi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: thugs las chung ngu zhes bya ba ni bsam mi dgos pa'o //
translated: Little thought is no thought.

original: gnas de lta bu yod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas de lta bu yod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The existence of such a place is

original: 'dir gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'am rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa'am rgyu'o //
translated: Here, place means possibility or cause.🔽One will know the time is

original: dus shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i dus gang yin pa shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dus shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i dus gang yin pa shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One will know the time of need.

original: bzhin bsgyur zhing zhes bya ba ni ngom zum byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin bsgyur zhing zhes bya ba ni ngom zum byed pa'o //
translated: Changing the expression is frowning.

original: yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ni yongs su gtong ba'i rgyu las byung ba dngos kyi dus su byung ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su btang ba las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ni yongs su gtong ba'i rgyu las byung ba dngos kyi dus su byung ba'o //
translated: The merit that arises from giving is the merit that arises from the cause of giving, which occurs at the time of the actual giving.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba sems can la phan pa'i dus su 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: mngon sum du babs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi dge slong gi mngon sum du ltung bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du babs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi dge slong gi mngon sum du ltung bar byas pa'o //
translated: “In one’s presence” means that the other monk has been caused to commit an offense in the presence of the accusing monk.

original: khyu nas dgar ba zhes bya ba ni khyu nas dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: khyu nas dgar ba zhes bya ba ni khyu nas dbyung ba'o //
translated: “Expelled from the community” means that he has been expelled from the community.

original: mig snar snang ba zhes bya @51b ba ni khyu'i yul nas sam rdzi bo'i yul nas snang ba'o //
analyzed: mig snar snang ba zhes bya @51b ba ni khyu'i yul nas sam rdzi bo'i yul nas snang ba'o //
translated: “Seen in the community” means that he has been seen in the community or in the region of the community.

original: grog ma zhes bya ba ni gror sbur dag go //
analyzed: grog ma zhes bya ba ni gror sbur dag go //
translated: “Ants” means termites.

original: til za ba zhes bya ba ni til nyams par byed pa'o //🔽phub ma za bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni zas su phub ma za ba dag go //
analyzed: til za ba zhes bya ba ni til nyams par byed pa'o // phub ma za bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni zas su phub ma za ba dag go //
translated: Eating chaff means to eat chaff as food.

original: rul pa za ba zhes bya ba ni shing rul pa ste shing srin gyi rigs dag go //🔽treem bu ka zhes bya ba ni phra mo'o //
analyzed: rul pa za ba zhes bya ba ni shing rul pa ste shing srin gyi rigs dag go // treem bu ka zhes bya ba ni phra mo'o //
translated: Eating rotten wood means to eat rotten wood, which is a type of worm.🔽Trembling means small.

original: tre'u ta la zhes bya ba ni rags pa'o //🔽gnod byed dag ces bya ba ni chad pas bcad pa'i mi dag go //
analyzed: tre'u ta la zhes bya ba ni rags pa'o // gnod byed dag ces bya ba ni chad pas bcad pa'i mi dag go //
translated: Trembling greatly means large.🔽Harming means people who are punished.

original: chad pas bcad ces bya ba ni chad pa la thug pa dag go //
analyzed: chad pas bcad ces bya ba ni chad pa la thug pa dag go //
translated: Punished means those who are subject to punishment.

original: gsug ces bya ba ni gsang ste gzhal du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: gsug ces bya ba ni gsang ste gzhal du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Secretly means to settle secretly.

original: bum pa so ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa so ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unfired pots means that they are destroyed.

original: nag po zhes bya ba ni gnag pa'o //
analyzed: nag po zhes bya ba ni gnag pa'o //
translated: Black means dark.

original: gnas skabs mnyam par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs mnyam par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba mthun pa'o //
translated: Equal in circumstances means having the same activities.

original: lus chung zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bong chung ba'o //
analyzed: lus chung zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bong chung ba'o //
translated: Small body means a small body.

original: yang na dbang thang chung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang thang chung ba'o //
translated: Or it means having little power.

original: ngan cing zhes bya ba ni rin chung zhing ngo //
analyzed: ngan cing zhes bya ba ni rin chung zhing ngo //
translated: “Bad” means of little value.

original: yongs su rnyings pa zhes bya ba ni dengs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rnyings pa zhes bya ba ni dengs pa'o //
translated: “Old” means worn out.

original: med nas zhes bya ba ni mi 'dug nas so //
analyzed: med nas zhes bya ba ni mi 'dug nas so //
translated: “Without” means not having.

original: drin can zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'i rgyu lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: drin can zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'i rgyu lci ba nyid do //
translated: “Kind” means heavy with the cause of benefit.

original: gzhan nas gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du'o //
analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du'o //
translated: “From one to another” means from higher to higher.

original: mtshungs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni glag pa dang kha ton dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni glag pa dang kha ton dang mthun pa'o //
translated: “Desired as equal” means in accordance with recitation and memorization.

original: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong bas so //
translated: “Beautiful” means pleasing.

original: kha dog gis gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'jam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: kha dog gis gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'jam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Clear in color” means smooth.

original: zlum pa zhes bya ba ni zlum ril lo //
analyzed: zlum pa zhes bya ba ni zlum ril lo //
translated: “Round” means full.

original: longs spyad bzod pa zhes bya ba ni spyad bzod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyad bzod pa zhes bya ba ni spyad bzod pa'o //
translated: “Endurable to use” means durable.

original: dge ba'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni dge ba spel ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni dge ba spel ba'o //
translated: “Side of virtue” means increasing virtue.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: “Practice” means accomplishment.

original: thabs yin no zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs yin no zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
translated: “Means” means acceptance.

original: gla rngan zhes bya ba ni rin no //
analyzed: gla rngan zhes bya ba ni rin no //
translated: “Wages” means price.

original: bsgrubs kyis zhes bya ba ni grub par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrubs kyis zhes bya ba ni grub par byas pa'o //
translated: “Having accomplished” means having made.

original: khyim bdag mgo reg ces bya ba ni dge slong thams cad kyi sbyin pa dag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag mgo reg ces bya ba ni dge slong thams cad kyi sbyin pa dag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: “Householder with a shaven head” means one who is a donor to all monks.

original: 'phral gyi zhes bya ba ni 'phral ngag gi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'phral gyi zhes bya ba ni 'phral ngag gi bya ba'o //
translated: “Immediately” means at that time.

original: thog mar 'gro ba ni grogs bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog mar 'gro ba ni grogs bya ba'o //
translated: “First” means first of all.

original: skabs zhes bya ba ni glags so //
analyzed: skabs zhes bya ba ni glags so //
translated: “Opportunity” means occasion.

original: rnyang rnying dag ces bya ba ni gos dengs pa dag go //
analyzed: rnyang rnying dag ces bya ba ni gos dengs pa dag go //
translated: “Old rags” means old clothes.

original: lcags kyi thu lum zhes bya ba ni lcags bsgongs pa ste /
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lum zhes bya ba ni lcags bsgongs pa ste /
translated: “Iron ball” means a lump of iron.

original: 'ju dka' ba nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ju dka' ba nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to digest, it is like that.

original: skal ba yod ces bya ba ni rung ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba yod ces bya ba ni rung ba'o //
translated: “Suitable” means proper.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ltar na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de ltar na'o //
translated: “In that way” means in that manner.

original: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni nyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni nyes pa'o //
translated: “Flaw” means fault.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma byin pa nyid med pas de'i phyir de sbom por @52a * //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma byin pa nyid med pas de'i phyir de sbom por @52a * //
translated: “A serious offense” means because there is no giving, therefore it is serious.

original: 'gyur ro // shar nas skyes pa zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs nas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // shar nas skyes pa zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs nas skyes pa'o //
translated: “Born in the east” means born in the east.

original: phrag pa la gyon pa zhes bya ba ni thal gong du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: phrag pa la gyon pa zhes bya ba ni thal gong du bzhag pa'o //
translated: “Shouldered” means placed on the shoulder.

original: 'phyang bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni nar bar gyur nas so //
analyzed: 'phyang bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni nar bar gyur nas so //
translated: “Hanging down” means hanging down.

original: chos kyi zhugs zhes bya ba ni dad pa lhag pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi zhugs zhes bya ba ni dad pa lhag pa'o //
translated: “Dharma robe” means robe of the Dharma.

original: mi bsam pas zhes bya ba ni mi lta bas so //
analyzed: mi bsam pas zhes bya ba ni mi lta bas so //
translated: “Not thinking” means not looking.

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni bgegs su 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni bgegs su 'gyur bas so //
translated: “Degeneration” means obstruction.

original: dbyar khang zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang ngo //
analyzed: dbyar khang zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang ngo //
translated: “Monastery” means the nunnery.

original: myur ba myur ba zhes bya ba ni rings pa ste /
analyzed: myur ba myur ba zhes bya ba ni rings pa ste /
translated: “Quickly” means quickly.

original: gus par bsgrims pa'i phyir lan gnyis su bzlas so //
analyzed: gus par bsgrims pa'i phyir lan gnyis su bzlas so //
translated: It is repeated twice because of respect and effort.

original: nad dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni khon dang bcas pa'o //🔽skad kyi nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /🔽skad ces bya ba ni tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir smra ba'o //
analyzed: nad dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni khon dang bcas pa'o // skad kyi nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba la / skad ces bya ba ni tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir smra ba'o //
translated: “With illness” means with a grudge.🔽Regarding the definition of language,🔽“language” means speaking for the purpose of conventional designation.

original: des nges par smra ba ni skad kyi nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des nges par smra ba ni skad kyi nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Definition” means the definite expression of that.

original: yul zhes bya ba ni yul gyi 'khor gyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba ni yul gyi 'khor gyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: A country is a part of a country.

original: ljongs zhes bya ba ni yul 'khor ro //
analyzed: ljongs zhes bya ba ni yul 'khor ro //
translated: A region is a country.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi lam mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi lam mo //
translated: A sign of concentration is a path of meditative absorption.

original: bzang ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bzang ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa med pa'o //
translated: Good is without disturbance.

original: dge skos zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi las la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge skos zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi las la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: The monk in charge of the community is the one who has authority over the community’s work.

original: dge 'dun gyis ci ba der bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i sa gzhir de byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ci ba der bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i sa gzhir de byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The community should do whatever he says, because he is the one who has arisen from that ground.

original: rnam par rgyal bar bya ba las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal bar bya ba las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having conquered the unconquered,

original: 'dir rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i g-yul lam khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i g-yul lam khams gsum pa ste /
translated: Here, the unconquered is the battle with the afflictions or the three realms.

original: de las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having conquered that is the meaning of having conquered the unconquered.

original: bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa'o //
analyzed: bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa'o //
translated: To invite is to invite as a guest.

original: yang dag par stobs pa zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par stobs pa zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pas so //
translated: To serve properly is to serve without deceit.

original: rtog pas stobs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tshul lo //
analyzed: rtog pas stobs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tshul lo //
translated: The power of thought is the way of the world.

original: ba gam pa zhes bya ba ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: ba gam pa zhes bya ba ni brtag pa'o //
translated: The word “only” is an investigation.

original: lto gang ngo zhes bya ba ni phal che bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lto gang ngo zhes bya ba ni phal che bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The word “belly” is a teaching of the majority.

original: lcags kyi se'u dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni lcags las byas pa'i bal po se'u dag 'dra'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi se'u dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni lcags las byas pa'i bal po se'u dag 'dra'o //
translated: The word “iron” is like an iron fruit.

original: nges pa la 'jug par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges pa la 'jug par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not enter into certainty.

original: des pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs par byed pa nges pa ste mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: des pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs par byed pa nges pa ste mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The word “certainty” is the path of insight, which is the cause of the attainment of nirvana, etc.

original: der 'jug pa ni nges pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: der 'jug pa ni nges pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The word “enter” is the entrance into certainty.

original: zag ba zad pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: zag ba zad pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The word “extinction” is the attainment of arhatship.

original: thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word “virtuous” is the beginning, middle, and end.

original: mdor ston par byed pa ni thog ma'o //
analyzed: mdor ston par byed pa ni thog ma'o //
translated: The beginning is the brief teaching.

original: rgyas par @52b 'chad par byed pa ni bar ro //
analyzed: rgyas par @52b 'chad par byed pa ni bar ro //
translated: The middle is the extensive teaching.

original: nges par sbyor ba ni tha mar ro //
analyzed: nges par sbyor ba ni tha mar ro //
translated: The end is the definite application.

original: yang na nyan pa ni thog mar ro //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa ni thog mar ro //
translated: Or, the beginning is the hearing.

original: sems pa ni bar ro //
analyzed: sems pa ni bar ro //
translated: The mind is in the middle.

original: sgom pa ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni tha ma'o //
translated: Cultivation is at the end.

original: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The so-called superknowledges are the uncontaminated knowledges.

original: nges pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are the entry into certainty.

original: rdzogs par byang chub ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid de zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid de zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The so-called perfect enlightenment is the state of an arhat, the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung ba med do //
translated: The so-called nirvana is the absence of future rebirth.

original: 'gyur ba yin na zhes bya ba ni de'i don du 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin na zhes bya ba ni de'i don du 'bras bur 'gyur ba yin pa'o //
translated: If it were to change, it would be the result for that purpose.

original: ston zla tha chungs kyi g-yon can zhes bya ba ni ston zla tha chungs kyi zla ba la lha mo bgrod dka' mchod nas chom rkun byed pa dag go //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs kyi g-yon can zhes bya ba ni ston zla tha chungs kyi zla ba la lha mo bgrod dka' mchod nas chom rkun byed pa dag go //
translated: The rogues of the last autumn month are those who, having worshipped the goddess Durga in the last autumn month, act as thieves.

original: brtsal mi dgos par zhes bya ba ni 'bad mi dgos par ro //
analyzed: brtsal mi dgos par zhes bya ba ni 'bad mi dgos par ro //
translated: Without effort means without exertion.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar gyi 'tsho ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni khye'u dag thar bar bya ba'i phyir rnyed pa mang po 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar gyi 'tsho ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni khye'u dag thar bar bya ba'i phyir rnyed pa mang po 'byung bas so //
translated: The existence of life up to the end of life is the occurrence of much gain in order to liberate the boys.

original: thabs soms shig ces bya ba ni phyir dgug pa'i thabs soms shig pa'o //
analyzed: thabs soms shig ces bya ba ni phyir dgug pa'i thabs soms shig pa'o //
translated: Think of a means means think of a way to bring them back.

original: brtson par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba ni brtsal bar mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtson par mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba ni brtsal bar mdzad du gsol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Please make an effort means please make an effort.

original: ma bsams na zhes bya ba ni ma bltas na'o //
analyzed: ma bsams na zhes bya ba ni ma bltas na'o //
translated: If you do not think means if you do not consider.

original: glags zhes bya ba ni skon no //
analyzed: glags zhes bya ba ni skon no //
translated: An opportunity means a chance.

original: gzhan du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: A change of heart means regret.

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Miraculous power is the result of concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rgyu'o //
translated: The performance of miracles is the cause of miracles.

original: phyir brtul nas zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas so //
analyzed: phyir brtul nas zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas so //
translated: Having withdrawn means having gathered.

original: thar par bya ba zhes bya ba ni btang ba'o //
analyzed: thar par bya ba zhes bya ba ni btang ba'o //
translated: To be liberated means to be released.

original: go bskon te zhes bya ba ni ci las ma rag par bcas te'o //
analyzed: go bskon te zhes bya ba ni ci las ma rag par bcas te'o //
translated: Having put on means having put on what is not suitable.

original: rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan che ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan che ba'o //
translated: Great miraculous power means great qualities.

original: mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa che ba'o //
analyzed: mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa che ba'o //
translated: Great power means great ability.

original: tshe 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di'o //
translated: In this life means in this world.

original: tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba ni tshe pha rol lo //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba ni tshe pha rol lo //
translated: The next life is the future life.

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: This life and the next are both.

original: spyi bo zhes bya ba ni skra med pa'i phyir ram yon tan chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi bo zhes bya ba ni skra med pa'i phyir ram yon tan chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The crown of the head is so called because it is devoid of hair or because it has few good qualities.

original: go bar byas so zhes bya ba ni lan glan pa'o //
analyzed: go bar byas so zhes bya ba ni lan glan pa'o //
translated: He has been informed means he has been given a reply.

original: don nyung du zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms pa ste bya ba nyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nyung du zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms pa ste bya ba nyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One of few wishes is one who lives on alms, because he has few activities.

original: skabs zhes bya ba ni gleng ba'i skabs so //
analyzed: skabs zhes bya ba ni gleng ba'i skabs so //
translated: The occasion is the occasion for discussion.

original: ltung ba sde lnga zhes bya ba ni pham par gyur pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas kyi sde tshan dag go //
analyzed: ltung ba sde lnga zhes bya ba ni pham par gyur pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ltung byed dang / so sor bshags par bya ba dang / nyes byas kyi sde tshan dag go //
translated: The five classes of offenses are the classes of offenses entailing expulsion, serious offenses, offenses entailing suspension, offenses requiring confession, and faults.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni bzhi'o //
translated: The meditative absorptions are the four meditative absorptions.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad de /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad de /
translated: Liberation is the eight liberations.

original: sems rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called liberations because they liberate the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'am @53a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'am @53a * //
translated: The meditative concentrations are the meditative concentrations of emptiness, etc.

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: with applied thought and sustained thought, etc.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste sems snyoms par 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste sems snyoms par 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Attainment” means the nine successive attainments, because they cause the mind to enter into sameness.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni de dag las byung ba'i zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni de dag las byung ba'i zhi ba nyid do //
translated: “Happiness” means the peacefulness that arises from them.

original: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni sbom po 'am nyes byas so //
analyzed: ltung ba zhes bya ba ni sbom po 'am nyes byas so //
translated: “Transgression” means a serious offense or a minor offense.

original: chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i cho ga yongs su mi gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas 'dul ba las gsungs pa'i cho ga yongs su mi gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In accordance with the Dharma” means not abandoning the rite that is taught in the Monastic Law, following the Dharma.

original: slar mdzod cig ces bya ba ni nye bar zhi bar gyis shig ces bya ba ste shogs shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slar mdzod cig ces bya ba ni nye bar zhi bar gyis shig ces bya ba ste shogs shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Make amends” means “pacify,” which means “confess.”

original: ltung ba mthong zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir dang // rdzu 'phrul gyi sems ni ma bsgribs la lung ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis bslang ba ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ltung ba mthong zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir dang // rdzu 'phrul gyi sems ni ma bsgribs la lung ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis bslang ba ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang /
translated: “One does not commit a downfall” means that one does not commit a downfall because the mind of supernormal knowledge is unobscured and neutral, and it is not tenable that what is motivated by a neutral mind is afflicted.

original: phyogs pa'i sems med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs pa'i sems med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One does not commit a downfall” means that one does not commit a downfall because there is no afflicted mind.

original: gnas nas dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun las dgar ba'o //🔽chos kyi sgyu thabs zhes bya ba ni chos ltar bcos pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun las dgar ba'o // chos kyi sgyu thabs zhes bya ba ni chos ltar bcos pa'o //
translated: “One is expelled from the community” means that one is expelled from the community.🔽“Deceptive Dharma” means a counterfeit Dharma.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: “Contradictory” means contradictory to the Dharma.

original: yongs su gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma bcas pa'i chad pa'i las bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gnas pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma bcas pa'i chad pa'i las bya ba'o //
translated: “One is suspended” means that one is given a penalty of suspension.

original: gzhi nas yongs su gnas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su gnas pa gzhi nas bslad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi nas yongs su gnas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su gnas pa gzhi nas bslad pa'o //
translated: “One is suspended from the beginning” means that one is suspended from the beginning.

original: mgu bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun mgu bar bya ba'i phyir chad pa'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: mgu bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun mgu bar bya ba'i phyir chad pa'i las byed pa'o //
translated: “To be pleased” means to perform a penalty transaction in order to please the Saṅgha.

original: gzhi nas mgu bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni de nyid gzhi nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi nas mgu bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni de nyid gzhi nas bslang ba'o //
translated: “To be pleased from the ground up” means to lift that very penalty.

original: 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba'i zug rdu 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba'i zug rdu 'byin pa'o //
translated: “To be expelled” means to remove the thorn of a downfall of a partially concordant defeating offense.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To be omniscient” means to know one’s own characteristics through knowledge.

original: thams cad gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong bas dngos po thams cad kyi bye brag mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong bas dngos po thams cad kyi bye brag mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To be all-seeing” means to know the particulars of all things through seeing.

original: mkhyen pa dang shes bya dag la bla na med pa'i mnga' brnyes pa zhes bya ba la mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa dag la'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang shes bya dag la bla na med pa'i mnga' brnyes pa zhes bya ba la mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa dag la'o //
translated: “To attain mastery over knowledge and objects of knowledge” means that with regard to the objects of knowledge, such as the Dharma,

original: shes bya dag la zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po dag la sogs pa'i yul dag la'o //
analyzed: shes bya dag la zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang ser po dag la sogs pa'i yul dag la'o //
translated: and with regard to the objects of knowledge, such as blue and yellow,

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni zla med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni zla med pa'o //
translated: one attains mastery that is unsurpassed.

original: mnga' brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: mnga' brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase having attained mastery means having attained mastery over meditative concentration.

original: zung shig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: zung shig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should take up means you should understand.

original: bsam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni snying @53b rje ba'i bsam pa dang 'phreg pa med pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni snying @53b rje ba'i bsam pa dang 'phreg pa med pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase with such an attitude means with an attitude of compassion and an attitude of non-violence.

original: dga' ba'i chos can dag ces bya ba ni dga' ba la rag lus pa dag go //
analyzed: dga' ba'i chos can dag ces bya ba ni dga' ba la rag lus pa dag go //
translated: The phrase those who are devoted to the Dharma means those who are devoted to joy.

original: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes su 'brel pa'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the Dharma means in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yang dag par ston par mdzad ces bya ba ni ma go ba go bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par mdzad ces bya ba ni ma go ba go bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase he teaches means he causes understanding of what was not understood.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad ces bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la nges par sbyor bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad ces bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la nges par sbyor bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase he causes them to take it up means he causes them to be definitely engaged in generosity and so on.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad ces bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i yon tan brjod pas dga' bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad ces bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i yon tan brjod pas dga' bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase he causes them to rejoice means he causes them to rejoice by proclaiming their present good qualities.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad ces bya ba ni phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan brjod pas dga' bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad ces bya ba ni phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan brjod pas dga' bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: He gladdened them means that he gladdened them by speaking of the virtues that will arise in the future.

original: rnam grangs du mar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang por ro //🔽ral ba zhes bya ba ni rdib pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang por ro // ral ba zhes bya ba ni rdib pa'o //
translated: In many ways means in many forms.🔽 Shaken means collapsed.

original: 'drums pa zhes bya ba ni gas pa'o //
analyzed: 'drums pa zhes bya ba ni gas pa'o //
translated: Split means cracked.

original: rang nyid kyis byed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kho nas las byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis byed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kho nas las byed pa'o //
translated: It is done by oneself means that the action is done by oneself alone.

original: lhan cig gnas pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma'o //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma'o //
translated: A companion means a disciple.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: Truth means reality.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa'o //
translated: Agreeable means beneficial.

original: ngo zlog phod par smra ba zhes bya ba ni gya gyu med par smra ba'o //
analyzed: ngo zlog phod par smra ba zhes bya ba ni gya gyu med par smra ba'o //
translated: One who speaks what is suitable means one who speaks without deceit.

original: 'khrug long zhes bya ba ni phan phun no //
analyzed: 'khrug long zhes bya ba ni phan phun no //
translated: Quarrel means dispute.

original: ae ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dod pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ae ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dod pa'i don yin no //
translated: Alas! is a word of desire.

original: sdum pa zhes bya ba ni khyim mo //
analyzed: sdum pa zhes bya ba ni khyim mo //
translated: House means home.

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi phyi rol dang 'od ma'i tshal gyi phyi rol gyi bar du zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi phyi rol dang 'od ma'i tshal gyi phyi rol gyi bar du zhes bya ba ni de gnyis kyi bar du'o //
translated: Between the outer court of Rājagṛha and the outer court of the Bamboo Grove means between those two.

original: lha 'bangs zhes bya ba ni las su rung bar byed pas byed ces bya ba'o //🔽dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lha 'bangs zhes bya ba ni las su rung bar byed pas byed ces bya ba'o // dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The god’s servant means the one who makes it workable.🔽The Saṅgha’s pleasure grove means the monastery with its retinue.

original: rtse rgod ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi kun dga'i rab skyong bar byed pas kun dga'i ra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtse rgod ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi kun dga'i rab skyong bar byed pas kun dga'i ra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pleasure grove means the one who protects the Saṅgha’s pleasure grove.

original: klag cor zhes bya ba ni ca co'o //
analyzed: klag cor zhes bya ba ni ca co'o //
translated: The noise means the clamor.

original: nang par sngar zhes bya ba ni dus snga ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nang par sngar zhes bya ba ni dus snga ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the morning early means with the early time.

original: dge slong gi rgyus shes pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang 'dre 'dre ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi rgyus shes pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang 'dre 'dre ba'o //
translated: The monk who knows the facts means the monk who is mixed with the mixed.

original: sgo 'phar zhes bya ba ni sgro drung gi them pa'o //
analyzed: sgo 'phar zhes bya ba ni sgro drung gi them pa'o //
translated: The door panel means the threshold.

original: lan bdun zhes bya ba ni res bdun no //
analyzed: lan bdun zhes bya ba ni res bdun no //
translated: Seven times means seven times.

original: byi dor zhes bya ba ni bcil te sas ma gos par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byi dor zhes bya ba ni bcil te sas ma gos par bya ba'o //
translated: The cleaning means the sweeping without the dust covering the ground.

original: khrus byas shing zhes bya ba ni sngar khrus byas te phyis gos dkar po dang dri dang phrad ba brgyus pas brgyan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khrus byas shing zhes bya ba ni sngar khrus byas te phyis gos dkar po dang dri dang phrad ba brgyus pas brgyan to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Having bathed” means that after bathing, he is later adorned with white clothes, perfume, and garlands.

original: ma bsgo 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dri ba'i tshig yin no //🔽bsnyems pa zhes bya ba ni rlom pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgo 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dri ba'i tshig yin no // bsnyems pa zhes bya ba ni rlom pa'o //
translated: The word “or” is a term of inquiry.🔽“Arrogant” means conceited.

original: sbran te zhes bya ba ni @54a * //
analyzed: sbran te zhes bya ba ni @54a * //
translated: “Having been urged” means having been incited.

original: bskul te'o // dgongs ka za 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo za 'dod pas so //
analyzed: bskul te'o // dgongs ka za 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo za 'dod pas so //
translated: “Desiring to eat in the evening” means desiring to eat at night.

original: nang par za 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni snga dro za 'dod pas so //
analyzed: nang par za 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni snga dro za 'dod pas so //
translated: “Desiring to eat in the morning” means desiring to eat in the forenoon.

original: 'dong bar byed do zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dong bar byed do zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To go” means to proceed.

original: le lo'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus zhen pa'o //
analyzed: le lo'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus zhen pa'o //
translated: “Lazy by nature” means lacking in perseverance.

original: soms shig ces bya ba ni shes par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: soms shig ces bya ba ni shes par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “Think about it” means understand it.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dod pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dod pa'i don yin no //
translated: The word “alas” expresses a desired meaning.

original: legs so zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa'o //
translated: “Good” means beautiful.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir ches mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir ches mdzes pa'o //
translated: “Excellent” means very beautiful because it is not harmful.

original: nyi ma gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gnyis kyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gnyis kyi dgos pa'o //
translated: “Two days” means the need for two days and nights.

original: nyi ma gsum gyi zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gsum gyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum gyi zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gsum gyi dgos pa'o //
translated: “Three days” means the need for three days and nights.

original: nyi ma bdun gyi zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan bdun gyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyi zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan bdun gyi dgos pa'o //
translated: “Seven days” means the need for seven days and nights.

original: bar gyi zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
analyzed: bar gyi zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
translated: “In between” means in the end.

original: gsog 'jog gi yongs su spyod pas zhes bya ba ni sogs shing za bas so //
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi yongs su spyod pas zhes bya ba ni sogs shing za bas so //
translated: “By the use of hoarding and storing” means by gathering and eating.

original: byings dang byings ma yin pa dag na zhes bya ba ni gtos dang gtos ma yin pa dag na'o ;
analyzed: byings dang byings ma yin pa dag na zhes bya ba ni gtos dang gtos ma yin pa dag na'o ;
translated: “In the case of a womb and a non-womb” means in the case of a container and a non-container.

original: / mtshams zhes bya ba ni rdo bsgreng ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bya ba'o //
analyzed: / mtshams zhes bya ba ni rdo bsgreng ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bya ba'o //
translated: “Boundary” means a sign such as a standing stone.

original: mu thug ces bya ba ni 'di ni khyod kyi'o 'di ni nga'i zhes bgo bsha' bya ba'o //
analyzed: mu thug ces bya ba ni 'di ni khyod kyi'o 'di ni nga'i zhes bgo bsha' bya ba'o //
translated: “Agreement” means “This is yours, this is mine.”

original: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni bgo bsha' bya ba'i ngang tshul nyid 'dod pa med pa yin pas 'dir chos su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni bgo bsha' bya ba'i ngang tshul nyid 'dod pa med pa yin pas 'dir chos su shes par bya'o //
translated: “Dharma” here should be understood as the Dharma of sharing, which is the absence of desire.

original: 'dren par byed ces bya ba ni gzhi'i gnas nas skyong par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren par byed ces bya ba ni gzhi'i gnas nas skyong par byed pa'o //
translated: “To lead” means to lead from the place of the basis.

original: khrid par byed ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i gnas su khrid par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khrid par byed ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i gnas su khrid par byed pa'o //
translated: “To guide” means to guide to the place of desire.

original: chad pas gcad par zhes bya ba ni chad pas gcad par 'os pa dag go //
analyzed: chad pas gcad par zhes bya ba ni chad pas gcad par 'os pa dag go //
translated: “To be punished” means those who deserve to be punished.

original: phan gdags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni bsrung bar bya ba dag go //🔽chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ste drug cha zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni bsrung bar bya ba dag go // chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ste drug cha zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “To be benefited” means those who should be protected.🔽“Righteous” means reasonable.

original: thog shas zhes bya ba ni rin nges pa'o //
analyzed: thog shas zhes bya ba ni rin nges pa'o //
translated: “Sixth part” means a definite price.

original: bkur zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: bkur zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: “To honor” means to request.

original: smas pa la skyob par byed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal las yongs su srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: smas pa la skyob par byed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal las yongs su srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To protect those who are injured” means to completely protect from suffering.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni 'dir nges pa ste de'i spyad pa rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni 'dir nges pa ste de'i spyad pa rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Morality is the definite term here, and its practice is the performance of it.

original: des kun tu spyod pa zhes bya ba rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa ni tshul khrims kyi spyod pa rjes su spyod de /
analyzed: des kun tu spyod pa zhes bya ba rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa ni tshul khrims kyi spyod pa rjes su spyod de /
translated: The conventional expression “one who practices it” is one who practices the practice of morality.

original: des chos kyis skye dgu dga' bar byed pas so //
analyzed: des chos kyis skye dgu dga' bar byed pas so //
translated: Because he delights the people with the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du gtong ba'i rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du gtong ba'i rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The practice of wisdom is the performance that is preceded by the intellect.

original: des kun tu spyod pa zhes bya ba rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa ni shes rab kyi @54b spyod pa kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: des kun tu spyod pa zhes bya ba rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa ni shes rab kyi @54b spyod pa kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: The conventional expression “one who practices it” is one who practices the practice of wisdom.

original: des chos kyis skye dgu dga' bar byed pas so //
analyzed: des chos kyis skye dgu dga' bar byed pas so //
translated: Because he delights the people with the Dharma.

original: rgyal rigs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs kyi sde tshan te rgyal rigs kyi rigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs kyi sde tshan te rgyal rigs kyi rigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The circle of the warrior class is the group of the warrior class, which is to say, the family of the warrior class.

original: de yang chos kyis yin gyi zhes bya ba ni skye dgu srung bar byed cing sems can la rjes su snying brtse ba nyid 'dir chos yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos kyis yin gyi zhes bya ba ni skye dgu srung bar byed cing sems can la rjes su snying brtse ba nyid 'dir chos yin no //
translated: “By the Dharma” means by the Dharma of protecting living beings and having compassion for living beings.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byed pa'am yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas so //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byed pa'am yongs su bzung ba'i rdzas so //
translated: “Possessions” means what is made one’s own or what is held as property.

original: nad ces bya ba ni sbubs nang du bltas pa'i rma'o //
analyzed: nad ces bya ba ni sbubs nang du bltas pa'i rma'o //
translated: “Disease” means an internal wound.

original: 'bras zhes bya ba ni sbubs phyir bltas pa'i rma'o //
analyzed: 'bras zhes bya ba ni sbubs phyir bltas pa'i rma'o //
translated: “Blisters” means an external wound.

original: zug rngu zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa glo bur ba'o //
analyzed: zug rngu zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa glo bur ba'o //
translated: “Pain” means a sudden onset.

original: de dag ni nad la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nad la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir smos pa yin no //
translated: These are mentioned because they are like disease, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems ngal ba'i rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems ngal ba'i rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: “The root of suffering” means the cause of physical and mental fatigue.

original: dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni dgon pa'i 'dug gnas so //
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni dgon pa'i 'dug gnas so //
translated: “A place in the wilderness” means a dwelling in the wilderness.

original: spyil po zhes bya ba ni khyim mo //
analyzed: spyil po zhes bya ba ni khyim mo //
translated: “A hut” means a house.

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: “Meditation” means concentration.

original: rab tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dben pa'am 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dben pa'am 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Solitary means either physically and mentally solitary or free from attachment.

original: mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni khong du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni khong du ma chud pa'o //
translated: Not fully realized means not understood.

original: sngags zhes bya ba ni dug sel ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa skyes bu chen po'i tshig go //
analyzed: sngags zhes bya ba ni dug sel ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa skyes bu chen po'i tshig go //
translated: Mantra means the words of a great being that have the effect of removing poison, etc.

original: gzhung zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i go rims bzhin du sdebs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i go rims bzhin du sdebs pa'o //
translated: Text means a composition in accordance with the order of the desired meaning.

original: rig byed ces bya ba ni shes pa bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rig byed ces bya ba ni shes pa bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: Veda means words that teach knowledge.

original: sbyar zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i 'brel pas sbyar ba'o //🔽ci nus zhes bya ba ni ji ltar spro ba'o //
analyzed: sbyar zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i 'brel pas sbyar ba'o // ci nus zhes bya ba ni ji ltar spro ba'o //
translated: Applied means connected with a meaningful relation.🔽As much as possible means according to one's enthusiasm.

original: ci lcogs zhes bya ba ni nor ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: ci lcogs zhes bya ba ni nor ji lta bar ro //
translated: As much as one can manage means according to one's wealth.

original: phyi rol du sems pa zhes bya ba ni mi phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du sems pa zhes bya ba ni mi phyogs pa'o //
translated: Thinking externally means not turning inward.

original: de yang chos kyi yin zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang 'dod pa med pa la sogs pa ni chos yin no ;
analyzed: de yang chos kyi yin zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang 'dod pa med pa la sogs pa ni chos yin no ;
translated: And that is Dharma means that even here, non-desire, etc. are Dharma.

original: / khang khyim so so dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khang khyim so sor mkho ba'o //
analyzed: / khang khyim so so dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khang khyim so sor mkho ba'o //
translated: “Having a separate house” means having a separate house for one’s needs.

original: bzo'i gnas zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang phru ba byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang phru ba byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Arts” means such things as making pots and baskets.

original: las kyi gnas zhes bya ba ni zhing las dang ba lang btsa' ba dang sa phyags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi gnas zhes bya ba ni zhing las dang ba lang btsa' ba dang sa phyags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Work” means such things as farming, raising cattle, and cleaning.

original: de yang chos kyis yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dir brtson 'grus la nos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang chos kyis yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'dir brtson 'grus la nos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “And that too is by means of the Dharma” means that here, “by means of effort” is meant.

original: mngon du smra ba zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal lo zhes mngon du smra ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du smra ba zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal lo zhes mngon du smra ba'o //
translated: “Speaking directly” means speaking directly, such as saying “I pay homage.”

original: phyag bya ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyis 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bya ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyis 'dud pa'o //
translated: “Bowing” means bowing with the body.

original: ldang ba zhes bya ba ni mngon du ldang ba'o //
analyzed: ldang ba zhes bya ba ni mngon du ldang ba'o //
translated: “Rising up” means rising up directly.

original: thal mo sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar ba'i las so //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar ba'i las so //
translated: “Joining the palms” means the action of joining the palms.

original: 'dud pa'i las zhes bya ba ni lus 'dud pa @55a * //
analyzed: 'dud pa'i las zhes bya ba ni lus 'dud pa @55a * //
translated: “The action of bowing” means bowing the body

original: dang mgo bos phyag bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang mgo bos phyag bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and bowing the head, and so on.

original: kha cig na re ska bas 'dir bram ze'i dkyil 'khor dang rje'u rigs kyi dkyil 'khor dang dge sbyong gi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i gtam dang skyon med cing chu bur med pa zhes smos pa ni ba si ta'i bu'i mdo las gsungs pa kha cig🔽gis 'dir btus pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re ska bas 'dir bram ze'i dkyil 'khor dang rje'u rigs kyi dkyil 'khor dang dge sbyong gi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i gtam dang skyon med cing chu bur med pa zhes smos pa ni ba si ta'i bu'i mdo las gsungs pa kha cig gis 'dir btus pa yin te /
translated: Some say:

original: bde bar gshegs pas 'dul ba'i skabs 'dir gsungs pa ma yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas 'dul ba'i skabs 'dir gsungs pa ma yin zhes zer ro //
translated: This was not spoken by the Sugata in this Vinaya context.

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa slob dpon dul ba'i lhas nye bar sbyar ba las pham par 'gyur ba gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so; ;
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa slob dpon dul ba'i lhas nye bar sbyar ba las pham par 'gyur ba gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so; ;
translated: This completes the explanation of the second defeating offense from the Vinaya Verses composed by Master Vinītadeva.

original: // sgra bsgrags par zhes bya ba ni sgra dbyung bar ro //
analyzed: // sgra bsgrags par zhes bya ba ni sgra dbyung bar ro //
translated: To make a loud noise means to make a sound.

original: so sor rtog pa mi mang ba zhes bya ba ni blos rtog pa mi mang ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa mi mang ba zhes bya ba ni blos rtog pa mi mang ba'o //
translated: Not excessive in discernment means not excessive in mental investigation.

original: 'phrod pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrod pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas su mthun pa'o //
translated: Suitable means in accord with the substance.

original: 'dag rdzas zhes bya ba ni lci skam dang thal ba la sogs pa khrus kyi chal lo //
analyzed: 'dag rdzas zhes bya ba ni lci skam dang thal ba la sogs pa khrus kyi chal lo //
translated: “Cleaning materials” are such things as ashes, clay, and so on, which are used for bathing.

original: ha cang zas drags nas zhes bya ba ni ha cang tshim ches so //
analyzed: ha cang zas drags nas zhes bya ba ni ha cang tshim ches so //
translated: “Too much food” means too much satisfaction.

original: yig brgyangs te zhes bya ba ni mi gsal bar ro //
analyzed: yig brgyangs te zhes bya ba ni mi gsal bar ro //
translated: “With a loud voice” means indistinctly.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrod pa'o //
translated: “Unwholesome” means unfitting.

original: yi chad pa'i bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni mi dga' ba'i gdong gis so //
analyzed: yi chad pa'i bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni mi dga' ba'i gdong gis so //
translated: “With a face of despair” means with a face of unhappiness.

original: rnon po zhes bya ba ni mthu che ba'o //
analyzed: rnon po zhes bya ba ni mthu che ba'o //
translated: “Sharp” means powerful.

original: dus la bab po zhes bya ba ni shi ba ste /
analyzed: dus la bab po zhes bya ba ni shi ba ste /
translated: “The time has come” means death.

original: tha ma'i dus la bab pa'i phyir ro //🔽'chi ba'i phyir rtsol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i dus la bab pa'i phyir ro // 'chi ba'i phyir rtsol bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Because it is the time of death.🔽“Striving for death” means engaging in it.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba smos par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba smos par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “This is just what happened” means that he is speaking about death.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dngung gsod pa'i ltung ba'i gzhi nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dngung gsod pa'i ltung ba'i gzhi nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha did not establish a precept against killing because it is not a basis for a downfall.

original: khyim bdag ces bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag ces bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The term “householder” refers to those of the warrior class, etc.

original: khyim khol gyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim khol gyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called householders because they are the masters of their own households.

original: 'di gnyis 'dong na zhes bya ba ni bdag cag gi rjes su dga' ba'i bsam pa yod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'dong na zhes bya ba ni bdag cag gi rjes su dga' ba'i bsam pa yod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “if these two go” means that if they have the intention of delighting in us,

original: yang na 'dab ma la sogs pa 'bul bar 'dod na 'bul du chug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na 'dab ma la sogs pa 'bul bar 'dod na 'bul du chug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or if they wish to offer us leaves, etc., let them offer them.

original: grims pa zhes bya ba ni sgrin pa'o //
analyzed: grims pa zhes bya ba ni sgrin pa'o //
translated: The term “diligent” means “attentive.”

original: le lo med pa zhes bya ba ni le lo can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: le lo med pa zhes bya ba ni le lo can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The term “non-lax” means “not lax.”

original: sgrub phong ba zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub phong ba zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The term “capable” means “powerful.”

original: stobs dang snyems pa dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stobs dang snyems pa dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba la /
