translated: The phrase “they became endowed with strength and self-confidence” means that

original: stobs dang ldan pa ni lus kyi mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa ni lus kyi mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: they became endowed with physical strength.

original: snyems pa dang ldan pa ni rgyags pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: snyems pa dang ldan pa ni rgyags pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is endowed with conceit is one who is endowed with arrogance.

original: yang na stobs kyi rgyu'i @55b rgyags pa dang ldan pa ni stobs dang snyems pa dang ldan par gyur ces pa'o //
analyzed: yang na stobs kyi rgyu'i @55b rgyags pa dang ldan pa ni stobs dang snyems pa dang ldan par gyur ces pa'o //
translated: Or, endowed with strength and conceit means endowed with the cause of strength and arrogance.

original: ri dags shor du zhes bya ba ni ri dags gsong du'o //
analyzed: ri dags shor du zhes bya ba ni ri dags gsong du'o //
translated: As for deer-hunting, it means hunting deer.

original: las med pa'i ngang tshul can rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag la zhing la sogs pa'i las kyi ngang tshul med pa ste las mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las med pa'i ngang tshul can rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag la zhing la sogs pa'i las kyi ngang tshul med pa ste las mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for those of no occupation, they are those who have no occupation such as farming, meaning they do not work.

original: pha'i las rjes su sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni rjes su skyongs shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha'i las rjes su sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni rjes su skyongs shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: As for follow your father's occupation, it means support it.🔽As for our heads are bound with golden garlands, it means we are not like that because of following shameful occupations.

original: bdag cag gnyis mgo la gser gyi phreng bas bcings pa ni ngo tsha'i las rjes su bsgrubs pas ni de lta ma lags kyis zhes bya ba ni la la zhig gis rgyu 'ga' zhig gi phyir bdag cag gnyis kyi mgo la gser gyi phreng bas bcings par gyur
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis mgo la gser gyi phreng bas bcings pa ni ngo tsha'i las rjes su bsgrubs pas ni de lta ma lags kyis zhes bya ba ni la la zhig gis rgyu 'ga' zhig gi phyir bdag cag gnyis kyi mgo la gser gyi phreng bas bcings par gyur
translated: As for someone bound our heads with golden garlands for some reason, it means we are not like that because of following shameful occupations.

original: pa ni bdag cag gnyis ngo tsha bar gyur yang srid kyis bdag cag gnyis pha'i las rjes su bsgrubs pas ni ngo tsha bar mi 'gyur gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de'i tshig tshig ma yin par byas te zhes bya ba ni ma bgrangs pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni bdag cag gnyis ngo tsha bar gyur yang srid kyis bdag cag gnyis pha'i las rjes su bsgrubs pas ni ngo tsha bar mi 'gyur gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i tshig tshig ma yin par byas te zhes bya ba ni ma bgrangs pa ste /
translated: “We two are ashamed of each other, but we are not ashamed of following our father’s occupation.”🔽“He made his words invalid” means he did not count them.

original: don med par byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don med par byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “He made them meaningless” means he did not do what they said.

original: yul gzhan du song na zhes bya ba ni dus nye bar ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan du song na zhes bya ba ni dus nye bar ro //
translated: “He went to another country” means he went to a place nearby.

original: lo legs shing zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi bde ba ni lo legs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //🔽dar gyis chod pa tsam zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i lhag ma 'di lo nas chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo legs shing zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi bde ba ni lo legs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro // dar gyis chod pa tsam zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i lhag ma 'di lo nas chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The harvest was good” means that the happiness of heaven is similar to a good harvest.🔽“He was separated from his relatives by a mere cloth” means that he was separated from his relatives by a mere birth.

original: yol bas bsgribs pa tsam zhes bya ba ni skye ba nyung shas shig gis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yol bas bsgribs pa tsam zhes bya ba ni skye ba nyung shas shig gis bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He was separated from his relatives by a mere curtain” means that he was separated from his relatives by a mere little birth.

original: lus zhig na zhes bya ba ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: lus zhig na zhes bya ba ni shi ba'o //
translated: “His body was destroyed” means he died.

original: gsod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: “One who kills” means one who takes life.

original: drag shul can zhes bya ba ni snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: drag shul can zhes bya ba ni snying rje med pa'o //
translated: “One who is cruel” means one who is merciless.

original: lag pa dmar ba zhes bya ba ni khrag gis gos pa'i lag pa can no //
analyzed: lag pa dmar ba zhes bya ba ni khrag gis gos pa'i lag pa can no //
translated: “One whose hands are red” means one whose hands are stained with blood.

original: bsnun pa dang rab tu bsnun pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsnun pa dang rab tu bsnun pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One who is engaged in striking and wounding” means

original: bsnun pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: bsnun pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'o //
translated: “striking” means harming.

original: rab tu bsnun pa zhes bya ba ni gsod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsnun pa zhes bya ba ni gsod pa'o //
translated: “Wounding” means killing.

original: de la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dam du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dam du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: “Engaged” means holding on to.

original: 'dis ni yid kyi 'dod pa nyid bstan to //🔽gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis gsod pa'o //🔽gzhan gyis srog gcod du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bskos pas srog gcod du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni yid kyi 'dod pa nyid bstan to // gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis gsod pa'o // gzhan gyis srog gcod du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bskos pas srog gcod du 'jug pa'o //
translated: This shows the mental desire.🔽“One who robs others of their life” means one who kills himself.🔽“One who causes others to kill” means one who kills by appointment.

original: gzhan gyi srog gcod pas 'tsho bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pas rjes su bsgrub par bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog gcod pas 'tsho bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pas rjes su bsgrub par bstan to //
translated: “One who makes a living by killing others” means one who is dedicated to killing.

original: 'du 'dzi'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsten pa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i rigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsten pa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: The “kind of distraction” is the training in reliance.

original: grog sbur phra mo zhes bya ba ni grog sbur chung ngu'o //🔽bdag la rtsom par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag @56a * //
analyzed: grog sbur phra mo zhes bya ba ni grog sbur chung ngu'o // bdag la rtsom par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag @56a * //
translated: “Ants” are small ants.

original: gis bdag gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gis bdag gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: “I will kill myself” means that I will kill myself.

original: bgros par gyur ces bya ba ni bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bgros par gyur ces bya ba ni bsams pa'o //
translated: “Having discussed” means having thought.

original: mtshon thogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon lus la 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon thogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon lus la 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: “Taking up a weapon” means taking up a weapon to strike the body.

original: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa'o //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni blun pa'o //
translated: “Unwise” means foolish.

original: bsgo ste zhes bya ba ni go bar byas te'o //
analyzed: bsgo ste zhes bya ba ni go bar byas te'o //
translated: “Having spoken” means having made understood.

original: btsa' zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi dri mas zos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: btsa' zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi dri mas zos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Having been eaten by rust” means having been eaten by the stain of iron.

original: rdza'o zhes bya ba ni rdza ma'o //
analyzed: rdza'o zhes bya ba ni rdza ma'o //
translated: “Pot” means a clay pot.

original: til gyi tshigs ma'o zhes bya ba ni til mar btsir ba'i tshigs ma'o //
analyzed: til gyi tshigs ma'o zhes bya ba ni til mar btsir ba'i tshigs ma'o //
translated: “Sesame chaff” means the chaff of sesame oil.

original: 'grub par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni don 'grub bam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni don 'grub bam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Will it be accomplished?” means “Will the purpose be accomplished?”

original: nad kyis btab cing zhes bya ba ni nad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nad kyis btab cing zhes bya ba ni nad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Having been afflicted by disease” means having been afflicted by disease.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal nyid kyis nyam thag pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal nyid kyis nyam thag pa'o //
translated: “Suffering” is the distress due to suffering itself.

original: tshabs che bas zhes bya ba ni te por na bas te shi la thug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshabs che bas zhes bya ba ni te por na bas te shi la thug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Greatly” means “at first,” that is, when it is life-threatening.

original: rnyings pa zhes bya ba ni dengs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyings pa zhes bya ba ni dengs pa'o //
translated: “Old age” means “decay.”

original: rdol bar gyur ces bya ba ni bu gu byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdol bar gyur ces bya ba ni bu gu byung ba'o //
translated: “Ruptured” means “having holes.”

original: pags pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi pags pa'o //
analyzed: pags pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi pags pa'o //
translated: “Skin” means the skin of the body.

original: shing dag byas nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shi ba'i las dag byas nas so //
analyzed: shing dag byas nas zhes bya ba ni dad pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shi ba'i las dag byas nas so //
translated: “Having made a funeral pyre” means having performed the funeral rites that arise from faith, and so on.

original: khyim dbub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bag ma blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim dbub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bag ma blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: “The house should be built” means the marriage should be arranged.

original: dus kyi chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus kyi chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: “He will be subject to the law of time” means the following.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i mtha'i dus te 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i mtha'i dus te 'chi ba'o //
translated: “Time” is the end of life, that is, death.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid de dus kyi chos 'chi ba dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid de dus kyi chos 'chi ba dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Law” means nature. The meaning is that he will be subject to the law of time, that is, death.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni sems brtan pa ste re ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni sems brtan pa ste re ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Firm” means firm in mind, with hope.

original: sbungs zhes bya ba ni lus mi zhan pa'o //
analyzed: sbungs zhes bya ba ni lus mi zhan pa'o //
translated: “Courage” means not weak in body.

original: spro ba chen po zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa chen po ste /
analyzed: spro ba chen po zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa chen po ste /
translated: “Great enthusiasm” means great undertaking.

original: las brtsams pa rnams nyams par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: las brtsams pa rnams nyams par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is not letting go of what one has begun.

original: dus dang mthun pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la dus snga ma dang rjes su 'brel pa'i dus phyi ma yod pa de ni dus dang mthun pa'i rjes su zhes bya ba ste bya ba'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: dus dang mthun pa'i dus su zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la dus snga ma dang rjes su 'brel pa'i dus phyi ma yod pa de ni dus dang mthun pa'i rjes su zhes bya ba ste bya ba'i bye brag yin no //
translated: “In accordance with the occasion” means that when an action has a prior occasion and a subsequent occasion, it is “in accordance with the occasion.”

original: chos nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad pa'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis na zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad pa'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis na'o //
translated: “By nature” means by the nature of all things at all times.

original: mtshan ma ston par byed ces bya ba ni gleng bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ston par byed ces bya ba ni gleng bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Gives signs” means speaks.

original: dbang po rnams phyir blan te zhes bya ba ni mig phyir bsdus te'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams phyir blan te zhes bya ba ni mig phyir bsdus te'o //
translated: “Withdraws the senses” means withdraws the eyes.

original: ma bslabs par mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi bya ba ma yin pa'i las dag la rang nyid kyis mkhas pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma bslabs par mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi bya ba ma yin pa'i las dag la rang nyid kyis mkhas pa yin pa'o //
translated: A skilled unlearner is one who is skilled in activities that are not the work of women.

original: khri zhig pa zhes bya ba ni thags ma rnyongs pa'i khri'o //🔽nang mi dag @56b ces bya ba ni khyim gyi mi dag go //
analyzed: khri zhig pa zhes bya ba ni thags ma rnyongs pa'i khri'o // nang mi dag @56b ces bya ba ni khyim gyi mi dag go //
translated: A broken bed is one that is not well woven.🔽The family is the household.

original: rigs gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni pha'i rigs dang gyos po'i rigs la'o //
analyzed: rigs gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni pha'i rigs dang gyos po'i rigs la'o //
translated: Both families means the family of the father and the family of the mother-in-law.

original: mi snyan pa 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gzhan dag la 'gro bar bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mi snyan pa 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni skyes pa gzhan dag la 'gro bar bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: To make them unhappy means to think, I will go to other men.

original: dus la bab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus la bab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To say, The time has come means to say, I will do that.

original: g-yen spyo ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: g-yen spyo ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: To scold means to quarrel.

original: byis pa nas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa tshun chad nas gsos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byis pa nas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni byis pa tshun chad nas gsos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To raise from childhood means to have raised from childhood; that is the meaning.

original: dang du blangs pas khas blangs so zhes bya ba ni mi spang pas khas blangs pa yin gyi tshig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang du blangs pas khas blangs so zhes bya ba ni mi spang pas khas blangs pa yin gyi tshig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By accepting it, one accepts it means that one accepts it by not abandoning it, but not by verbal expression.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i mtshan ma dag ces bya ba ni sbrum ma'i rtags dag ste /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i mtshan ma dag ces bya ba ni sbrum ma'i rtags dag ste /
translated: The signs of pregnancy are the signs of a pregnant woman.

original: nu ma sngo ba la sogs pa'o //🔽na zla dag ces bya ba ni na mnyam pa'i grogs po dag go //
analyzed: nu ma sngo ba la sogs pa'o // na zla dag ces bya ba ni na mnyam pa'i grogs po dag go //
translated: They are the swelling of the breasts, and so on.🔽The friends are those who are in the same condition.

original: grogs mo zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes mo'o //
analyzed: grogs mo zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes mo'o //
translated: The female friends are the female relatives.

original: sems can dang ldan par gyur zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang ldan par gyur zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: One becomes endowed with a being means that one becomes endowed with a fetus.

original: sprin bzhin du zhes bya ba ni char pa 'dod pa rnams de 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin bzhin du zhes bya ba ni char pa 'dod pa rnams de 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like a cloud means that it is like a cloud for those who desire rain, because they desire it.

original: tha chad ces bya ba ni ches lhag par smad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha chad ces bya ba ni ches lhag par smad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The worst means the most contemptible, that is the meaning.

original: longs spyod dag ni 'gyur ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni nor dag g-yo ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dag ni 'gyur ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni nor dag g-yo ba yin pa'o //
translated: Wealth is changeable means that wealth is unstable.

original: lam lam por byas zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas pa'o //🔽dum bu dum bur zhes bya ba ni dum bu dum bu ste bya ba'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: lam lam por byas zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas pa'o // dum bu dum bur zhes bya ba ni dum bu dum bu ste bya ba'i bye brag yin no //
translated: “Having made the path clear” means having made it evident.🔽“In pieces” means in parts.

original: grags zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
analyzed: grags zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'o //
translated: “Having become known” means having become widespread.

original: spyod lam spyad ces bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba bcad pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam spyad ces bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba bcad pa'o //
translated: “Having gone about” means having gone and come.

original: mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni mi dga' 'am zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni mi dga' 'am zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Unpleasant” means disagreeable.

original: rkun ma dag ces bya ba ni chom rkun pa dag go //
analyzed: rkun ma dag ces bya ba ni chom rkun pa dag go //
translated: “Robbers” means thieves.

original: bkag bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bkag bzhin du zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog bzhin du'o //
translated: “Having been stopped” means having been turned back.

original: mdza' bshes dang dgra bo dang bar ma zhes bya ba ni skye bo de nyid lan 'ga' mdza' bshes su 'gyur lan 'ga' dgra por 'gyur lan 'ga' tha mal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang dgra bo dang bar ma zhes bya ba ni skye bo de nyid lan 'ga' mdza' bshes su 'gyur lan 'ga' dgra por 'gyur lan 'ga' tha mal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Friends, enemies, and neutrals” means that very person is sometimes a friend, sometimes an enemy, and sometimes neutral.

original: snga dro rma ba bris te zhes bya ba ni sprin yig gi nang du'o //
analyzed: snga dro rma ba bris te zhes bya ba ni sprin yig gi nang du'o //
translated: “Having written a letter in the morning” means having written it on a cloud.

original: bag tshabs yid mi bde zhing zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa'i bag tshabs yid mi bde zhing ngo //
analyzed: bag tshabs yid mi bde zhing zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa'i bag tshabs yid mi bde zhing ngo //
translated: The phrase anxiety and mental distress refers to anxiety and mental distress that are forms of fear.

original: thos pa brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni mi dag las gtam gcig nas gcig tu thos pas so //
analyzed: thos pa brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni mi dag las gtam gcig nas gcig tu thos pas so //
translated: The phrase through a succession of reports refers to reports that are passed from one person to another.

original: gdams ngag ces bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi lung ngo //
analyzed: gdams ngag ces bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi lung ngo //
translated: The phrase instruction refers to the scriptural teachings of meditative absorption.

original: bsil ba'i tshal gyi dur khrod ces bya ba ni sngon sa phyogs de mchog tu bsil bas @57a * //
analyzed: bsil ba'i tshal gyi dur khrod ces bya ba ni sngon sa phyogs de mchog tu bsil bas @57a * //
translated: The phrase the Śītavana charnel ground means that in the past this place was extremely cool.

original: grong khyer ba rnams kyis der tshal chen po bskyed pas bsil tshal zhes bya ba'o //🔽phyis der gnod sbyin chen po zhig glo bur du 'ongs te /
analyzed: grong khyer ba rnams kyis der tshal chen po bskyed pas bsil tshal zhes bya ba'o // phyis der gnod sbyin chen po zhig glo bur du 'ongs te /
translated: Because the people of the city planted a large grove there, it was called the cool grove.

original: de na gnas pas smras pa /
analyzed: de na gnas pas smras pa /
translated: Later, a great yakṣa suddenly appeared there and said, From now on, I will eat all humans who live in the cool grove.

original: da phyin chad mi su dag bsil tshal na gnas pa thams cad bza' ba'o zhes zer nas grong khyer ba rnams kyis tshal de bor te dur khrod du gyur pas bsil ba'i tshal gyi dur khrod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: da phyin chad mi su dag bsil tshal na gnas pa thams cad bza' ba'o zhes zer nas grong khyer ba rnams kyis tshal de bor te dur khrod du gyur pas bsil ba'i tshal gyi dur khrod ces bya ba'o //
translated: The people of the city abandoned that grove and it became a charnel ground. Therefore, it was called the Śītavana charnel ground.

original: brtson pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis mngon par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis mngon par brtson pa'o //
translated: “Exertion” is the mental application.

original: 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni lung nod pa dang 'dzin pa dang / the tshom sel ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni lung nod pa dang 'dzin pa dang / the tshom sel ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: “Effort” is the activity of recitation, retention, and the removal of doubts, etc.

original: brtsal bas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du sgrub cing bsgom pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtsal bas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du sgrub cing bsgom pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “By striving” means by accomplishing and cultivating it in that way.

original: chen por gyur to zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bong tshod do //
analyzed: chen por gyur to zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bong tshod do //
translated: “It became great” means that it became large in size.

original: mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas zhes bya ba ni tha snyad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: “The wise” means those who are skilled in conventional expressions.

original: rnam par gnon pa las zhes bya ba ni lus kyi stobs las so //
analyzed: rnam par gnon pa las zhes bya ba ni lus kyi stobs las so //
translated: “By the power of his will” means by the power of his body.

original: na le sham dkar po 'byung ba dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i gnas logs shig na mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: na le sham dkar po 'byung ba dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i gnas logs shig na mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: “Like the appearance of white mustard seed” means that it is not perceived as being in a different place from it, because it is adventitious.

original: sems dag gso bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems dag gso bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: “It heals the mind” means that it makes it powerful.

original: sgo glegs drud pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs bcad pa dang dbye ba'i mtha' 'og gzhi dang 'drud pa'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: sgo glegs drud pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs bcad pa dang dbye ba'i mtha' 'og gzhi dang 'drud pa'i gnas su'o //
translated: Under the doorsill means in the place where the doorsill is cut and the door is opened, and where the lower ground is dragged.

original: ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug ces bya ba ni don chung ba'i phyir thams cad la sems par mi byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug ces bya ba ni don chung ba'i phyir thams cad la sems par mi byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Knowledge and seeing do not operate without reflection means that one does not reflect on everything because the meaning is small.

original: dug shin tu rno ba zhes bya ba ni khro ba ni zhe sdang gi dri ma yin pa'i phyir dug kyang khro ba la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug shin tu rno ba zhes bya ba ni khro ba ni zhe sdang gi dri ma yin pa'i phyir dug kyang khro ba la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Very sharp poison means that poison also increases anger, etc., because anger is the stain of hatred.

original: lus shin tu phra bas zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang zhe sdang gnyis kyis lus gnon pa'i phyir de gnyis skyes pas lus bri ba'o //
analyzed: lus shin tu phra bas zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang zhe sdang gnyis kyis lus gnon pa'i phyir de gnyis skyes pas lus bri ba'o //
translated: Very subtle body means that the body decreases due to the arising of both anger and hatred because they oppress the body.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Rebirth means birth.

original: spang leb kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni steng rim dang spang leb kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: spang leb kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni steng rim dang spang leb kyi bar du'o //
translated: Up to the roof and the floor means up to the upper story and the floor.

original: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni grogs med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni grogs med pa'o //
translated: Alone means without a companion.

original: dben par song ste zhes bya ba ni khyim stong pa na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dben par song ste zhes bya ba ni khyim stong pa na gnas pa'o //
translated: “Having gone to a secluded place” means staying in an empty house.

original: 'bar ba rno ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba gdung ba rno ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba rno ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba gdung ba rno ba'o //
translated: “Blazing and sharp” means hot and intense.

original: dug drag po zhes bya ba ni phyir dbyung dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dug drag po zhes bya ba ni phyir dbyung dka' ba'o //
translated: “Strong poison” means difficult to expel.

original: phra ba zhes bya ba ni bong chung ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba zhes bya ba ni bong chung ba'o //
translated: “Subtle” means small.

original: thon kor nas zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi nas so //
analyzed: thon kor nas zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi nas so //
translated: “From the four directions” means from the four cardinal directions.

original: nyin mo gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mo dge ba'i phyogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mo gnas pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mo dge ba'i phyogs byed pa'o //
translated: “Dwelling during the day” means doing virtuous activities during the day.

original: bzhin gzhan du gyur @57b pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: bzhin gzhan du gyur @57b pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs gnyis kyis so //
translated: “With a different face” means with a different color and shape.

original: dbang po rnams sna tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa dang zhum pa dang brtad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams sna tshogs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa dang zhum pa dang brtad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The faculties becoming various” means ceasing, slackening, and agitating, etc.

original: mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni dbang po dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: mig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni dbang po dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: The mention of “eyes” and so on shows freedom from attachment to the faculties.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni yul rnams las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni yul rnams las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: The mention of “forms” and so on shows freedom from attachment to the objects.

original: sa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni zin pa'i lus kyi dngos gzhi dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: sa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni zin pa'i lus kyi dngos gzhi dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: The statement “the earth element, etc.” indicates freedom from attachment to the basic material of the appropriated body.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa smos pa ni 'khor ba thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa smos pa ni 'khor ba thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar bstan to //
translated: The statement “the form heap, etc.” indicates freedom from attachment to all of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar na gang la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sems rnam par 'gyur ba skye ba la ni bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba dang dbang po rnams sna tshogs su 'gyur ba yod kyis gang la de lta bu'i sems skye ba med pa la
analyzed: de ltar na gang la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sems rnam par 'gyur ba skye ba la ni bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba dang dbang po rnams sna tshogs su 'gyur ba yod kyis gang la de lta bu'i sems skye ba med pa la
translated: Thus, the transformation of the mind that is preceded by the apprehension of “I” and “mine” is the basis for the occurrence of the changes in facial expression and the various changes in the sense faculties.

original: ni bzhin la sogs par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ni bzhin la sogs par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement “there is no change in facial expression, etc.” means that there is no change in facial expression, etc.

original: yun ring po nas zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring po nas so //🔽bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas zhes bya ba ni dus yun ring po nas so // bdag tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba'o //
translated: For a long time means for a long period of time.🔽The apprehension of “I” is the view of self.

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir lta ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir lta ba'o //
translated: The apprehension of “mine” is the view of what belongs to a self.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The so-called pride of “I am” is the pride that is the cause of grasping the self.

original: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The so-called clinging is the grasping of the inferior as supreme.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with the grasping of views as supreme.

original: bag la nyal ba zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag nyid bag la nyal ba yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal ba zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag nyid bag la nyal ba yin no //
translated: The so-called latent tendencies are the very afflictions of grasping the self, grasping “mine,” the pride of “I am,” and clinging.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus de'i tshe tshegs su bcad pa smras pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus byis pa'i skye bo dag dgra bcom pas dug tsam bzlog par mi nus sam snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshigs
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus de'i tshe tshegs su bcad pa smras pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus byis pa'i skye bo dag dgra bcom pas dug tsam bzlog par mi nus sam snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshigs
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra spoke these verses at that time. This means that at that time, the noble Śāriputra spoke these verses in order to dispel the doubt that childish beings might have, thinking, “Can an arhat not even ward off poison?”

original: su bcad pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: su bcad pa smras pa yin no //
translated: The so-called verses are spoken by Śāriputra.

original: tshangs spyod ces bya ba ni 'dir tshul khrims la bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs spyod ces bya ba ni 'dir tshul khrims la bya'o //
translated: Purity here means morality.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: Path means the noble path.

original: legs par bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: Well-cultivated means realizing the state of no-more-training.

original: dus snod spang ba zhes bya ba ni bor bar ro //
analyzed: dus snod spang ba zhes bya ba ni bor bar ro //
translated: Giving up the vessel of time means discarding it.

original: 'bar ba'i khyim nas thar pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i khyim nas thar pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like escaping from a burning house -

original: ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe'i tshig yin no //
translated: the word like is a term for an example.

original: 'chi ba'i mthar zhes bya ba ni 'chir nye ba @58a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mthar zhes bya ba ni 'chir nye ba @58a * //
translated: At the end of death means when death is imminent.

original: na'o // rtsva dang shing 'dra bar mthong bar 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir rtsva dang shing dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: na'o // rtsva dang shing 'dra bar mthong bar 'gyur bar zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rgyu nyid med pa'i phyir rtsva dang shing dang 'dra'o //
translated: Will be seen as similar to grass and trees means they are like grass and trees because of selflessness and the absence of causes for desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: nying mtshams sbyor med ces bya ba ni yang 'byung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor med ces bya ba ni yang 'byung ba med pa ste /
translated: No rebirth means no further occurrence.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with complete nirvana.

original: des na 'dod pa med pa'i phyir dang gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba med par zad kyi dgra bcom pas dug tsam rnam par sbyong bar mi nus pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: des na 'dod pa med pa'i phyir dang gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba med par zad kyi dgra bcom pas dug tsam rnam par sbyong bar mi nus pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of desire and the absence of abiding, they are exhausted without effort. But it is not that the Arhats are unable to eliminate even a little poison.

original: lus kyi mchod pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bsnyen bkur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi mchod pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bsnyen bkur ro //
translated: The phrase “physical worship” means physical service.

original: snang bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur na'o //
analyzed: snang bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur na'o //
translated: The phrase “when they appear” means when they manifest.

original: tshugs par mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni 'jug par mi 'gyur zhing ngo //
analyzed: tshugs par mi 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni 'jug par mi 'gyur zhing ngo //
translated: The phrase “they will not be able to overcome” means they will not be able to engage.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang gsang sngags kyi tshig rnams ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa dang gsang sngags thogs pa med pa mthu dang
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang gsang sngags kyi tshig rnams ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa dang gsang sngags thogs pa med pa mthu dang
translated: The phrase “then the Lord Buddha spoke these verses” refers to the verses and secret mantra words that were spoken by the teacher, the Lord Buddha. The verses and secret mantra words are unimpeded, powerful, and

original: ldan pa 'di bstan pa dang myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las mngon du ma gyur ba'i ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa 'di bstan pa dang myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las mngon du ma gyur ba'i ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: This is stated for the sake of future beings who are not presently engaged in the karma that is certain to be experienced and to manifest.

original: yul 'khor srung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni klu yin no //
analyzed: yul 'khor srung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni klu yin no //
translated: The nāgas are called Dhṛtarāṣṭra and so on.

original: byams zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes dag la kun du spyod par byed pa byams pa ste kho na med pa yin no //
analyzed: byams zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes dag la kun du spyod par byed pa byams pa ste kho na med pa yin no //
translated: Love is the activity of friends, which is nonaversion.

original: 'gul zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'gul zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: Motion is movement.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ste snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ste snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Stability is firmness, such as meditative equipoise.

original: sems can kun zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams te snying stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can kun zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi rnams te snying stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All sentient beings are gods and humans, because they possess courage.

original: srog chags kun zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro rnams te srog tsam dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags kun zhes bya ba ni dud 'gro rnams te srog tsam dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All living beings are animals, because they possess mere life.

original: 'byung po kun zhes bya ba ni 'dre la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung po kun zhes bya ba ni 'dre la sogs pa ste /
translated: All spirits are ghosts and so on.

original: phal cher 'byung po'i don du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher 'byung po'i don du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the teaching is mostly for the sake of spirits.

original: ma 'dres shog ces bya ba ni skyon med par shog shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma 'dres shog ces bya ba ni skyon med par shog shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May they be free from confusion means may they be free from faults.

original: nad ni med gyur cig ces bya ba ni nad med par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nad ni med gyur cig ces bya ba ni nad med par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May they be free from illness means may they be free from disease.

original: bzang po mthong gyur cing zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i dngos po thob par gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzang po mthong gyur cing zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i dngos po thob par gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May they see what is good means may they obtain desirable things.

original: sdig par ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni mi dge ba 'phel bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdig par ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni mi dge ba 'phel bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May they not do evil means may they not increase nonvirtue.

original: sbrul gyis gad ba'i zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyis chal bar @58b gang ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul gyis gad ba'i zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyis chal bar @58b gang ba'o //
translated: May they not be bitten by snakes means may they not be bitten by poisonous snakes.

original: bya skyibs su zhes bya ba ni ngam grog gi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: bya skyibs su zhes bya ba ni ngam grog gi phyogs su'o //
translated: In a sheltered place means in a place free from ravines.

original: bdag gi srog la gnod par 'byur zhes bya ba ni de lta bur rtag tu gnas par gyur du zin kyang bdag gi srog la gnod par byed par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi srog la gnod par 'byur zhes bya ba ni de lta bur rtag tu gnas par gyur du zin kyang bdag gi srog la gnod par byed par ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: May they not be harmed by injury to their lives means may they not be harmed by injury to their lives even if they always live in that way.

original: bdag gi bden tshig gang gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag gi bden pa'i tshig ma nor ba gang gis ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten thams cad na bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi bden tshig gang gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag gi bden pa'i tshig ma nor ba gang gis ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten thams cad na bla na med pa yin te /
translated: By whatever unerring true words of mine, the Teacher, the Blessed Buddha, is unsurpassed in all the world,

original: gzhan du ma yin pa'i bdag gi bden tshig ma nor ba des bdag gi lus la dug ma 'jug cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pa'i bdag gi bden tshig ma nor ba des bdag gi lus la dug ma 'jug cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: by that unerring true word of mine, which is not otherwise, let poison not enter my body.

original: sangs rgyas bden pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ma nor ba nyid kyis te chos dang dge 'dun la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bden pas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ma nor ba nyid kyis te chos dang dge 'dun la yang de bzhin no //
translated: By the truth of the Buddha means by the unerring nature of the Buddha, and the same applies to the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: bsrung bas yongs su gzung ba byas zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi bsrung bas yongs su bskyad bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung bas yongs su gzung ba byas zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi bsrung bas yongs su bskyad bar byas pa'o //
translated: Having made protection, means having been sustained by the protection of the awareness spell.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dug bcom pas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dug dang bza' ba la sogs pa'i dug pham par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dug bcom pas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dug dang bza' ba la sogs pa'i dug pham par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all Buddhas have conquered poison means that they have conquered the poisons of desire and so on, and the poisons of food and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dug gi las la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dug gi las la'o //
translated: In that, means in the work of poison.

original: sngon ma thos pas zhes bya ba ni sngon chad ma thos pas so //
analyzed: sngon ma thos pas zhes bya ba ni sngon chad ma thos pas so //
translated: Because they have not heard it before means because they have not heard it previously.

original: mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsngags pa'o //
translated: Rejoicing means praising it.

original: rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin no zhes khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin no zhes khas blangs pa'o //
translated: Applauding means accepting it by saying That is the way it is.

original: las zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / brnab sems la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / brnab sems la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Action refers to virtuous and nonvirtuous actions of body, speech, and mind, as well as covetousness, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Maturation is the result here.

original: gzer ba'i snying gis zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i lus kyis so //🔽tshogs rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dag rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gzer ba'i snying gis zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i lus kyis so // tshogs rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dag rnyed pa'o //
translated: With a heart full of longing means with a body full of longing.🔽Obtaining the collection means obtaining the internal co-operating causes.

original: rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi grogs rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi grogs rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The transformation of conditions means the transformation of the external aids.

original: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chu'i 'od pa bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed pa la mngon du phyogs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chu'i 'od pa bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed pa la mngon du phyogs par gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding like a light means that it abides as if it were a light in the water, facing the performance of its function.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag ces bya ba ni des pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zlog par mi spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag ces bya ba ni des pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zlog par mi spyod pa dag go //
translated: The phrase “that will certainly occur” means that it is certain, and the Blessed One cannot avert it.

original: byas shing zhes bya ba ni blangs shing ngo //
analyzed: byas shing zhes bya ba ni blangs shing ngo //
translated: The phrase “having done” means having taken up.

original: bstsags pas zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa'i tshigs kyis gsos pa'am 'bras bur 'gyur bar nges par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bstsags pas zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa'i tshigs kyis gsos pa'am 'bras bur 'gyur bar nges par byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “having accumulated” means having nourished it with homogeneous components, or having made it certain that it will have a result.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is compassionate by nature.

original: nyid kyis ci'i phyir zhal gyis mi @59a * //🔽bzhes she na /
analyzed: nyid kyis ci'i phyir zhal gyis mi @59a * // bzhes she na /
translated: Why did he not accept it himself?

original: de'i phyir nye sde nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis so sor myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye sde nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis so sor myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, “Upatiṣya, who else will experience the karma that you have done and accumulated?”

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la 'bras bu dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la 'bras bu dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because there is no connection, the results do not occur in the other’s continuum.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang gsang sngags la sogs pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po dag la ci'i phyir 'byung bar mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang gsang sngags la sogs pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po dag la ci'i phyir 'byung bar mi mdzad ce na /
translated: Why don’t miracles, spells, etc. cause external things to occur?

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag las byas shing bstsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag las byas shing bstsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Monks, actions that are done and accumulated do not ripen externally in the element of earth, etc.”

original: zin pa zhes bya ba ni sems pas zin pa ste /
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba ni sems pas zin pa ste /
translated: “Seized” means “seized by intention.”

original: nang gi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as “internal.”

original: dus 'phos pas ji ltar chud za bar mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir // las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
analyzed: dus 'phos pas ji ltar chud za bar mi 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir // las rnams bskal pa brgyar yang ni //
translated: How can it be wasted by the passage of time?🔽Therefore, it is said, “Even after a hundred eons,

original: chud mi za ba'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chud mi za ba'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: actions do not perish.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug pa'i bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug pa'i bye brag bstan to //
translated: The second “even” shows that the meaning of “thus” is a distinction.

original: chogs zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: chogs zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: “Collection” is the collection of causes that give rise to it.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'o //
translated: “Time” is the absence of an obstacle.

original: lus can rnams la 'ang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'ang zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la'o //
translated: “For embodied beings” is for sentient beings.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni sgra'i nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni sgra'i nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: “Just” is a particle.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: las nges pa rnams ni bskal pa brgya phrag 'das pa dag tu yang chud mi za ba yin te /
analyzed: las nges pa rnams ni bskal pa brgya phrag 'das pa dag tu yang chud mi za ba yin te /
translated: Even after a hundred eons, the results of certain actions are not lost.

original: de'ang 'di ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa dang bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'i dus rnyed na byed pa po sems can lus can rnams la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa dang bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'i dus rnyed na byed pa po sems can lus can rnams la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: And when the collection of causes and the time without an obstacle are found, they become the desired and undesired results for embodied beings, the agents.

original: 'dir don ni de yin no //
analyzed: 'dir don ni de yin no //
translated: This is the meaning here.

original: nye sdes gang gi tshe ci zhig byas she na ;
analyzed: nye sdes gang gi tshe ci zhig byas she na ;
translated: What did Udayana do?

original: de'i phyir dge slong rag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na zhis bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong rag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na zhis bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Monks, in the past, a long time ago…” and so on.

original: sngon byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni sngon byung ba yin gyi da ltar ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba gang yin pa 'di ni sngon byung ba yin gyi da ltar ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha tshig go //
translated: “Previously” means that this which will be explained below is previous, not present.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rgyal po ni 'gran zla med pas phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rgyal po ni 'gran zla med pas phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “When the Buddhas have not appeared” means that the Dharma King is rare because he is without rival.

original: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig pu kho na'i phyir sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig pu kho na'i phyir sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: “Pratyekabuddhas” are Buddhas for themselves alone.

original: gzhan la rjes su ston par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan la rjes su ston par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They do not teach others, that is the meaning.

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni rigs dma' ba'o //
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni rigs dma' ba'o //
translated: “Inferior” means of low family.

original: bkren pa zhes bya ba ni dbul ba'o //
analyzed: bkren pa zhes bya ba ni dbul ba'o //
translated: “Poor” means destitute.

original: @59b rab mtha'i gnas mal la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni thag ring ba'i gnas na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @59b rab mtha'i gnas mal la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni thag ring ba'i gnas na gnas pa'o //
translated: “Delighting in remote abodes” means living in a distant place.

original: bse ru lta bu zhes bya ba ni gcig pu 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu zhes bya ba ni gcig pu 'dug pa'o //
translated: “Rhinoceros-like” means living alone.

original: gcig pu 'jig rten gyi yon gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pas de'i tshe nyid 'jig rten gyi yon gnas yin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pu 'jig rten gyi yon gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pas de'i tshe nyid 'jig rten gyi yon gnas yin pa ste /
translated: He is the sole object of offerings in the world, because he is nondual. At that time, he is the object of offerings in the world,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because the Tathagatas do not appear in the world.

original: mtshe'u zhes bya ba ni mtsho'o //
analyzed: mtshe'u zhes bya ba ni mtsho'o //
translated: A pond is a lake.

original: rnyong zhes bya ba ni bya 'dzin pa ste thang shing gi thang chung la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyong zhes bya ba ni bya 'dzin pa ste thang shing gi thang chung la sogs pa'o //
translated: A snare is a trap for birds, a small piece of wood, etc.

original: don yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: don yod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod pa yin no //
translated: He is not without purpose, because he has a purpose.

original: brang 'gro'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni klu ste /
analyzed: brang 'gro'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni klu ste /
translated: The king of elephants is an elephant.

original: de nyal ba'i lus bskyil ba zlum por 'dug pa ltar brla gnyis kyis skyil mo krung byas te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyal ba'i lus bskyil ba zlum por 'dug pa ltar brla gnyis kyis skyil mo krung byas te 'dug pa'o //
translated: He sits cross-legged, like the coiled body of an elephant lying down.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni bkren pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni bkren pa'o //
translated: He is not poor, because he is not destitute.

original: smas pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
analyzed: smas pa zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
translated: He is not angry, because he is not hostile.

original: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pas so //
analyzed: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pas so //
translated: He is not sinful, because he is not wicked.

original: yang na smas pa ni dngos gzhi'i sdig pa byed pas so //
analyzed: yang na smas pa ni dngos gzhi'i sdig pa byed pas so //
translated: Alternatively, he is not angry, because he does not commit the basic sins.

original: nyams pa ni rjes kyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni rjes kyi nyes pa'o //
translated: The loss is the subsequent fault.

original: lag nas drangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyir bcos pas te /
analyzed: lag nas drangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyir bcos pas te /
translated: The pulling from the hand is the correction,

original: 'gyod pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: which is to be applied to regret and so on.

original: 'dab ma brkyang pa zhes bya ba ni gshog pa phyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brkyang pa zhes bya ba ni gshog pa phyar ba'o //
translated: The spreading of the wings is the flapping of the wings.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni bar snang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni bar snang ngo //
translated: The sky is the atmosphere.

original: cho 'phrul zhes bya ba ni ya mtshan no //
analyzed: cho 'phrul zhes bya ba ni ya mtshan no //
translated: The miracle is the wonder.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The ordinary person is the one who has not seen reality.

original: sems gtod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems gtod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: The attention is the conformity.

original: rma lhan zhes bya ba ni rma glen pa'o //
analyzed: rma lhan zhes bya ba ni rma glen pa'o //
translated: The wound is the foolish wound.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni nyes pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni nyes pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The peace is the complete liberation from all faults.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med par zhes bya ba ni phung po tsam dang yang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med par zhes bya ba ni phung po tsam dang yang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The nirvana without remainder is the non-possession even of the mere aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba ni phung po med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba ni phung po med pa'o //
translated: The realm of nirvana is the absence of the aggregates.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni de dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The entry is the conformity with that.

original: mnyes par byed ces bya ba ni mgu ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes par byed ces bya ba ni mgu ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Please means to follow with joy.

original: las de nyid kyi lhag mas zhes bya ba ni las de'i 'khor gyi las yod pas so //
analyzed: las de nyid kyi lhag mas zhes bya ba ni las de'i 'khor gyi las yod pas so //
translated: The remainder of that action means that there is an action that accompanies that action.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: Thus means because of that.

original: las gcig tu gnag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du mi dge ba dag go //
analyzed: las gcig tu gnag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du mi dge ba dag go //
translated: Actions that are entirely dark means that which is non-virtuous in all aspects.

original: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du dge ba dag go //
analyzed: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du dge ba dag go //
translated: Actions that are entirely bright means that which is virtuous in all aspects.

original: brtsam par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang spel bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtsam par bya ste zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang spel bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should undertake means to contemplate and increase.

original: btsas pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni btsas ston la sogs pa'i go rims kyis so //🔽gnang chen la zhes @60a * //
analyzed: btsas pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni btsas ston la sogs pa'i go rims kyis so // gnang chen la zhes @60a * //
translated: In the order of birth means in the order of the birth ceremony and so on.

original: bya ba ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni byams pa'o //
translated: In the great festival means in the great love.

original: ci nas cir bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni tshegs chen pos so //
analyzed: ci nas cir bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni tshegs chen pos so //
translated: In whatever way means with great effort.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni gzengs bstod pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni gzengs bstod pas so //
translated: Fully delight means to encourage.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: Delight means the desired meaning.

original: snyan pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: snyan pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The term fame refers to a favorable reputation.

original: 'khyams pa zhes bya ba ni gar song mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khyams pa zhes bya ba ni gar song mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term wandering means that one does not know where one is going.

original: bsil ba'i ro dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag bsil ba'i ro dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsil ba'i ro dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag bsil ba'i ro dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The term possessing the taste of coolness means that one possesses the taste of the nectar of immortality.

original: de dus lags par dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod pa de gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dus lags par dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod pa de gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term please consider the time means do what you wish.

original: tshim par byas zhes bya ba ni zas 'dod pas so //
analyzed: tshim par byas zhes bya ba ni zas 'dod pas so //
translated: The term satisfied means that one is satisfied with food.

original: bstabs zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod na gzhan dbul ba'o //
analyzed: bstabs zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod na gzhan dbul ba'o //
translated: The term presented means that one offers to others what one does not want.

original: khron pa lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chu'i khron pa dang 'dra bar thams cad 'du ba'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khron pa lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chu'i khron pa dang 'dra bar thams cad 'du ba'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: The term like a well means that one is a support for the gathering of all, like a well for water.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term thus means for what reason.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba ni phan pa nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes bya ba ni phan pa nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: The term spiritual teacher means one who teaches what is beneficial.

original: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub dka' ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub dka' ba'o //
translated: The term extraordinary means difficult to accomplish.

original: sbom po zhes bya ba ni lus lci ba'o //
analyzed: sbom po zhes bya ba ni lus lci ba'o //
translated: “Gross” means heavy.

original: glen ma zhes bya ba ni blo ngan pa'o //
analyzed: glen ma zhes bya ba ni blo ngan pa'o //
translated: “Stupid” means of poor intellect.

original: dman pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa zhan pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa zhan pa'o //
translated: “Inferior” means of weak practice.

original: spobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //🔽bu zan mo'i bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o // bu zan mo'i bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Eloquence” means knowledge.🔽“Son of a dākinī” means

original: bu zan mo zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma ste /🔽de'i bu ni bu zan mo'i bu ste mkha' 'gro ma'i bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bu zan mo zhes bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma ste / de'i bu ni bu zan mo'i bu ste mkha' 'gro ma'i bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: a dākinī’s son.

original: nyam nga nas zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha nas so //
analyzed: nyam nga nas zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha nas so //
translated: “Embarrassed” means ashamed.

original: sgron shing gi tshal zhes bya ba ni sgron ma rgyu'i shing gi tshal lo //
analyzed: sgron shing gi tshal zhes bya ba ni sgron ma rgyu'i shing gi tshal lo //
translated: “Lamp-wood forest” means a forest of trees that are the cause of lamps.

original: bsten cing goms pas byas lan mang du byas zhes bya ba ni chung du dang // 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bsten cing goms pas byas lan mang du byas zhes bya ba ni chung du dang // 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: “By practice, cultivation, and frequent practice” means generated by small, medium, and great.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni bar du mchod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni bar du mchod pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Result” means the result of intermediate worship.

original: phan yon zhes bya ba ni bar chod pa'o //
analyzed: phan yon zhes bya ba ni bar chod pa'o //
translated: “Benefit” means the intermediate obstacle.

original: mi sdug pa ston par mdzad ces bya ba ni rus pa'i keng rus la sogs pa'i rnam par bsgom pa ston par mdzad de'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ston par mdzad ces bya ba ni rus pa'i keng rus la sogs pa'i rnam par bsgom pa ston par mdzad de'o //
translated: He teaches the meditation on the repulsive, i.e., the meditation on the skeleton, etc.

original: bsngags pa brjod pa yang mdzad do zhes bya ba ni yon tan stod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa brjod pa yang mdzad do zhes bya ba ni yon tan stod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He praises, i.e., extols the virtues of others.

original: dge slong la stsol bar byed do zhes bya ba ni gsong par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong la stsol bar byed do zhes bya ba ni gsong par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He gives to the monks, i.e., he is generous to them.🔽Mṛgāramāṭa, Śramaṇamuni, etc.

original: ri dags zlog dge sbyong sbed ces bya ba ni kun du rgyu zhig gi ming ste ri dags zlog ces bya ba ni ri dags phyir zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ri dags zlog dge sbyong sbed ces bya ba ni kun du rgyu zhig gi ming ste ri dags zlog ces bya ba ni ri dags phyir zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: Mṛgāramāṭa is the name of a certain wandering mendicant. He is called Mṛgāramāṭa because he turns away deer.

original: dge sbyong sbed ces bya ba ni kun du rgyu'i dge sbyong la gsang thabs su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong sbed ces bya ba ni kun du rgyu'i dge sbyong la gsang thabs su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Śramaṇamuni is the name of a certain wandering mendicant. He is called Śramaṇamuni because he was born as a secret son of a Śramaṇa.

original: yang na nags @60b khrod na gnas pa'i rab tu byung ba dge sbyong rnams chom rkun la sogs pa dag las srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nags @60b khrod na gnas pa'i rab tu byung ba dge sbyong rnams chom rkun la sogs pa dag las srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, he is called Śramaṇamuni because he protects the Śramaṇas who are ascetics living in the forest from thieves, etc.

original: bdud kyi rigs zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi 'khor ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi rigs zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi 'khor ro //
translated: The family of Māra, i.e., the retinue of Māra.

original: rgyun ma phye bar 'dug nas zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi chu'i rgyun so sor ma phye bar 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun ma phye bar 'dug nas zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi chu'i rgyun so sor ma phye bar 'dug pa ste /
translated: “Remaining without interruption” means remaining without interruption of the stream of water in a river.

original: chu'i steng na 'dug ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste de ni yib ces bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa spong ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i steng na 'dug ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste de ni yib ces bya ba'i phyir ro // tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa spong ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that he remains on the water, because that is the meaning of “concealed.”🔽“Possessing morality” means possessing the avoidance of that which is naturally reprehensible.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa spong ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa spong ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Possessing virtue” means possessing the avoidance of that which is reprehensible by prescription.

original: rgal bar byed ces bya ba ni lus kyis sdug bsngal gyi chu bo las rgal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgal bar byed ces bya ba ni lus kyis sdug bsngal gyi chu bo las rgal bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Crossing over” means crossing over the river of suffering by the body.

original: grol bar byed ces bya ba ni lus kyi mdud pa las grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: grol bar byed ces bya ba ni lus kyi mdud pa las grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Liberating” means liberating from the bonds of the body.

original: dbugs 'byin par byed ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal 'byung bar dogs pa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin par byed ces bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sdug bsngal 'byung bar dogs pa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: “Giving relief” means removing the fear of the arising of future suffering.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i lus 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i lus 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: “They will cause complete nirvana” means they will stop the body, which is the cause of suffering.

original: de ltar de la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar de la zhes bya ba la /
translated: “In that way, in regard to that” means:

original: 'dir de la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de'i phyir zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir de la zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de'i phyir zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: Here, the word “in regard to that” is taught to mean “for that reason.”

original: lta ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “Aspect of view” means a type of view.

original: nyung ngur gyur ces bya ba ni grangs kyis so //
analyzed: nyung ngur gyur ces bya ba ni grangs kyis so //
translated: “Become few” means by number.

original: nyams par gyur ces bya ba ni chud zos pas so //
analyzed: nyams par gyur ces bya ba ni chud zos pas so //
translated: “Become lost” means by wasting away.

original: yang na nyung ngur gyur ces bya ba ni gson po dag go //
analyzed: yang na nyung ngur gyur ces bya ba ni gson po dag go //
translated: Alternatively, “become few” means the living.

original: nyams par gyur ces bya ba ni shi ba dag go //
analyzed: nyams par gyur ces bya ba ni shi ba dag go //
translated: “Become lost” means the dead.

original: rda rdor gyur ces bya ba ni shi bar mi shes pa dag gi byug ris bzhag pas skabs skabs su stong par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rda rdor gyur ces bya ba ni shi bar mi shes pa dag gi byug ris bzhag pas skabs skabs su stong par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Become scattered” means those who are dead but are not known to be so, because their possessions are seen here and there.

original: bsrabs par gyur ces bya ba ni dge slong nyung bas go ba srab mor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsrabs par gyur ces bya ba ni dge slong nyung bas go ba srab mor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Become thin” means that because there are few monks, the understanding is thin.

original: 'di la nges par 'chi bar gyur pa nyid yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang btang snyoms su mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di la nges par 'chi bar gyur pa nyid yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang btang snyoms su mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One, knowing that they will certainly die, does not teach them the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba sgrib pa yod pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam ston par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skye ba sgrib pa yod pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam ston par mi mdzad do //
translated: He does not teach the noble path to those who are destined to be reborn in the form and formless realms, because the arising of the noble path is obstructed.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba dang 'chi bar nges pa rnams la 'jig rten pha rol du lam skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir mi sdug pa ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba dang 'chi bar nges pa rnams la 'jig rten pha rol du lam skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir mi sdug pa ston pa mdzad do //
translated: He teaches repulsiveness to those who are destined to die and to be reborn in the desire realm, because the path that is the cause for the arising of the noble path in the next world arises for them.

original: dge slong shi bar gyur pa de dag ni sngon bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi ri la dge slong rnal 'byor spyod par gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong shi bar gyur pa de dag ni sngon bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi ri la dge slong rnal 'byor spyod par gyur te /
translated: Those monks who died were previously monks who practiced yoga under the Blessed One Kāśyapa.

original: lo khri'i bar du mi sdug pa bsgoms pa 'phags pa'i lam mthong ba dag sbyor ba de'i rgyu bcom ldan 'das @61a * //
analyzed: lo khri'i bar du mi sdug pa bsgoms pa 'phags pa'i lam mthong ba dag sbyor ba de'i rgyu bcom ldan 'das @61a * //
translated: For ten thousand years they meditated on repulsiveness, but did not see the noble path. The Blessed One destroyed the cause of that practice.

original: kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun du gyur pa yin pas de dag la mi sdug pa bsgom pa bstan na tshe phyi ma la 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur zhing de dag shi ma thag tu lhar skyes nas /
analyzed: kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun du gyur pa yin pas de dag la mi sdug pa bsgom pa bstan na tshe phyi ma la 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur zhing de dag shi ma thag tu lhar skyes nas /
translated: They were the Sangha of Hearers of the Bhagavat. Therefore, when the Bhagavat taught them meditation on the foul, it became the cause for the arising of the arya path in their future lives.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ong ba'i tshe /
translated: Immediately after they died, they were born as gods and when they came into the presence of the Bhagavat,🔽the Bhagavat extensively taught them meditation on the foul and they obtained the result of stream enterer in that very life.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa'i rnam par bsgom pa rgya cher bstan pas tshe de nyid la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes 'dul ba bye brag tu bshad pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa'i rnam par bsgom pa rgya cher bstan pas tshe de nyid la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to zhes 'dul ba bye brag tu bshad pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is explained in the Vinaya-vibhanga.

original: de nyid kyi tshes bco lnga zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi zla ba phyed po'i bar du ma chod pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshes bco lnga zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi zla ba phyed po'i bar du ma chod pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The fifteenth day of that month means the fifteenth day of that month without interruption.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni nang gi gtso bo'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni nang gi gtso bo'i rgyu'o //
translated: Cause means the internal primary cause.

original: rkyen ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi grogs su gyur pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: rkyen ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi grogs su gyur pa'i rkyen no //
translated: Condition means the external secondary condition.

original: mir chags pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mir chags pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i rgyu'o //
translated: Attachment to humans means the cause of humans.

original: rang gi lag dar te zhes bya ba ni 'di la rang gi lag mngon sum du dar bsrid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lag dar te zhes bya ba ni 'di la rang gi lag mngon sum du dar bsrid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One's own hand means that one's own hand is directly extended.

original: lag pas lag pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag ste de la lag pas bskyod pa'i lag pa'o //
analyzed: lag pas lag pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag ste de la lag pas bskyod pa'i lag pa'o //
translated: Hand to hand means a distinction, and in that case it is a hand that is moved by a hand.

original: de la mtshon byin nam zhes bya ba ni de la mtshon phul ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshon byin nam zhes bya ba ni de la mtshon phul ba'o //
translated: To give a weapon to someone means to offer a weapon to someone.

original: chu gri zhes bya ba ni bla dags so //
analyzed: chu gri zhes bya ba ni bla dags so //
translated: A water knife is a metaphor.

original: kha cig na re ral gri so gcig pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re ral gri so gcig pa zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say it is a single-edged sword.

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad cas bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i 'tshog chas so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad cas bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i 'tshog chas so //
translated: Provisions for life are the equipment for living.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las dag gi'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las dag gi'o //
translated: Morally degenerate refers to physical and verbal actions.

original: sdig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni bsam pa la skyon chags pa'o //🔽bdag nyid thong shig ces bya ba ni rang gi lag pa'am sos bdag nyid bod cig pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni bsam pa la skyon chags pa'o // bdag nyid thong shig ces bya ba ni rang gi lag pa'am sos bdag nyid bod cig pa'o //
translated: Sinful refers to a flaw in intention.🔽Let go of yourself means with your own hand or mouth, let go of yourself.

original: bdag nyid sod cig ces bya ba ni rang gis bskyod pa'i mtshon la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid sod cig ces bya ba ni rang gis bskyod pa'i mtshon la sogs pas so //
translated: Kill yourself means with a weapon that you have moved yourself.

original: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du chug shig ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol bas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du chug shig ces bya ba ni gzhan la bcol bas so //
translated: “Let him be deprived of life” means that he is entrusted to others.

original: lus kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: “The impurity of bodily conduct” means

original: lus kyi kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba las nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni lus kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba las nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni lus kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: that which is afflicted in bodily conduct is the impurity of bodily conduct.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de /
translated: That very thing is its state.

original: lus kyi tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
