analyzed: lus kyi tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “immoral bodily conduct.”

original: ngag dang yid la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag dang yid la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way for speech and mind.

original: bslang ste zhes bya ba ni bshags pa la sogs pas phyung ste'o //
analyzed: bslang ste zhes bya ba ni bshags pa la sogs pas phyung ste'o //
translated: “Having been raised” means having been brought out by confession, etc.

original: 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor ba'o //
translated: “To be placed” means to be applied.

original: lus zhig na zhes bya ba ni shi na'o //
analyzed: lus zhig na zhes bya ba ni shi na'o //
translated: “When the body is destroyed” means when it dies.

original: bde 'gro zhes bya ba ni bzang po rnams kyis 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro zhes bya ba ni bzang po rnams kyis 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Good destiny” means going to a good place.

original: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten yongs su spang ba bstan to //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten yongs su spang ba bstan to //
translated: “The world of the gods” means the world of humans.

original: lha rnams kyi nang du zhes bya ba ni der yang dri za @61b la sogs pa yongs su spang ba bstan to //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi nang du zhes bya ba ni der yang dri za @61b la sogs pa yongs su spang ba bstan to //
translated: Among the gods means that even there, gandharvas and so on are to be avoided.

original: dge ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bsam pa can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bsam pa can no //
translated: Endowed with virtuous qualities means having a virtuous intention.

original: lhug par gtong ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rang la mi 'gog par gtong ba ste /
analyzed: lhug par gtong ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rang la mi 'gog par gtong ba ste /
translated: Liberally giving means giving without holding back.

original: sbyin pa'i cho ga blangs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i cho ga blangs pa'o //
translated: This is the rite of giving.

original: lag rkyong ba zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'i don du lag pa rkyong ba'o //
analyzed: lag rkyong ba zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'i don du lag pa rkyong ba'o //
translated: Extending the hand means extending the hand in order to give.

original: rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: Delighting in giving means delighting in giving.

original: mchod sbyin rgyun du byed pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la mchod pa yang dang yang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin rgyun du byed pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la mchod pa yang dang yang du byed pa'o //
translated: Performing sacrifices continuously means repeatedly making offerings to those who have good qualities.

original: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa byas pa'o //
translated: Excellent giving means having given a gift.

original: sbyin pa la 'ged par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan las thob pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de gzhan la yang 'ged par dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin pa la 'ged par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan las thob pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de gzhan la yang 'ged par dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase he is delighted to distribute means that he is delighted to distribute to others whatever objects he has obtained from others.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase painful feelings means undesirable feelings.

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du 'byung ba'o //🔽rtsub par zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'phel nas 'bring nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du 'byung ba'o // rtsub par zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'phel nas 'bring nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase inexhaustible means that they occur continuously.🔽 The phrase harsh means that they increase and become moderate.

original: tsha ba zhes bya ba ni chen po nyid kyis brnag mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba zhes bya ba ni chen po nyid kyis brnag mi bzod pa'o //
translated: The phrase burning means that they become intense and unbearable.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni yid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni yid sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase unpleasant means that they cause mental suffering.

original: zas so sor bsten par bya ba dag ces bya ba ni 'dod pa dag go //
analyzed: zas so sor bsten par bya ba dag ces bya ba ni 'dod pa dag go //
translated: The phrase foods that are to be consumed means that they are desired.

original: nad g-yog tshul dang mthun pa dag ces bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: nad g-yog tshul dang mthun pa dag ces bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa dag go //
translated: The phrase proper nursing means that they are suitable.

original: bod pa'i tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i ming ngo /
analyzed: bod pa'i tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i ming ngo /
translated: The phrase Tibetan terms means that they are names that are understood.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu'am sdig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i 'bras bu'am sdig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: “Evil” is the result of evil or the cause of evil.

original: mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gzhi mi gtsang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi gzhi mi gtsang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Filth” is the basis of the body, because it is impure.

original: 'tsho ba ngan pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ngan pa zhes bya ba ni smad pa'o //
translated: “Bad livelihood” is contemptible.

original: sems kyi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Desire of the mind” is strong desire.

original: sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag gi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dag gis so //
analyzed: sems kyi kun du rtog pa dag gi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dag gis so //
translated: “By the thoughts of the mind” is by the conceptual thoughts of the mind.

original: yang na smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa rgyun mi gcod pa la bstan pa'i phyir yang tshig tu smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod pa rgyun mi gcod pa la bstan pa'i phyir yang tshig tu smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Or by speech” is stated in order to show that one should not stop praising death.

original: des na sbyor ba ma btang ba'i 'bras bu grub na dngos gzhir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na sbyor ba ma btang ba'i 'bras bu grub na dngos gzhir 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, if the result of the preparation is accomplished, it becomes the actual basis,

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: but not by another.

original: bdag nyid kyis zin pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi khongs su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis zin pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi khongs su gtogs pa ste /
translated: “By oneself” is included in the body.

original: sems pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same as “with a mind.

original: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //🔽des zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa des so //
analyzed: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o // des zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa des so //
translated: ” “To begin” means to apply oneself.🔽“By that” means by that beginning.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa'i tshe'o //
translated: “At that time” means at the time of beginning.

original: ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni dus byed pa ma yin yang ngo //
analyzed: ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni dus byed pa ma yin yang ngo //
translated: “Even though” means even though one does not die.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa'i dus kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa'i dus kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: “After that” means after the time of beginning.

original: @62a * // gru mo zhes bya ba ni lag ngar dang phung pa'i bar gyi zur ro //
analyzed: @62a * // gru mo zhes bya ba ni lag ngar dang phung pa'i bar gyi zur ro //
translated: “Elbow” means the joint between the upper arm and the forearm.

original: phyi rol tu 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis mda' la sogs pa 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis mda' la sogs pa 'phangs pa'o //
translated: “Thrown outside” means shot by the body, such as an arrow.

original: mda' zhes bya ba ni mda' rtse mo mde'u dang bcas pa'o //🔽lcags mda' zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi mda'o //
analyzed: mda' zhes bya ba ni mda' rtse mo mde'u dang bcas pa'o // lcags mda' zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi mda'o //
translated: “Arrow” means an arrow with a metal point.🔽“Iron arrow” means an iron arrow.

original: mda' phyed kyi lcags las byas pa zhes bya ba ni mda' phyed lcags las byas pa'o //
analyzed: mda' phyed kyi lcags las byas pa zhes bya ba ni mda' phyed lcags las byas pa'o //
translated: “Half an arrow” means half an arrow made of iron.

original: kha cig na re smyig ma'i dma' mde'u 'dab ma ring po bcas pa ni lcags mda' yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re smyig ma'i dma' mde'u 'dab ma ring po bcas pa ni lcags mda' yin la /
translated: Some say that an iron arrow is a bamboo arrow with a long feather.

original: de nyid kyi mde'u rna sbrang can ni mda' phyed lcags las byas pa'o zhes zer ro //🔽ste'u kha ma zhes bya ba ni mda'i mde'u dra gri'i dbyibs 'dra ba'o //🔽mde'u be'u so lta bu zhes bya ba ni mde'u ba lang gi so'i dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi mde'u rna sbrang can ni mda' phyed lcags las byas pa'o zhes zer ro // ste'u kha ma zhes bya ba ni mda'i mde'u dra gri'i dbyibs 'dra ba'o // mde'u be'u so lta bu zhes bya ba ni mde'u ba lang gi so'i dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
translated: The arrowhead with a hole is made of iron.🔽The arrowhead with a sharp edge is shaped like a razor.🔽The arrowhead with a cow’s hoof is shaped like a cow’s hoof.

original: mde'u zur ma zhes bya ba ni mde'u til gyi gang bu'i dbyings dang 'dra ba'o //🔽mde'u ka ra b'i ra'i lo ma dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: mde'u zur ma zhes bya ba ni mde'u til gyi gang bu'i dbyings dang 'dra ba'o // mde'u ka ra b'i ra'i lo ma dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
translated: The arrowhead with a point is shaped like a sesame pod.🔽The arrowhead with a leaf is shaped like a karavīra leaf.

original: mde'u bye'u snying ma'i zhes bya ba ni mde'u me tog gzhon nu'i gnas skabs kyi dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: mde'u bye'u snying ma'i zhes bya ba ni mde'u me tog gzhon nu'i gnas skabs kyi dbyibs 'dra ba'o //
translated: The arrowhead with a bird’s heart is shaped like a young flower.

original: rdo rje rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon rdo rje'i dbyibs 'dra ba rtse mo mi rno ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon rdo rje'i dbyibs 'dra ba rtse mo mi rno ba'o //
translated: The single-pointed vajra is shaped like a vajra, but without a sharp point.

original: mda' bo che zhes bya ba ni mde'u can thung la yub sbom po'o //
analyzed: mda' bo che zhes bya ba ni mde'u can thung la yub sbom po'o //
translated: The large arrow is short and has a large shaft.

original: mtshon rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa mud ga ra'o //
analyzed: mtshon rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa mud ga ra'o //
translated: The single-pointed weapon is a mudgara.

original: rgyu shug gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu shug gi rus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu shug gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu shug gi rus pa'o //
translated: The fruit of the jujube tree is the bone of the jujube tree.

original: ral gri zhes bya ba ni ral gri chen po'o //
analyzed: ral gri zhes bya ba ni ral gri chen po'o //
translated: The sword is the great sword.

original: shang lang zhes bya ba ni ral gri so gcig pa ste /
analyzed: shang lang zhes bya ba ni ral gri so gcig pa ste /
translated: The śakti is the single-edged sword.

original: gri bo che zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gri bo che zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the great knife.

original: ral gri so gcig pa zhes bya ba ni ral gri dgu bo'o //
analyzed: ral gri so gcig pa zhes bya ba ni ral gri dgu bo'o //
translated: The single-edged sword is the nine-edged sword.

original: ral gri so gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni ral gri ring po'o //
analyzed: ral gri so gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni ral gri ring po'o //
translated: The double-edged sword is the long sword.

original: mdung zhes bya ba ni mdung rtse dang bcas pa yu ba gnyis sam gsum gyi tshad tsam du ring ba'o //
analyzed: mdung zhes bya ba ni mdung rtse dang bcas pa yu ba gnyis sam gsum gyi tshad tsam du ring ba'o //
translated: The spear is the one with a tip, long like two or three cubits.

original: mdung thung zhes bya ba ni yu ba thung ba mi'i tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: mdung thung zhes bya ba ni yu ba thung ba mi'i tshad tsam mo //
translated: The short spear is the short-handled one, the size of a human.

original: 'phang mdung zhes bya ba ni srog shing mdung rtse can 'phang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'phang mdung zhes bya ba ni srog shing mdung rtse can 'phang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The javelin is the one with a shaft and tip that is thrown.

original: kyo ba kha brag ces bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma drang ba'i lcags kyo ba kha brag go //
analyzed: kyo ba kha brag ces bya ba ni mkha' 'gro ma drang ba'i lcags kyo ba kha brag go //
translated: The goad is the iron hook for catching the sky-goers.

original: tsha lcag ces bya ba ni gtsag pa'i lcag yu'o //
analyzed: tsha lcag ces bya ba ni gtsag pa'i lcag yu'o //
translated: The whip is the whip for striking.

original: kha cig na re 'breng lcags la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'breng lcags la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is a chain of iron.

original: rtsa ma dang zhes bya ba ni shar ba 'phra ma'o //🔽bldag pa zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtse dang pi po ling la sogs pa bldag pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ma dang zhes bya ba ni shar ba 'phra ma'o // bldag pa zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtse dang pi po ling la sogs pa bldag pa'o //
translated: The word root means a thin root.🔽 The word sucking means sucking honey, grapes, etc.

original: gzhib pa zhes bya ba ni aa mra la sogs pa dbugs rngub cing za ba'o //
analyzed: gzhib pa zhes bya ba ni aa mra la sogs pa dbugs rngub cing za ba'o //
translated: The word chewing means eating mangoes, etc., by inhaling and exhaling.

original: dril phyi zhes bya ba ni lus dril zhing phyi ba'o //
analyzed: dril phyi zhes bya ba ni lus dril zhing phyi ba'o //
translated: The word rubbing means rubbing and massaging the body.

original: phye ma zhes bya ba ni skra dang rgyu ma la sogs pa lhag bag pa'i dug go //
analyzed: phye ma zhes bya ba ni skra dang rgyu ma la sogs pa lhag bag pa'i dug go //
translated: The word powder means poison mixed with hair, intestines, etc.

original: 'ching @62b ba zhes bya ba ni 'ching bar byed pa'o //🔽mtsha' zhes bya ba ni ba lang la za ba'i gcan gzan no //
analyzed: 'ching @62b ba zhes bya ba ni 'ching bar byed pa'o // mtsha' zhes bya ba ni ba lang la za ba'i gcan gzan no //
translated: The word binding means binding.🔽 The word crocodile means a beast that eats cows.

original: spyang ki zhes bya ba ni ce sbyang ngo //🔽yongs su skam pa zhes bya ba ni pags pa nyams pa'o //🔽yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni khrag skam pa'o //
analyzed: spyang ki zhes bya ba ni ce sbyang ngo // yongs su skam pa zhes bya ba ni pags pa nyams pa'o // yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni khrag skam pa'o //
translated: The word wolf means a jackal.🔽 The word drying up means decaying skin.🔽 The word exhaustion means dried blood.

original: yongs su 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sha skam pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sha skam pa'o //
translated: The word depletion means dried flesh.

original: dkris pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su zin pas so //
analyzed: dkris pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su zin pas so //
translated: “Entanglement” means being bound.

original: brang du 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrul 'khor gyi mi ste des gzhan gyi brang du rdeg par byed do //
analyzed: brang du 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrul 'khor gyi mi ste des gzhan gyi brang du rdeg par byed do //
translated: “Striking the chest” means a machine-man, who strikes the chest of another.

original: 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa 'gugs pa dang rdo bsgreng ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa 'gugs pa dang rdo bsgreng ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Machine” means a tree-puller, a standing stone, and so on.

original: rngon spyad ces bya ba ni ri dags kyi 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: rngon spyad ces bya ba ni ri dags kyi 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: “Hunting device” means a deer-trap.

original: zla ba mar gyi ngo'i tshes bcu bzhi zhes bya ba ni tshes nyi shu dgu'o //
analyzed: zla ba mar gyi ngo'i tshes bcu bzhi zhes bya ba ni tshes nyi shu dgu'o //
translated: “The fourteenth day of the waning half of the month” means the twenty-ninth day.

original: shi ba'i ro zhes bya ba ni mi'i ro'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i ro zhes bya ba ni mi'i ro'o //
translated: “A corpse” means a human corpse.

original: ma smas zhes bya ba ni bu gum byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma smas zhes bya ba ni bu gum byung ba'o //
translated: “Unharmed” means not having a hole.

original: ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag dum bur ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag dum bur ma gyur pa'o //
translated: “Unbroken” means not having a limb missing.

original: bya rmyang zhes bya ba ni lus gyen du 'chu ba'o //
analyzed: bya rmyang zhes bya ba ni lus gyen du 'chu ba'o //
translated: “Stretching” means raising the body.

original: blag blag zer zhing zhes bya ba ni sgra blag blag zer zhing ngo //
analyzed: blag blag zer zhing zhes bya ba ni sgra blag blag zer zhing ngo //
translated: “With a cracking sound” means with a cracking sound.

original: ro langs zhes bya ba ni 'dre la sogs pa mi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ro langs zhes bya ba ni 'dre la sogs pa mi ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Zombie” means a ghost, and so on.

original: nags kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba ni nags tshal gyi nang nas skyes pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu la byas pa'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: nags kyi phreng ba zhes bya ba ni nags tshal gyi nang nas skyes pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu la byas pa'i phreng ba'o //
translated: A garland of forest is a garland made of flowers and fruits that grow in the forest.

original: bum pa gang ba zhes bya ba'i chus bkang ba'o //🔽ba dang be'ur 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni smad gnyis spu ga mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa gang ba zhes bya ba'i chus bkang ba'o // ba dang be'ur 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni smad gnyis spu ga mthun pa'o //
translated: A full vase is one filled with water.🔽A cow and calf are two animals with similar hair color.

original: mchig mchi gu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mchig smad phrugs su ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchig mchi gu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni mchig smad phrugs su ldan pa'o //
translated: A pestle and mortar are two things that are used for grinding.

original: me tshugs sbar ba zhes bya ba ni me bud pa'o //
analyzed: me tshugs sbar ba zhes bya ba ni me bud pa'o //
translated: A kindling fire is a fire that is burning.

original: rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //🔽rgyal bas bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi pho nya'am /
analyzed: rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o // rgyal bas bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi pho nya'am /
translated: A victor is a Tathagata.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: A statement by the Victor is a message from the Bhagavan or an instruction by the Bhagavan.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma'o //
translated: A bodhisattva is one in his last existence.

original: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni dang por thar pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni dang por thar pa'o //
translated: A pratimokṣa is the first liberation.

original: kha ton pa zhes bya ba ni kha don du ma bslabs pa'o //
analyzed: kha ton pa zhes bya ba ni kha don du ma bslabs pa'o //
translated: A reciter is one who has not studied recitation.

original: rgya cher dbyangs kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis thos pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: rgya cher dbyangs kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis thos pa'i sgras so //
translated: The phrase in a loud voice means in a voice that can be heard by others.

original: mdo sde'i sde tshan bzhi po zhes bya ba ni lung ring po dang / lud bar ma dang / yang dag par ldan pa'i lung dang / gcig las 'phros pa'i lung ngag go //
analyzed: mdo sde'i sde tshan bzhi po zhes bya ba ni lung ring po dang / lud bar ma dang / yang dag par ldan pa'i lung dang / gcig las 'phros pa'i lung ngag go //
translated: The phrase the four types of sutra collections refers to the Sutra, the Vinaya, the Abhidharma, and the Miscellaneous.

original: mdo chen po zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba las rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir dang // gnod sbyin gdug pa la sogs pa las rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mdo chen po zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba las rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir dang // gnod sbyin gdug pa la sogs pa las rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The phrase great sutra means that it is a sutra that is great in terms of its content, because it is victorious over the adversaries and because it is victorious over the evil yakshas, etc.

translated: “The seat of the ṛṣis” means

analyzed: gzhon pa zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu nyid dgag pa bstan te na tshod gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: bcu bdun sde zhes bya @64b ba ni bcu bdun po dag gi tshogs so //
analyzed: bcu bdun sde zhes bya @64b ba ni bcu bdun po dag gi tshogs so //
translated: The term “group of seventeen” refers to the collection of seventeen.

original: tshogs dag ces bya ba ni gcig pa dag ste de dag la tshogs kyi grangs dang 'brel ba yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽las su bsko ba zhes bya ba ni las su zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs dag ces bya ba ni gcig pa dag ste de dag la tshogs kyi grangs dang 'brel ba yod pa'i phyir ro // las su bsko ba zhes bya ba ni las su zhugs pa ste /
translated: The term “group” means a single group, because they are related to the number of a group.🔽The term “assigned to work” means that they are engaged in work.

original: las kyi res zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las kyi res zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “in turn” means in order.

original: stongs te zhes bya ba ni bya ba gcig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: stongs te zhes bya ba ni bya ba gcig pa nyid du'o //
translated: The term “empty” means in a single action.

original: gag tshil zhes bya ba ni mchan khung la sogs par sor mo gnyis sam gsum dal bus nyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gag tshil zhes bya ba ni mchan khung la sogs par sor mo gnyis sam gsum dal bus nyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The term “massage” means to slowly rub two or three fingers into the armpits and so on.

original: dad pa can zhes bya ba ni yon tan rnams dang yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la yid ches pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa can zhes bya ba ni yon tan rnams dang yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la yid ches pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The term “faithful” means to have confidence in qualities and those who possess qualities.

original: bzang ba zhes bya ba ni gnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bzang ba zhes bya ba ni gnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The term “good” means to be virtuous.

original: dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya ba ni bsod nams 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya ba ni bsod nams 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who has a virtuous intention is one who desires merit.

original: bsngos te zhes bya ba ni mngon par bsams te'o //
analyzed: bsngos te zhes bya ba ni mngon par bsams te'o //
translated: Having dedicated means having fully intended.

original: rta babs mthon po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rta babs mthon po zhes bya ba la /
translated: A high archway is as follows.

original: rta babs zhes bya ba ni lam po che'i sgo'o //
analyzed: rta babs zhes bya ba ni lam po che'i sgo'o //
translated: An archway is the gate to a great road.

original: mthon po zhes bya ba ni bsgrengs pa'o //
analyzed: mthon po zhes bya ba ni bsgrengs pa'o //
translated: A high one is an elevated one.

original: skar khung zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i mthongs so //
analyzed: skar khung zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i mthongs so //
translated: A window is an opening for light.

original: skar khung dra ba can zhes bya ba ni rlung gi lam dra ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: skar khung dra ba can zhes bya ba ni rlung gi lam dra ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: A window with a lattice is a wind passage with a lattice.

original: lan kan zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba'i lam gcad pa'o //
analyzed: lan kan zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba'i lam gcad pa'o //
translated: A railing is a barrier on a path.

original: des na gtsug lhag khang rta babs mthong po dang skar khung dang skar khung dra ba can lan kan gyis brgyan pa de lta bu byed du bcug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na gtsug lhag khang rta babs mthong po dang skar khung dang skar khung dra ba can lan kan gyis brgyan pa de lta bu byed du bcug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, having made a temple with high archways, windows, and lattice windows adorned with railings means having had it built. This is the meaning.

original: snying dang mig 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying dang mig 'phrog pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: It captivates the heart and the eye means it is captivating.

original: mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni stegs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni stegs su gyur pa'o //
translated: It is a staircase to heaven means it is a stepping stone.

original: dpyang tshags zhes bya ba ni chu btsags pa'i tshags so //
analyzed: dpyang tshags zhes bya ba ni chu btsags pa'i tshags so //
translated: The “net” is the net for catching fish.

original: mtsho padma gang ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni padma dang bcas pa'i mtsho bzhin no //
analyzed: mtsho padma gang ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni padma dang bcas pa'i mtsho bzhin no //
translated: “Like a lake full of lotuses” means like a lake with lotuses.

original: sa gzhi de ni dga' byed yin zhes bya ba ni sa rnams dga' bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi de ni dga' byed yin zhes bya ba ni sa rnams dga' bar gyur ba'o //
translated: “That ground is delightful” means the grounds are delightful.

original: yon bshad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: yon bshad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: “The explanation of the virtues” means the dedication of the results of generosity.

original: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni rus gong la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i chags pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni rus gong la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i chags pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: “The unattractive” means the mind without attachment to the observation of skeletons, and so on.

original: bla mkhyen zhes bya ba ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi spyan no //
analyzed: bla mkhyen zhes bya ba ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi spyan no //
translated: “The clairvoyances” means the eyes of the retinue of queens.

original: dad pas spel bar bya zhing zhes bya ba ni tshul dang mthun par rjes su bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: dad pas spel bar bya zhing zhes bya ba ni tshul dang mthun par rjes su bsgrubs pas so //
translated: “One should increase with faith” means one should practice in accordance with the rules.

original: rjes su snying brtse bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos blang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su snying brtse bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos blang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “One should have compassion” means accepting the Dharma of giving and so on.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “With the melody of verse” means

original: rta brgyad dang ni gser brgya dang / dre'u dang shing rta brgya dag dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'don pas so //🔽rgan zhugs zhes bya @65a * //
analyzed: rta brgyad dang ni gser brgya dang / dre'u dang shing rta brgya dag dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'don pas so // rgan zhugs zhes bya @65a * //
translated: The verse eight horses, one hundred of gold, one hundred mules, one hundred carts and so on.

original: ba ni yun ring du lon nas rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: ba ni yun ring du lon nas rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The term old man means one who has gone forth in old age.

original: shing shun zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i shun pa'o //🔽gos zhes bya ba ni bgo ba la sogs pa'i gos so //
analyzed: shing shun zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i shun pa'o // gos zhes bya ba ni bgo ba la sogs pa'i gos so //
translated: The term bark means the bark of a tree.🔽The term cloth means a cloth for covering and so on.

original: phur shog cing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyi tshogs dag sgra phur shog zer zhing 'dug pa'o//
analyzed: phur shog cing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gos kyi tshogs dag sgra phur shog zer zhing 'dug pa'o//
translated: The term heap means a pile of cloth.

original: byug ris zhes bya ba ni sa'o //
analyzed: byug ris zhes bya ba ni sa'o //
translated: The term design means a picture.

original: dang po bdun po dag ces bya ba ni stan nang tshangs can dang / 'og gzhi dang steng g-yogs dang / gding ba dang / bgo ba dang sngas dang / rten ma'o //
analyzed: dang po bdun po dag ces bya ba ni stan nang tshangs can dang / 'og gzhi dang steng g-yogs dang / gding ba dang / bgo ba dang sngas dang / rten ma'o //
translated: The term first seven means a mattress, a mat, a blanket, a shawl, a pillow, and a support.

original: padma'i mig can dag ces bya ba ni dga' ba la bod pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i mig can dag ces bya ba ni dga' ba la bod pa'o //
translated: The term lotus-eyed means one who is fond of.

original: gru bo che zhes bya ba ni 'degs pa'i snod do //
analyzed: gru bo che zhes bya ba ni 'degs pa'i snod do //
translated: The term large ship means a vessel for lifting.

original: phrogs shing phrogs shig ces bya ba ni khyer cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: phrogs shing phrogs shig ces bya ba ni khyer cig ces bya ba ste /
translated: “Take, take!” means “carry off.”

original: gus par bsgrim pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
analyzed: gus par bsgrim pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
translated: It is repeated twice in order to express respect and care.

original: 'phong gi slob dpon zhes bya ba ni 'phong gi rig byed la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phong gi slob dpon zhes bya ba ni 'phong gi rig byed la mkhas pa'o //
translated: “Master of archery” means skilled in the science of archery.

original: bton te zhes bya ba ni smras te'o //
analyzed: bton te zhes bya ba ni smras te'o //
translated: “Expelled” means “spoken.”

original: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims gso ba'o //🔽mi mchog 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur mdzad pa //
analyzed: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims gso ba'o // mi mchog 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur mdzad pa //
translated: “Purification” means the purification of morality.🔽The Tathāgata, the leader who tames the best of men,

original: kun sbyor 'ching ba gcod pa de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: kun sbyor 'ching ba gcod pa de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the cutter of the bonds of all fetters,

original: dbang po zhi zhing nyer zhi zhi la mkhas //
analyzed: dbang po zhi zhing nyer zhi zhi la mkhas //
translated: the one skilled in the peace and tranquility of the faculties,

original: mnyan yod bzhugs pas bka' bzhin byed pas gsungs //
analyzed: mnyan yod bzhugs pas bka' bzhin byed pas gsungs //
translated: resides in Śrāvastī, speaking in accordance with the teachings.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: mi mchog 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa lta bu bden pa'i snod du rung ba'i 'dul ba dag go //
translated: “the tamer of the best of men” refers to those to be tamed who are suitable vessels for the truth, such as Ārya Śāriputra and so on.

original: kha lo sgyur mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: kha lo sgyur mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi khyad par ro //
translated: “The leader” and so on describe the special qualities of the Blessed One.

original: kun sbyor zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / phra dog dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba dgu po dag go //
analyzed: kun sbyor zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / phra dog dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba dgu po dag go //
translated: The fetters are the nine fetters: the fetters of passion, aversion, pride, ignorance, views, false views, adherence, perplexity, and concealment.

original: 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba stug po dag go //
analyzed: 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba stug po dag go //
translated: The bonds are the three bonds: passion, aversion, and delusion.

original: gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba de dag gcod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba de dag gcod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The cutting off is the cutting off of those fetters and bonds of the disciples.

original: dbang po zhi zhing zhes bya ba ni rang gi'o //🔽nyer zhi zhes bya ba ni lam mo //
analyzed: dbang po zhi zhing zhes bya ba ni rang gi'o // nyer zhi zhes bya ba ni lam mo //
translated: The pacification of the faculties is one's own.🔽The complete pacification is the path.

original: zhi la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la'o //
analyzed: zhi la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la'o //
translated: The peace is nirvana.

original: bka' bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: bka' bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma rnams la'o //
translated: The obedience is that of the disciples.

original: gsung zhes bya ba ni go bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gsung zhes bya ba ni go bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The speech is the teaching.

analyzed: ming 'dogs par byed pa ni nyams so zhes bya ba ni don med cing dal @65b ba zhig byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase it is lost means that it is useless and that it is wasted.

original: lhag ma dang bcas par bzho bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod zho'i lhag ma dang bcas par bzho ba bzhin du tshod shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas par bzho bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod zho'i lhag ma dang bcas par bzho ba bzhin du tshod shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one should drink in moderation means that one should drink in the same way that one drinks a beverage that is mixed with a small amount of alcohol.

original: phyogs bzhi pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhin gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhin gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase the saṅgha of bhikṣus who are located in the four directions means those who are located in the four directions.

original: mtshan mo 'gebs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo de dag 'gebs shing mi snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan mo 'gebs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo de dag 'gebs shing mi snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the darkness of night means that it covers over and conceals the night.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'o /
translated: The phrase monastery means that it is not shared in common.

original: 'dug gnas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: The phrase dwelling place means that it is shared in common with others.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni gnyis bzhur gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni gnyis bzhur gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The phrase wheel of time means the wheel of the two purities.

original: bdun pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos glegs bu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: bdun pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos glegs bu bdun pa'o /
translated: The phrase seven-part garment means a Dharma robe that has seven panels.

analyzed: lnga pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos glegs bu lnga pa'o //
translated: The five-panelled one is the five-panelled robe.

analyzed: rgya cang zhes bya ba ni ska rags sbrul gyi mgrin pa lta bu'o // shur bu zhes bya ba ni skra rags leb leb pa'o // lcag pod ces bya ba ni ska rags rgyun sbom pa'o //
translated: The snake-girdle is a girdle like the neck of a snake.🔽The flat girdle is a flat girdle.🔽The thick girdle is a thick girdle.

original: shur bu phre'u zhes bya ba ni ska rags rgyun phra mo'o //
analyzed: shur bu phre'u zhes bya ba ni ska rags rgyun phra mo'o //
translated: The thin girdle is a thin girdle.

original: tsham ngam zhes bya ba ni rab tu sdang ba'i sems med pas bsdigs par bya ba'o //🔽yo byad bcu gsum zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / sham thabs dang / sham thabs kyi gzan dang / rdul gzan dang / rdal gzan gyi gzan dang ; gding ba dang / skra bzed pa dang /
analyzed: tsham ngam zhes bya ba ni rab tu sdang ba'i sems med pas bsdigs par bya ba'o // yo byad bcu gsum zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / sham thabs dang / sham thabs kyi gzan dang / rdul gzan dang / rdal gzan gyi gzan dang ; gding ba dang / skra bzed pa dang /
translated: The threatening gesture is a gesture of threatening without a mind of hatred.🔽The thirteen articles are the patched robe, the upper robe, the lower robe, the underskirt, the underskirt cover, the dust cloth, the dust cloth cover, the sitting cloth, the hair cloth,

original: rnag gzan dang / g-yan pa dgab pa dang khrus ras dang / dbyar gyi ras chen dang / yo byad kyi gos so //
analyzed: rnag gzan dang / g-yan pa dgab pa dang khrus ras dang / dbyar gyi ras chen dang / yo byad kyi gos so //
translated: the sweat cloth, the itch cloth, the bathing cloth, and the rainy season cloth.

original: legs gsungs zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: legs gsungs zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase well-spoken means spoken well.

original: rkang gnyis gtso bo zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rkang gnyis gtso bo zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i gtso bo'o //
translated: The phrase foremost of two-legged beings means foremost of gods and humans.

original: gang bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ba //
analyzed: gang bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ba //
translated: The phrase what was taught means what was said.

original: g-yul las sngar ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul ngar 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul las sngar ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul ngar 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the battle means in the fearsome battle.

original: rgan pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'i yul lo //
translated: The phrase the end of the old means the end of the old age.

original: gzhon pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba yang gzhon pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: gzhon pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba yang gzhon pa'i yul lo //
translated: The phrase the end of the young means the end of the young age.

original: rgan zhugs zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'o //
analyzed: rgan zhugs zhes bya ba ni rgan pa'o //
translated: The phrase the old man means the old man.

original: 'phang los rlogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i 'phong lo bteg pa'i sa'o //🔽mtshams med pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa ste sems can dmyal bar skye ba'i phyir bar du gcod par mi nus pa ni bar med pa ste /

translated: The phrase the place where the axle is broken means the place where the axle of the chariot is broken.

original: bar med par sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba'i las shes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar med par sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba'i las shes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase without interval means without interruption, because it is not possible to interrupt the birth in the hells. It means the karma that causes birth in the hells without interval.

original: spang leb ces bya ba ni @66a * //
analyzed: spang leb ces bya ba ni @66a * //
translated: The phrase the place of the flat stone means the place of the flat stone.

original: bkru bshal bya ba'i dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: bkru bshal bya ba'i dbyug pa'o //
translated: The stick for cleaning the teeth.

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa slob dpon dul ba'i lhas nye bar sbyar ba las pham par gyur pa gsum pa gsod pa'i pham par 'gyur ba'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /

translated: The third defeating offense, the offense of killing, is completed in the same way as the second defeating offense.

original: // / yangs pa can zhes bya ba'i grong khyer de khyim spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / yangs pa can zhes bya ba'i grong khyer de khyim spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The city of Vaiśālī is so called because it was founded by the king of the same name.

original: spre'u rdzing gi 'gram zhes bya ba ni spre'us brkos pa'i rdzing gi rgyun ngogs na'o //
analyzed: spre'u rdzing gi 'gram zhes bya ba ni spre'us brkos pa'i rdzing gi rgyun ngogs na'o //
translated: The bank of the pond of the monkeys is so called because a pond was dug there by monkeys.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi ming ngo //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi ming ngo //
translated: The upper chamber of the multistoried building is so called because it was the name of the temple.

original: chu srin nya'i rigs zhes bya ba ni nya dang 'dra ba ste mjug ma la sogs pa nya'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: chu srin nya'i rigs zhes bya ba ni nya dang 'dra ba ste mjug ma la sogs pa nya'i rnam pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The crocodile-like fish is so called because it resembles a fish but has a tail and so forth like a crocodile.

original: las ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las ma mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The offense of not seeing karma is so called because it means not knowing virtuous and nonvirtuous karma as they are.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni rma chung zhig byung ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni rma chung zhig byung ba'o //
translated: The term wounded means that a small wound has occurred.

original: rnam par smas pa zhes bya ba ni rma chen po byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smas pa zhes bya ba ni rma chen po byung ba'o //
translated: The term severely wounded means that a great wound has occurred.

original: ral pa zhes bya ba ni cung zhig ral pa'o //
analyzed: ral pa zhes bya ba ni cung zhig ral pa'o //
translated: The term torn means that something has been torn a little.

original: rab tu ral pa zhes bya ba ni cher ral pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu ral pa zhes bya ba ni cher ral pa'o //
translated: The term severely torn means that something has been torn a lot.

original: ltad mo zhes bya ba ni ya mtshan gyi blos lta 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ltad mo zhes bya ba ni ya mtshan gyi blos lta 'dod pa'o //
translated: The term spectacle means that one wishes to see out of a sense of wonder.

original: ston pa drug po zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang / kun du rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang /
analyzed: ston pa drug po zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs rdzogs byed dang / kun du rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang /
translated: The term six teachers refers to Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, Maskarin Gośālīputra, Saṃjayin Vairaṭīputra, Ajita Keśakambala, Kakuda Kātyāyana, and Nirgrantha Jñātiputra.

original: gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu zhes bya ba mu stegs can rnams kyi lam ston par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu zhes bya ba mu stegs can rnams kyi lam ston par byed pa dag go //
translated: The term tīrthikas refers to those who teach the path of the tīrthikas.

original: rtog par byed ces bya ba ni rnam par dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par byed ces bya ba ni rnam par dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: The term conceive means to investigate.

original: mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis so //
translated: The term know means by means of knowledge.

original: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni spyan gyis so //
analyzed: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni spyan gyis so //
translated: The term see means by means of the eyes.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni snyan gyis so //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni snyan gyis so //
translated: “Awareness” means by the ears.

original: rnam par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis rnam par shes so //
analyzed: rnam par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis rnam par shes so //
translated: “Knowledge” means by the mind consciousness.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni thugs rje bla na med pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni thugs rje bla na med pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Endowed with great compassion” means generated by unsurpassed compassion.

original: 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub pas so //
translated: “Engaged in the welfare of the world” means by subsequent accomplishment.

original: bsrung ba gcig bu gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo srung dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba gcig bu gcig pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo srung dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Sole protector, unique” means always endowed with the door of mindfulness.

original: nyag gcig dpa' ba zhes bya ba ni grogs la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: nyag gcig dpa' ba zhes bya ba ni grogs la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: “Sole hero” means not relying on a companion.

original: gnyis pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba gnyis pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba gnyis pa med pa'o //
translated: “Without a second” means without a second similar one.

original: gnyis su mi gsung ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu nges par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su mi gsung ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu nges par gsungs pa ste /
translated: “Not teaching in two ways” means teaching with certainty.

original: snga phyi 'gal ba mi gsung ba'o //
analyzed: snga phyi 'gal ba mi gsung ba'o //
translated: “Not teaching in contradictory ways” means not teaching in contradictory ways.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Engaged in calm abiding and special insight” means

original: zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: “Calm abiding” means meditative stabilization.

original: nyes pa @66b zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa @66b zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pacifies faults.

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni shes rab mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni shes rab mkhas pa ste /
translated: Insight is wisdom,

original: lhag mthong gi skyes bu mkhas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi skyes bu mkhas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it makes the person of insight wise.

original: rig pa gsum gsal bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i rig pa gsum ston par mdzad pa'o ;
analyzed: rig pa gsum gsal bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i rig pa gsum ston par mdzad pa'o ;
translated: He is the one who illuminates the three knowledges, because he teaches the three knowledges: the knowledge of former abodes, of the decease and rebirth of beings, and of the destruction of the impurities.

original: / bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gsum rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: / bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gsum rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is well trained in the three trainings, because he practices the three trainings: higher morality, higher thought, and higher wisdom.

original: dul ba'i gnas gsum gyi gzhi la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu 'jam pa dang / gcig tu rtsub pa dang ; 'jam rtsub 'dres pas 'dul ba'i gnas gsum la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dul ba'i gnas gsum gyi gzhi la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu 'jam pa dang / gcig tu rtsub pa dang ; 'jam rtsub 'dres pas 'dul ba'i gnas gsum la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is skilled in the three bases of the tamed one, because he is skilled in the three bases of taming: the gentle, the harsh, and the gentle and harsh.

original: chu bo bzhi las rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo las rgal ba'o //🔽rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis spyod pa'i gzhi la legs par gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: chu bo bzhi las rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo las rgal ba'o // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis spyod pa'i gzhi la legs par gnas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: The phrase he has crossed over the four rivers means that he has crossed over the rivers of desire, becoming, views, and ignorance.🔽The phrase he is well established in the basis of the practice of the four forms of supernatural knowledge means that he is well established in the four forms of supernatural knowledge that are made up of the one consisting of the concentration that is accompanied by the volition to achieve miraculous powers, the one consisting of the concentration that is accompanied by the volition to achieve miraculous powers, the one consisting of the concentration that is accompanied by the volition to achieve miraculous powers, and the one consisting of the concentration that is accompanied by the volition to achieve miraculous powers.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas yongs su sbyang ba mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa la yun ring po nas goms par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas yongs su sbyang ba mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa la yun ring po nas goms par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase he has long trained himself in the four principles for attracting a following means that he has long been accustomed to generosity, agreeable speech, helpful activity, and the practice of equal mindedness.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa nyid dang / gang la zag bzang pa nyid nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos de bzhin du bstan pa la bsnyengs pa mi mnga' zhing khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam 'cha' la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa nyid dang / gang la zag bzang pa nyid nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos de bzhin du bstan pa la bsnyengs pa mi mnga' zhing khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam 'cha' la /
translated: The phrase he is fearless due to the four forms of perfect knowledge means that he is a perfect buddha, and that he is fearless in teaching the path of deliverance to those who are desirous of liberation, and in teaching the Dharma that obstructs that path.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog pa'o //
translated: He is a great leader who makes proclamations in the midst of the assembly.

original: yan lag lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang ; the tshom zhes bya ba'i 'khor bar byed pa'i yan lag lnga po dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang ; the tshom zhes bya ba'i 'khor bar byed pa'i yan lag lnga po dag spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase he has abandoned the five states of deprivation means that he has abandoned the five states of deprivation that are the causes of samsara: desire, malice, torpor, excitation, and doubt.

original: 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dags kyi 'gro ba lnga las so //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dags kyi 'gro ba lnga las so //
translated: Having transcended the five destinies means having transcended the five destinies of gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi @67a * //
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi @67a * //
translated: Possessing the six limbs means attaining the six higher knowledges:

original: yul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa dang brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa dang brnyes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of supernatural power, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of past lives, knowledge of death and rebirth, and knowledge of the destruction of defilements.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Having perfected the six perfections means having perfected the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de dag 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they increase.

original: rtag tu gnas pa drug gis gnas pa mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba yul drug po dang rtag tu dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa drug gis gnas pa mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba yul drug po dang rtag tu dran pa dang shes bzhin gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: He is always mindful and vigilant in regard to the six sense-fields, which are the six objects of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: He is rich with the flowers of the seven factors of enlightenment, which are the factors of enlightenment that are perfect mindfulness, perfect analysis of phenomena, perfect effort, perfect joy, perfect pliancy, perfect concentration, and

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: perfect equanimity.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
translated: He is the teacher of the eightfold path, which is the right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort,

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He teaches the noble path by the nature of right mindfulness and right concentration.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la'o //
translated: Skill in the nine serial absorptions means in the four dhyanas, four formless states, and the absorption of cessation.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa dang / bstan pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang dbang po mchog dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa dang / bstan pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang dbang po mchog dang /
translated: Possessing the power of the ten powers means the power of knowing what is possible and impossible, the power of knowing one's own and others' past lives, the power of knowing the death and rebirth of beings, the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements, and the power of knowing the supreme and excellent right efforts.

original: mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ; khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ; khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of recollection of former existences,🔽the power of knowledge of death and rebirth of beings,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ngo //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ngo //
translated: and the power of knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: phyogs bcur snyan pas yang dag par @67b rgyas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs bcur snyan pas yang dag par @67b rgyas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is renowned in the ten directions.

original: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi dang steng dang 'og go //
analyzed: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi dang steng dang 'og go //
translated: The ten directions are the four directions, the four intermediate directions, and the zenith and the nadir.

original: brgya phrag bcur dbang bsgyur ba las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgya phrag bcur dbang bsgyur ba las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is superior to those who rule over a hundred koṭis.

original: brgya phrag bcu zhes bya ba ni stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: brgya phrag bcu zhes bya ba ni stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: A hundred koṭis is a great trichiliocosm.

original: der dbang sgyur ba ni 'khor gyi bdag pos te /
analyzed: der dbang sgyur ba ni 'khor gyi bdag pos te /
translated: To rule over that is to be the lord of the retinue.

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su dbang sgyur ba'i tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su dbang sgyur ba'i tshangs pa'o //
translated: Brahma, who rules over a thousand world systems.

original: de las khyad par du 'phags pa ni mthus lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de las khyad par du 'phags pa ni mthus lhag pa'o //
translated: Superior to that is the power of the Buddha.

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum zhes bya ba ni nyin par gyi snga dro dang / gung dang / phyi dro'i cha gsum /
analyzed: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum zhes bya ba ni nyin par gyi snga dro dang / gung dang / phyi dro'i cha gsum /
translated: Three times during the day and three times during the night means three times during the day, in the morning, at noon, and in the evening,

original: mtshan mo'i thun dang po dang / gung dang / tha ma gsum mo ;
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun dang po dang / gung dang / tha ma gsum mo ;
translated: and three times during the night, in the first, middle, and last periods.

original: / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: With the eye of a Buddha means with the knowledge of omniscience.

original: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba la'o //
translated: In the world means in the world of beings in the three realms.

original: rnam par gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags nas so //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags nas so //
translated: Having seen means having examined.

original: nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag las ltung ba'o //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de dag las ltung ba'o //
translated: They will decline means they will fall from those.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba dag nye bar sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge ba dag nye bar sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will increase means they will increase their virtues.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: They will be harmed means they will suffer physical pain.

original: nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The term misery refers to the suffering of separation from what is pleasant.

original: mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The term unhappiness refers to the suffering of encountering what is unpleasant.

original: gzhol ba dang bab pa dang 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pas mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba dang bab pa dang 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rnam pas mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: The terms inclined, bent, and directed refer to the small, medium, and great forms of the spiritual lineage.

original: mtho ris zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: mtho ris zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'jig rten no //
translated: The term heaven refers to the world of the gods.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The term liberation refers to nirvana.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //🔽'dod pa'i 'dam zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod pa dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'o // 'dod pa'i 'dam zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod pa dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa ste /
translated: The term fruit refers to the fruits of the sramana life.

original: 'dam pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dam pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term mire of desire refers to the desire for things and the desire for the passions, because they are similar to a mire.

original: 'phags pa'i nor zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dad pa dang // tshul khrims dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi nor bdun po dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dad pa dang // tshul khrims dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi nor bdun po dag go //
translated: The seven riches of the noble ones are faith, morality, a sense of shame, conscience, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas la dad pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas la dad pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
translated: With their fruits is explained as being in the order of faith in the teaching, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma 'phags pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue that have not been planted are those that are not the aids to liberation.

original: yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni mthus bskyed cing spel ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni mthus bskyed cing spel ba'o //
translated: They are brought to maturity by the power of the bodhisattvas.

original: smas pa zhes bya ba ni bstod pa byed pa la bsams so //🔽chu srin gnas kyi dug @68a * //
analyzed: smas pa zhes bya ba ni bstod pa byed pa la bsams so // chu srin gnas kyi dug @68a * //
translated: The word “praise” is used in the sense of “to make.”

original: can pa // zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: can pa // zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ste /
translated: The ocean is called “the abode of the sea monster”

original: de ni chu srin gyi gnas kyang yin la dug can yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni chu srin gyi gnas kyang yin la dug can yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abode of the sea monster and because it is poisonous.

original: dug las zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du rlabs 'byung ba'i dus las so //
analyzed: dug las zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du rlabs 'byung ba'i dus las so //
translated: The word “from” is used in the sense of “at a certain time.”

original: srid kyis zhes bya ba ni srid par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srid kyis zhes bya ba ni srid par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “By existence” means by the existence of the world.

original: byams pa zhes bya ba ni spyan ras kyis 'cho ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa zhes bya ba ni spyan ras kyis 'cho ba'o //
translated: “Loving” means looking with compassion.

original: rtog cing zhes bya ba ni tshol ba'o //
analyzed: rtog cing zhes bya ba ni tshol ba'o //
translated: “Thinking” means seeking.

original: bya ba lhag par byas zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i lam 'phangs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba lhag par byas zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i lam 'phangs par byas pa'o //
translated: “Having done what had to be done” means having made the path of liberation superior.

original: gdul bar gyur ba'i rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: gdul bar gyur ba'i rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i tshogs so //
translated: “The great ocean of those to be disciplined” means the multitude of those to be disciplined.

original: 'dzum pa zhes bya ba ni zhal cung zad dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzum pa zhes bya ba ni zhal cung zad dbye ba'o //
translated: “Smiling” means slightly opening the mouth.

original: 'od zer zhes bya ba ni 'od 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer zhes bya ba ni 'od 'phro ba'o //
translated: “Rays” means light-rays.

original: yang sos zhes bya ba ni bcad cing yang 'tsho ba rnams so //
analyzed: yang sos zhes bya ba ni bcad cing yang 'tsho ba rnams so //
translated: “Reviving” means those who are cut up and then revived.

original: thig nag ces bya ba ni gshegs pa la sogs pa'i phyir thig nag po 'de bas pa'o //
analyzed: thig nag ces bya ba ni gshegs pa la sogs pa'i phyir thig nag po 'de bas pa'o //
translated: “Black line” means that because of being led away, a black line is drawn.

original: bsdus gzhom zhes bya ba ni bsdus te gzhom pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: bsdus gzhom zhes bya ba ni bsdus te gzhom pa'i sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pa dag go //
translated: “Crushing” means those who have the suffering of being crushed together.

original: ngu 'bod ces bya ba ni rtag tu ngu ba'o //
analyzed: ngu 'bod ces bya ba ni rtag tu ngu ba'o //
translated: “Crying out” means crying out all the time.

original: ngu 'bod chen po zhes bya ba ni ngu 'bod pas kyang ches rtag tu ngu 'bod do //
analyzed: ngu 'bod chen po zhes bya ba ni ngu 'bod pas kyang ches rtag tu ngu 'bod do //
translated: The Great Wailing Hell is so called because the beings there wail even more than in the previous hell.

original: tsha ba zhes bya ba ni rtag tu me 'bar bas tsha ba'o //
analyzed: tsha ba zhes bya ba ni rtag tu me 'bar bas tsha ba'o //
translated: The Hot Hell is so called because it is always hot due to the blazing fire.

original: rab tu tsha ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba bas kyang ches mchog tu tsha ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu tsha ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba bas kyang ches mchog tu tsha ba'o //
translated: The Extremely Hot Hell is so called because it is hotter than the previous hell.

original: mnar med pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du mes khyab pas bde ba'i mtshams kyi bar skabs stong pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal bar du 'chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnar med pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du mes khyab pas bde ba'i mtshams kyi bar skabs stong pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal bar du 'chad pa med pa'o //
translated: The Hell Without Respite is so called because it is filled with fire everywhere, without any interval of relief, and the suffering is uninterrupted.

original: chu bur can zhes bya ba ni chu bar 'bus pa'i rnam pa ltar lus skrangs pa'o //
analyzed: chu bur can zhes bya ba ni chu bar 'bus pa'i rnam pa ltar lus skrangs pa'o //
translated: The Hell of Blisters is so called because the bodies of the beings there swell up like blisters.

original: chu bor rdol zhes bya ba ni chu bur rnam par gas pa'i phyir ro //🔽so thams thams zhes bya ba ni rtag tu kha dang so dag las sgra thams thams zer ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu bor rdol zhes bya ba ni chu bur rnam par gas pa'i phyir ro // so thams thams zhes bya ba ni rtag tu kha dang so dag las sgra thams thams zer ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Hell of Bursting Blisters is so called because the blisters burst open.🔽The Hell of Chattering Teeth is so called because the beings there constantly make the sound chat-chat with their mouths and teeth.

original: kyi hud zer zhes bya ba ni rtag tu kyi hud ces bya ba'i sgra 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi hud zer zhes bya ba ni rtag tu kyi hud ces bya ba'i sgra 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Hell of Lamentation is so called because the beings there constantly cry out Alas!

original: aa chu zer zhes bya ba ni rtag tu aa chu zhes zer ba'i sgra 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aa chu zer zhes bya ba ni rtag tu aa chu zhes zer ba'i sgra 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wailing are those who always cry out wail!

original: autpala ltar gas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang lus de ltar gas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: autpala ltar gas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang lus de ltar gas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The split-like-a-lotus and so on are named after the way their bodies split open.

original: tsha ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The hot are the eight hot hells and so on.

original: grang ba zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cold are the cold hells and so on.

original: gnod pa'i bye brag ces bya ba ni myong bar 'gyur par ma nges pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyam nga ba dag go //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bye brag ces bya ba ni myong bar 'gyur par ma nges pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyam nga ba dag go //
translated: The various tortures are the various tortures of the indeterminate karma results.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal @68b ba'i 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal @68b ba'i 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The after death are the hells.

original: gzhan du skyes zhes bya ba ni shal ma li'i tshal la sogs pa gnas gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du skyes zhes bya ba ni shal ma li'i tshal la sogs pa gnas gzhan du'o //
translated: The other births are the other places such as the Śālmali forest.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi gnas na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi gnas na gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Four Great Kings are so called because they live in the abodes of the Four Great Kings.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya ba la /🔽sum cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni dbang po ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya ba la / sum cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni dbang po ste /
translated: The Thirty-Three Gods🔽The Thirty-Three Gods are the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings.

original: de la nyan pa'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyan pa'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Thirty-Three Gods are the gods of the realm of the Thirty-Three.

original: 'thab bral zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir thun sgrogs zhes kyang bya ste /🔽thun brgyad po dag tu bsod nams la spro ba'i sgra sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thab bral zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir thun sgrogs zhes kyang bya ste / thun brgyad po dag tu bsod nams la spro ba'i sgra sgrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Yāma gods are the gods of the realm of the Yāma gods.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ci dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽'phrul dga' zhes bya ba ni ci dgar sprul pa dag gis mngon par dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ci dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // 'phrul dga' zhes bya ba ni ci dgar sprul pa dag gis mngon par dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tuṣita gods are the gods of the realm of the Tuṣita gods.🔽The Nirmāṇarati gods are the gods of the realm of the Nirmāṇarati gods.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba ni gzhan dag gis sprul pa dag la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba ni gzhan dag gis sprul pa dag la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods are the gods of the realm of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: tshangs ris zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs ris zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Brahmakāyika gods are the gods of the realm of the Brahmakāyika gods.🔽The Brahmapurohita gods are the gods of the realm of the Brahmapurohita gods.

original: tshangs chen zhas bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs chen zhas bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na bdag po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mahābrahmā means the lord of the Brahma world.

original: 'od chung dang tshad med 'od dang 'od gsal zhes bya ba dag ni 'ong chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid dang ldan pa'i bye brag gis go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'od chung dang tshad med 'od dang 'od gsal zhes bya ba dag ni 'ong chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid dang ldan pa'i bye brag gis go rims bzhin no //
translated: The heavens of Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, and Ābhāsvara are so called because they possess lesser, middling, and greater light.

original: dge chung dang tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas zhes bya ba dag kyang dge chung dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyi bye brag gis go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge chung dang tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas zhes bya ba dag kyang dge chung dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyi bye brag gis go rims bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The heavens of Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, and Śubhakṛtsna are so called because they possess lesser, middling, and greater virtue.

original: sprin med ces bya ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa'i bar chad kyi sprin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin med ces bya ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa'i bar chad kyi sprin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The heaven of Anabhraka is so called because it is free from the cloud of obstacles such as inhalation and exhalation.

original: bsod nams skyes zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du dge ba rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams skyes zhes bya ba ni yang nas yang du dge ba rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The heaven of Puṇyaprasava is so called because it is the place where one repeatedly practices virtue.

original: 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa rgya che zhing rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa rgya che zhing rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The heaven of Bṛhatphala is so called because its fruition is vast and peaceful.

original: mi che ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i chos rtogs pa'i phyir 'bad pa klog pas ched du sgrim pa mi che ba'i phyir ro //
