analyzed: mi che ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i chos rtogs pa'i phyir 'bad pa klog pas ched du sgrim pa mi che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The gods called not great are so called because they do not exert great effort to study the uncontaminated teachings.

original: mi gdung ba zhes bya ba ni gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gdung ba zhes bya ba ni gdung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The gods called not tormented are so called because they are free from torment.

original: gya nom snang zhes bya ba ni shes rab gya nom pa snang ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gya nom snang zhes bya ba ni shes rab gya nom pa snang ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The gods called shining beautifully are so called because they shine with beautiful wisdom.

original: / shin tu mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha mal pa nyid kyis shes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / shin tu mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha mal pa nyid kyis shes pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The gods called seeing well are so called because they see with knowledge that is not obscured by the defilements of the summit of existence.🔽The gods called highest are so called because they are the highest of all the gods of the form realm.

original: 'og min zhes bya ba ni gzugs can thams cad kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og min zhes bya ba ni gzugs can thams cad kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanent means subject to arising and destruction.

original: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod @69a * //🔽pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod @69a * // pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering means undesirable.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Empty means selfless.

original: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan la bdag po mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid dang gzhan la bdag po mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term selflessness means that it is not a self in the sense of being independent, nor is it a self in the sense of being a master.

original: brtsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni brtson par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: brtsam par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni brtson par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase should be undertaken means that one should strive for it.

original: 'byung bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar bya zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase should be realized means that one should strive for the transcendence of cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi bstan pa la'o //
translated: The phrase the teaching of the Buddha refers to the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brtson par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par brtson par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase should be entered means that one should strive for it.

original: 'chi bdag ces bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi bdag ces bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The term death refers to death.

original: sde zhes bya ba ni srid pa la sogs pa 'khor ro //
analyzed: sde zhes bya ba ni srid pa la sogs pa 'khor ro //
translated: The term army refers to the retinue of cyclic existence, such as craving.

original: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefits of this,

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
translated: having abandoned the cycle of birth,

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: one will make an end of suffering.

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dag tu 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba dag tu 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the cycle of birth means that one cycles through births.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term suffering refers to birth and so on.

original: tha mar byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tha mar byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun gcod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “in the end, they will be destroyed” means that their continuity will be interrupted.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po zhes bya ba ni gcig rnams kyi stong dang / stong rnams kyi stong dang / stong gi stong rnams kyi stong dag ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po zhes bya ba ni gcig rnams kyi stong dang / stong rnams kyi stong dang / stong gi stong rnams kyi stong dag ste /
translated: The term “great trichiliocosm” means one thousand of the worlds of three-thousand worlds, one thousand of those is one great trichiliocosm.

original: de dag ni gling bzhi pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris dang / tshangs ris kyi 'jig rten stong la ni stong chung ngu gcig go //
analyzed: de dag ni gling bzhi pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris dang / tshangs ris kyi 'jig rten stong la ni stong chung ngu gcig go //
translated: One thousand four-continent worlds, one thousand worlds of the desire realm gods, and one thousand worlds of the Brahma realm gods constitute one small chiliocosm.

original: stong chung ngu stong la ni stong 'bring po gcig go //
analyzed: stong chung ngu stong la ni stong 'bring po gcig go //
translated: One thousand small chiliocosms constitute one second-order chiliocosm.🔽One thousand second-order chiliocosms constitute one great trichiliocosm.

original: stong 'bring po stong la ni stong chen po gcig ste de ni stong yang yin la stong chen po yang yin pas stong chen po'o //
analyzed: stong 'bring po stong la ni stong chen po gcig ste de ni stong yang yin la stong chen po yang yin pas stong chen po'o //
translated: That is a great trichiliocosm because it is a thousand times a great trichiliocosm.🔽That is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.

original: de ni stong gsum yang yin la stong chen po yang yin pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po ste /🔽gling bzhi pa thar 'bum gyi tshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni stong gsum yang yin la stong chen po yang yin pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po ste /🔽gling bzhi pa thar 'bum gyi tshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm.🔽It is a great trichiliocosm because it is a great trichiliocosm

original: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'i gnas so //
translated: The world-realms are the places where beings live.

original: 'das pa'i las lung ston par bzhed ces bya ba ni gang la 'bras bu thams cad 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las lung ston par bzhed ces bya ba ni gang la 'bras bu thams cad 'das pa'o //
translated: He is about to prophesy the past karma of those whose results are all past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i las lung ston par yang bzhed ces bya ba ni gang la 'bras bu nyid ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i las lung ston par yang bzhed ces bya ba ni gang la 'bras bu nyid ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: He is about to prophesy the future karma of those whose results are future.

original: thal mo sbyar te zhes bya ba ni thal mo pug pug por sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te zhes bya ba ni thal mo pug pug por sbyar ba'o //
translated: With palms joined means with palms pressed together.

original: tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs rnams zhes bya ba ni 'od zer gyi tshogs rnams so //
translated: The hosts of light rays means the hosts of light rays.

original: zhal gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni zhal gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhal gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni zhal gyi sgo nas so //
translated: From the door of his mouth means from the door of his mouth.

original: rgod bral zhes bya ba ni rgod pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: rgod bral zhes bya ba ni rgod pa spangs nas so //
translated: Free from agitation means free from agitation.

original: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni sems zhum pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni sems zhum pa nyid do //
translated: Depression means the state of a depressed mind.

original: rgyags pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yon @69b tan la ltos pas khengs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yon @69b tan la ltos pas khengs pa'o //
translated: Conceit means the swelling up of the mind due to considering one's own qualities.

original: de gnyis las grol ba ni zhum dang rgyags pa rab spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las grol ba ni zhum dang rgyags pa rab spangs pa'o //
translated: Liberated from those two means free from depression and conceit.

original: mchog gi rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mchog gi rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The phrase “the cause of the supreme” refers to the nature of the cause of nirvana.

original: dgra thul zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi'i dgra thul lo //
analyzed: dgra thul zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi'i dgra thul lo //
translated: The phrase “the foe-destroyer” refers to the one who has destroyed the four māras.

original: byed rgyu ma mchis par zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par te /
analyzed: byed rgyu ma mchis par zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par te /
translated: The phrase “without any cause” means without a cause.

original: 'di la rgyu gang lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu gang lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “what is the cause of this?” is what is meant.

original: rtsa lag ces bya ba ni padma'i rtsa lag ni myu gu'i mtshan nyid gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa lag ces bya ba ni padma'i rtsa lag ni myu gu'i mtshan nyid gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “like the stem of a lotus” refers to the stem of a lotus, which is characterized by a sprout.

original: dung zhes bya ba ni dung nyid do //
analyzed: dung zhes bya ba ni dung nyid do //
translated: The phrase “like a conch” refers to a conch.

original: padma'i rtsa lag dang dung ltar dkar ba zhes bya ba ni zhal bzhed pa'i tshems 'dzum pa ste /
analyzed: padma'i rtsa lag dang dung ltar dkar ba zhes bya ba ni zhal bzhed pa'i tshems 'dzum pa ste /
translated: The phrase “white like the stem of a lotus and a conch” refers to the smile of the one who has a face with forty even teeth.

original: 'dzum zhes bya ba ni cung zad bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzum zhes bya ba ni cung zad bzhad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “a smile” means a slight smile.

original: de slad ces bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de slad ces bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “therefore” means “for that reason.”

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the teaching” refers to the instruction.

original: rang blos zhes bya ba ni rang gi ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: rang blos zhes bya ba ni rang gi ye shes kyis so //
translated: The phrase “with one’s own mind” means with one’s own wisdom.

original: dus mkhyen nas zhes bya ba ni lung bstan pa'i dus mkhyen nas so //
analyzed: dus mkhyen nas zhes bya ba ni lung bstan pa'i dus mkhyen nas so //
translated: Having known the time, means having known the time of the prophecy.

original: thub pa khyu mchog dge sbyong skye dbang po //
analyzed: thub pa khyu mchog dge sbyong skye dbang po //
translated: The Sage, the bull, the ascetic, the lord of men,

original: zhes bya ba dag kyang bod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag kyang bod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The Sage and the bull are terms of address.

original: thub pa zhes bya ba dang / khyu mchog ces bya ba dang / dge sbyong skye bo'i dbang po 'phags pa'i gang zag gi gtso bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽nyan pa'i skye bo som nyi ldan rnams la //
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba dang / khyu mchog ces bya ba dang / dge sbyong skye bo'i dbang po 'phags pa'i gang zag gi gtso bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // nyan pa'i skye bo som nyi ldan rnams la //
translated: The Sage, the bull, the ascetic, the lord of men, the chief of the noble persons, is the meaning.🔽The people who listen have doubts.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos the tshom can rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos the tshom can rnams so //
translated: The people who listen are the disciples who have doubts.

original: de rnams la the tshom skyes pa bsal du gsol zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams la the tshom skyes pa bsal du gsol zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They say, Please remove the doubts that have arisen for them.

original: tshig ji lta bu dag gis bsal zhe na /
analyzed: tshig ji lta bu dag gis bsal zhe na /
translated: By what words will they be removed?

original: de'i phyir gsung tshig bstan pa dang / dam pa dge ba dag gis zhes bya ba gsungs te brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsung tshig bstan pa dang / dam pa dge ba dag gis zhes bya ba gsungs te brtan pa zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, With words of speech, with the best, the good, and so on. Firm means unshakable.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The best means the supreme meaning and the profound.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bzang ba'i phyir dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bzang ba'i phyir dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Virtue is good because it is wholesome and free from reproach.

original: tsha chu zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: tsha chu zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The ocean is the great ocean.

original: ri rgyal zhes bya ba ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab bo //
analyzed: ri rgyal zhes bya ba ni ri'i rgyal po ri rab bo //
translated: The king of mountains is Mount Meru.

original: de gnyis lta bur brtan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni tsha chus ri rgyal lta bur brtan pa dag go //
analyzed: de gnyis lta bur brtan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni tsha chus ri rgyal lta bur brtan pa dag go //
translated: Those who are firm like the ocean and the king of mountains are the ocean and the king of mountains.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: sangs rgyas mgon rnams zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mgon rnams zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The protectors, the Buddhas.

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: It is so,

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni mthun par bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni mthun par bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: gus par mdzad pa'i slad du lan gnyis su bzlas so //
analyzed: gus par mdzad pa'i slad du lan gnyis su bzlas so //
translated: He said it is so twice, out of respect.

original: rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med ces bya ba ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: Without a cause means without a cause.

original: rkyen med par zhes bya ba ni rkyen dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen med par zhes bya ba ni rkyen dang bral ba'o //
translated: Without conditions means without conditions.

original: dul ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyis mnyam par bzhag pa ste /🔽nyon mongs @70a * //
analyzed: dul ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyis mnyam par bzhag pa ste / nyon mongs @70a * //
translated: Subdued means the mind is in equipoise.

original: pa kun du 'byung ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: pa kun du 'byung ba spangs pa'o //
translated: The arising of afflictions is abandoned.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
translated: “Peace” refers to body and speech.

original: grol ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa gzhan spangs pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa gzhan spangs pa'o //
translated: “Liberation” refers to the abandonment of other existences.

original: dbugs phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: “Relief” refers to pliancy, because there is no suffering.

original: thul ba zhes bya ba ni tshul ma yin par spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thul ba zhes bya ba ni tshul ma yin par spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Subjugation” refers to the absence of improper actions.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Arhat” refers to being worthy of worship.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Free from desire” refers to the absence of desire for sense objects.

original: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i gzugs kyis mdzes pa'o //🔽khyu mchog ltar zhes bya ba ni grong mtha' dag gi dpe'o //🔽glang po che ltar zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i gzugs kyis mdzes pa'o // khyu mchog ltar zhes bya ba ni grong mtha' dag gi dpe'o // glang po che ltar zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: “Beautiful” refers to beauty through the form of evolutionary development.🔽“Like a bull” is an example for those who live in villages.🔽“Like an elephant” is an example for those who live in the forest.

original: seng ge ltar zhes bya ba ni nags khrod na gnas pa dag gi dpa'o //
analyzed: seng ge ltar zhes bya ba ni nags khrod na gnas pa dag gi dpa'o //
translated: “Like a lion” is an example for those who live in the wilderness.

original: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi 'gram na gnas pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: ngang pa'i rgyal po ltar zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi 'gram na gnas pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Like the king of geese refers to those who live on the banks of a river.

original: nam mkha' lding ltar zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i 'gram na gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding ltar zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'i 'gram na gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a garuḍa refers to those who live on the shores of the ocean.

original: bram ze ltar zhes bya ba ni klog pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: bram ze ltar zhes bya ba ni klog pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a brahman refers to those who read the Vedas.

original: sman pa mkhas pa ltar zhes bya ba ni nang pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa ltar zhes bya ba ni nang pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a skilled physician refers to those who are insiders.

original: dpa' bo ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar ma dag gi dpe'o //🔽sa mkhan ltar zhes bya ba ni lam dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar ma dag gi dpe'o // sa mkhan ltar zhes bya ba ni lam dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a hero refers to those who are in front.🔽Like a guide refers to those on the path.

original: ded dpon ltar zhes bya ba ni don mthun pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: ded dpon ltar zhes bya ba ni don mthun pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a caravan leader refers to those who are traveling together.

original: tshong dpon ltar zhes bya ba ni tshong pa dag gi dpe'o //🔽mkhar gyi rgyal po ltar zhes bya ba ni mtha' 'khob pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: tshong dpon ltar zhes bya ba ni tshong pa dag gi dpe'o // mkhar gyi rgyal po ltar zhes bya ba ni mtha' 'khob pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a merchant leader refers to those who are merchants.🔽Like a king of a fort refers to those who are in the borderlands.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like a universal monarch refers to those who are in Jambudvīpa.

original: zla ba ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon par skabs yod pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: zla ba ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon par skabs yod pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Like the moon refers to those who are in the open.

original: nyi ma ltar zhes bya ba ni nyi ma la dga' ba dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ltar zhes bya ba ni nyi ma la dga' ba dag gi dpe'o //
translated: The sun is an example for those who delight in the sun.

original: yul 'khor srung ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyal po chen po zhi ni ri rab kyi bang rim dag na gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //🔽thag bzang ris ltar zhes bya ba ni ri gnya' 'dzin la gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: yul 'khor srung ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyal po chen po zhi ni ri rab kyi bang rim dag na gnas pa dag gi dpe'o // thag bzang ris ltar zhes bya ba ni ri gnya' 'dzin la gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Dhṛtarāṣṭra and so on are examples for those who live on the terraces of Meru.🔽Virūḍhaka is an example for those who live on the Yugandhara mountain.

original: brgyan byin ltar zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi steng na gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //
analyzed: brgyan byin ltar zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi steng na gnas pa dag gi dpe'o //
translated: Vaiśravaṇa is an example for those who live on Meru.

original: tshangs pa ltar zhes bya ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na gnas pa dag gi dpe ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa ltar zhes bya ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na gnas pa dag gi dpe ste /
translated: Brahmā is an example for those who live in the Brahma world.

original: de dag thams cad kyang mnga' mdzad pa dang / 'khor gus pa dang ldan pa'i don du shes par bya'i dngos su khyu mchog ltar ba lang gi tshogs kyis bskor ba la @70b sogs pa nyid ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang mnga' mdzad pa dang / 'khor gus pa dang ldan pa'i don du shes par bya'i dngos su khyu mchog ltar ba lang gi tshogs kyis bskor ba la @70b sogs pa nyid ni ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: All of these are to be understood as examples of those who rule and have respectful retinues, but not as examples of those who are actually surrounded by herds of cattle like bulls.

original: dbang po rnams kyis shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rgyur gyur pa dag gis shin tu dul zhing shin tu dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rgyur gyur pa dag gis shin tu dul zhing shin tu dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: Very well-tamed by the faculties means that the faculties such as the eye are very well-tamed and very well-controlled.

original: spyod lam dang spyod pa ma 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs pa 'khrug long med pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam dang spyod pa ma 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs pa 'khrug long med pa'o //
translated: Not agitated in deportment and conduct means that going and so forth are without agitation.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir chu gter ltar ting nge zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te chu gter zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir chu gter ltar ting nge zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te chu gter zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho'o //
translated: But how is that? Therefore it is said, like an ocean, tranquil, etc. An ocean is called a 'great reservoir.'

original: ting nge ba zhes bya ba ni brtan zhing mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge ba zhes bya ba ni brtan zhing mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: Tranquil means firm and unmoving.

original: de ni rgya mtshor 'gro ba rnams kyi dpe'o //🔽sprin ltar chu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zhing pa rnams kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: de ni rgya mtshor 'gro ba rnams kyi dpe'o // sprin ltar chu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zhing pa rnams kyi dpe'o //
translated: That is an example for those who go to the ocean.🔽Like a cloud, with water is an example for farmers.

original: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dral ba zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa rnams kyi dpe'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dral ba zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa rnams kyi dpe'o //
translated: Like the king of elephants, with arrogance removed is an example for those in the wilderness.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is well adorned with the thirty two marks of a great being.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi mthil 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang /
translated: The thirty two marks of a great being are: his feet are well placed; the soles of his hands and feet are marked with wheels; his fingers are long; the heels of his feet are broad; his hands and feet are soft and youthful;

original: phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu dang / sku ma btud pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang / shing na+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dra bar 'brel ba dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i byin pa lta bu dang / sku ma btud pa dang / mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa dang / shing na+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa dang /
translated: his hands and feet are webbed; his ankles are not prominent; his legs are like an antelope’s; his body is not bent; his sexual organ is concealed in a sheath; his body is the width of an auspicous tree;

original: sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / spu re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / sku mdog gser 'dra shing 'od 'doms gang ba dang ldan pa dang / pags pa srab pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / spu re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / sku mdog gser 'dra shing 'od 'doms gang ba dang ldan pa dang / pags pa srab pa dang / bdun mtho ba dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang /
translated: His body hair points upward, each hair growing singly and curling to the right. His body is golden colored and has a halo one fathom wide. His skin is smooth and soft. He has seven prominent places. His torso is like a lion’s.

original: dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / 'gram pa seng ge 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang / sku che zhing drang ba dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba dang / tshems mnyam pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba dang / tshems shin tu dkar ba dang / 'gram pa seng ge 'dra ba dang /
translated: His shoulders are well formed. His chest is broad. His body is large and straight. He has forty teeth. His teeth are even. His teeth are set close together. His teeth are very white. His jaws are like a lion’s.

original: ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / ro bro ba mkhyen pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dung gi mdog 'dra ba g-yas su 'khyil pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ljags ring zhing srab pa dang / ro bro ba mkhyen pa dang / tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dung gi mdog 'dra ba g-yas su 'khyil pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: His tongue is long and slender, he has the knowledge of taste, he has the voice of Brahma, his eyes are deep blue, his eyelashes are like those of an ox, he has a crown protrusion, and he has the hair-coil of Brahma, the color of a conch shell, between his eyebrows.

original: @71a * // dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @71a * // dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: His body is beautified by the eighty minor marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag rten gyi tshul gyis 'dzin cing /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag rten gyi tshul gyis 'dzin cing /
translated: The eighty minor marks are the thirty-two major marks of a great person, which are held to be the basis of the minor marks.

original: gzugs bzang po mdzes par byed pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ste /
analyzed: gzugs bzang po mdzes par byed pa'i dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ste /
translated: They beautify his excellent form.

original: de la dpe byad bzang po drug cu ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin la nyi shu ni mgur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dpe byad bzang po drug cu ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin la nyi shu ni mgur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Among them, sixty minor marks are included in the body below the collar bone, and twenty are included in the body above the collar bone.

original: de la phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo nyi shu tshigs dang bcas sen mo dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po nyi shu dang / phyag dang zhabs gnyis la mthil brgyad brgyad de phyag gnyis la bzhi dang / zhabs gnyis la bzhi dpe byad bzang po brgyad dang /
analyzed: de la phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo nyi shu tshigs dang bcas sen mo dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po nyi shu dang / phyag dang zhabs gnyis la mthil brgyad brgyad de phyag gnyis la bzhi dang / zhabs gnyis la bzhi dpe byad bzang po brgyad dang /
translated: The twenty fingers and toes with their joints and nails are the twenty secondary signs, the eight surfaces of the two hands and two feet are the eight secondary signs,

original: long bu gnyis dang pus mo gnyis dang / brla gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / phyag gi mkhrig ma gnyis dang / lag ngar gnyis dang / dpung pa gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug po dang /
analyzed: long bu gnyis dang pus mo gnyis dang / brla gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / phyag gi mkhrig ma gnyis dang / lag ngar gnyis dang / dpung pa gnyis te rnam pa drug rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po drug po dang /
translated: the two ankles, two knees, and two thighs are the six secondary signs, the two forearms, two upper arms, and two shoulders are the six secondary signs,

original: sta zur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rked pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / 'bras bu gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mdoms dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / snam btsos gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dku do dpe byad bzang po gcig dang /🔽phyal dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / lte ba dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rtsib logs gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang / nu ma gnyis bsdus pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / brang dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / thugs ka dpe byad bzang po gcig dang /
analyzed: sta zur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rked pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / 'bras bu gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mdoms dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / snam btsos gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dku do dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / phyal dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / lte ba dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rtsib logs gnyis dang / mchan khung gnyis dang / nu ma gnyis bsdus pa dpe byad bzang po drug dang / brang dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / thugs ka dpe byad bzang po gcig dang /
translated: One of the major marks is on the shoulder, one on the waist, two on the buttocks, one on the genitals, two on the calves, one on the thigh,

original: mgur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rgyab dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
analyzed: mgur dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / rgyab dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
translated: two on the knees, two on the shanks, two on the ankles, two on the toes, two on the palms of the hands, two on the fingers, two on the wrists, two on the forearms, two on the elbows, two on the upper arms, two on the shoulders, one on the neck, one on the chin, one on the nose, one on the forehead, one on the head, one on the crown of the head, one on the eyes, one on the eyebrows, one on the cheeks, one on the ears, one on the mouth, one on the teeth, one on the tongue, one on the palate, one on the throat, one on the heart, one on the back, and one on the chest.

original: dpe byad bzang po drug cu po de rnams ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po drug cu po de rnams ni mgur yan chad ma gtogs pa sku man chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: These sixty minor marks are on the body below the neck.

original: tshems phreng la gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dkar than kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / sgros gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mkhur ba shin tu rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / 'gram pa rgyas shing dbyibs legs pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis te /🔽spyan gnyis than kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang // smin @71b ma gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / shangs kyi sbubs gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dpral ba dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / spyan gyi grva gnyis dang /
analyzed: tshems phreng la gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dkar than kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / sgros gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / mkhur ba shin tu rgyas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / 'gram pa rgyas shing dbyibs legs pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis te / spyan gnyis than kor dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang // smin @71b ma gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / shangs kyi sbubs gnyis dpe byad bzang po gnyis dang / dpral ba dpe byad bzang po gcig dang / spyan gyi grva gnyis dang /
translated: The two rows of teeth are two of the excellent marks. The white teeth with their gums are one of the excellent marks. The two lips are two of the excellent marks. The very full cheeks are one of the excellent marks. The full and well-shaped jaws are two of the excellent marks.

original: snyan gnyis dpe byad bzang po bzhi dang / dbu skra dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
analyzed: snyan gnyis dpe byad bzang po bzhi dang / dbu skra dang bcas pa dpe byad bzang po gcig ste /
translated: The two eyes with their white parts are two of the excellent marks. The two eyebrows are two of the excellent marks. The two nostrils are two of the excellent marks. The forehead is one of the excellent marks. The two corners of the eyes and the two ears are four of the excellent marks. The hair of the head is one of the excellent marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po nyi shu po de dag ni mgur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po nyi shu po de dag ni mgur yan chad du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: These twenty excellent marks are included above the collar bone.

original: gzugs can zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sku'o //
analyzed: gzugs can zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi sku'o //
translated: The “embodiment” is the form body.

original: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i mkhyen pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i mkhyen pa gsum ste /
translated: The “three unshared close placements of mindfulness” are the three unshared knowledges.

original: gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par nyan pa dang mi gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par nyan pa dang mi gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o //
translated: They are the evenness of mind toward those who listen respectfully, the evenness of mind toward those who do not listen respectfully, and the evenness of mind toward those who both listen respectfully and do not listen respectfully.

original: thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyi rnam pa mnyam par 'jug pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa sdug bsngal nyid gsum gyi rnam pa mnyam par 'jug pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba /
translated: “Great compassion” is the Tathāgata’s possession of the even engagement of the three kinds of suffering with regard to the sentient beings of the three realms.

original: thabs kyi 'jug pa 'phags pa'i lam skyed pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi 'jug pa 'phags pa'i lam skyed pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i blo'o //
translated: It is the contaminated mind that generates the noble path, the engagement of the method, and causes the attainment of nirvāṇa.

original: ldan par zhes bya ba ni mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: ldan par zhes bya ba ni mnga' ba'o //
translated: “Possesses” means to have.

original: nyan thos chen po dag ces bya ba ni mngon par zhes pa'i yon tan gyi gtso bor gyur pa'i slob ma dag go //
analyzed: nyan thos chen po dag ces bya ba ni mngon par zhes pa'i yon tan gyi gtso bor gyur pa'i slob ma dag go //
translated: The great disciples are the disciples who are foremost in the quality of being manifest.

original: ltad mo zhes bya ba ni mi srid do snyam du the tshom za zhing lta 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ltad mo zhes bya ba ni mi srid do snyam du the tshom za zhing lta 'dod pa'o //
translated: A spectacle is something that one looks at with doubt, thinking that it is impossible.

original: ngo mtshar zhes bya ba ni brgya la ma na 'byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: ngo mtshar zhes bya ba ni brgya la ma na 'byung ba'i chos so //
translated: A marvel is a phenomenon that occurs only occasionally.

original: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa'i chos so //
translated: A wonder is a phenomenon that is meaningful.

original: cung zhig ces bya ba ni mi shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: cung zhig ces bya ba ni mi shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: A little is a nature that is not known.

original: ltad mo bral ba'i dgongs ldan pa //
analyzed: ltad mo bral ba'i dgongs ldan pa //
translated: The one who is intent on being free of the spectacle

original: zhes bya ba ni ltad mo'i sems spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ltad mo'i sems spangs pa'o //
translated: is the one who has abandoned the mind that is a spectacle.

original: skye ngan zhes bya ba ni skye bo ngan pa dag ste smad pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: skye ngan zhes bya ba ni skye bo ngan pa dag ste smad pa'i tshig go //
translated: Evil people are people who are contemptible.

original: don med ces bya ba ni don dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don med ces bya ba ni don dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Meaningless is not having a meaning.

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni gor ma chag pa'o //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni gor ma chag pa'o //
translated: Certainly is without a doubt.

original: 'phral khon la zhes bya ba ni gzi brjid mi bzod pa'i phyir thog ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral khon la zhes bya ba ni gzi brjid mi bzod pa'i phyir thog ma byas pa'o //
translated: Immediately is done at the beginning because of not being able to bear the splendor.

original: gshegs te zhes bya ba ni byon te'o //
analyzed: gshegs te zhes bya ba ni byon te'o //
translated: “Having gone” means having arrived.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i phung po dag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i phung po dag go //
translated: “World” means the aggregates that are born from ripening.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma la 'byung ba la sogs pa dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang / nye bar bsags pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma la 'byung ba la sogs pa dge ba nyon mongs pa can dang / nye bar bsags pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: “Birth” means that which arises in the intermediate existence, etc. , that which arises from the afflicted roots of virtue, that which arises from the accumulation of karma, and that which arises from natural outflow.

original: tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba ni dus dang po'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma zhes bya ba ni dus dang po'i srid pa'o //
translated: “The next life” means the first existence of the future.

original: yang na 'gro ba ni bar ma do'i srid @72a * //
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba ni bar ma do'i srid @72a * //
translated: Alternatively, “world” means the intermediate existence.

original: pa'o // skye ba ni skye ba'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // skye ba ni skye ba'i srid pa'o //
translated: “Birth” means the existence at birth.

original: tshe phyi ma'i dus dang po'i srid pa la sogs pa dus phyi ma'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i dus dang po'i srid pa la sogs pa dus phyi ma'o //
translated: “The next life” means the first existence of the future, etc.

original: chu ji ltar ba kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chu'i rjes su 'brang zhing ste /
analyzed: chu ji ltar ba kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chu'i rjes su 'brang zhing ste /
translated: “Just like water” means following the water.

original: de ni thad kar 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thad kar 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to refute the idea that it goes straight.

original: mi khom pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i skabs med pa'o //
analyzed: mi khom pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i skabs med pa'o //
translated: “No opportunity” means there is no opportunity to see the truth.

original: chags bral zhes bya ba ni yongs su spangs te'o //
analyzed: chags bral zhes bya ba ni yongs su spangs te'o //
translated: “Free from attachment” means completely abandoned.

original: zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Tranquil” means free from the faults of desire, etc.

original: bsten par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bsten par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mnan par dka' ba'o //
translated: “Difficult to approach” means difficult to overcome.

original: bzod par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni brnag par mi nus pa'o //🔽las kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bzod par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni brnag par mi nus pa'o // las kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'gro ba ste /
translated: “Difficult to bear” means impossible to endure.🔽“The course of action” means the course of action.

original: las kyi bye brag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las kyi bye brag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the particular action.

original: nyon la zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: nyon la zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: “Listen” means with the ear consciousness.

original: legs par yid la gyis shig ces bya ba ni rgyun du nyams su myong bas so //
analyzed: legs par yid la gyis shig ces bya ba ni rgyun du nyams su myong bas so //
translated: “Keep it well in mind” means experience it continuously.

original: rab tu yid la gyis shig ces bya ba ni gsal bar nyams su myong bas so //
analyzed: rab tu yid la gyis shig ces bya ba ni gsal bar nyams su myong bas so //
translated: “Keep it well in mind” means experience it clearly.

original: bskal ba chen po bzang po zhes bya ba ni bskal ba mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: bskal ba chen po bzang po zhes bya ba ni bskal ba mdzes pa ste /
translated: “The great fortunate eon” means the beautiful eon.

original: sangs rgyas lnga brgya 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga brgya 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because five hundred buddhas appear.

original: drang srong smra ba zhes bya ba ni drang srong gi gnas kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: drang srong smra ba zhes bya ba ni drang srong gi gnas kyi ming ngo //
translated: The Sage's Speech is the name of a place where sages live.

original: ri dags kyi gnas zhes bya ba ni ri dags kyi tshal lo //
analyzed: ri dags kyi gnas zhes bya ba ni ri dags kyi tshal lo //
translated: The Deer Park is a forest where deer live.

original: 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pas so //
translated: Prosperous means rich in gold, silver, and so on.

original: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni grong dang grong khyer la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni grong dang grong khyer la sogs pas so //
translated: Flourishing means full of villages, cities, and so on.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pas so //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pas so //
translated: Happy means free from harm.

original: lo legs pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba mang bas so //
analyzed: lo legs pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba mang bas so //
translated: Good harvest means abundant food and drink.

original: skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning /
analyzed: skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning /
translated: Full of many people means full of men, women, eunuchs,

original: dang glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo la sogs pas gang ba'o //🔽thab mo zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi yul 'khor dang 'khon pa'o //
analyzed: dang glang po che dang rta dang rnga mo la sogs pas gang ba'o // thab mo zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi yul 'khor dang 'khon pa'o //
translated: elephants, horses, camels, and so on.🔽Quarrel means conflict with a foreign country.

original: 'thab pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul 'khor dang 'khon pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi yul 'khor dang 'khon pa'o //
translated: Fight means conflict within one's own country.

original: phyi dgra zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis byas pa'i 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dgra zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis byas pa'i 'khrug pa'o //
translated: External enemies are disturbances caused by the armies of others.

original: nang 'khrug ces bya ba ni rang gi dmag tshogs kyis byas pa'i 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: nang 'khrug ces bya ba ni rang gi dmag tshogs kyis byas pa'i 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Internal enemies are disturbances caused by one’s own armies.

original: chom rkun zhes bya ba ni g-yon can no //
analyzed: chom rkun zhes bya ba ni g-yon can no //
translated: Bandits are rogues.

original: mu ge zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba dkon pa'o //
analyzed: mu ge zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang btung ba dkon pa'o //
translated: Famine is the scarcity of food and drink.

original: nad ces bya ba ni yams kyi nad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nad ces bya ba ni yams kyi nad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Disease is epidemic disease, and so on.

original: s'a lu'i phreng ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras s'a lu'i zhing gi tshar ro //
analyzed: s'a lu'i phreng ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras s'a lu'i zhing gi tshar ro //
translated: A series of rice fields is a series of rice fields.

original: bu ram shing gi phreng @72b pa zhes bya ba ni bu ram shing gi zhing gi tshar ro //
analyzed: bu ram shing gi phreng @72b pa zhes bya ba ni bu ram shing gi zhing gi tshar ro //
translated: A series of sugarcane fields is a series of sugarcane fields.

original: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Righteous means practicing generosity, morality, and so on.

original: chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba ni rigs pas rgyal srid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba ni rigs pas rgyal srid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A Dharma king is one who obtains kingship through reason.

original: chos kyi rgyal srid byed du bcug go zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i chad pa la sogs pas skye bo la gnod pa mi byed pas blon po'i tshogs rnams rgyal srid byed du bcug pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal srid byed du bcug go zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'i chad pa la sogs pas skye bo la gnod pa mi byed pas blon po'i tshogs rnams rgyal srid byed du bcug pa yin no //
translated: The king made the ministers rule the kingdom means that he did not harm the people with improper punishments, etc., and so the assembly of ministers ruled the kingdom.

original: shed bu zhes bya ba ni bram ze gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: shed bu zhes bya ba ni bram ze gzhon nu'o //
translated: The young brahmin means a young brahmin.

original: gsang tshig 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis te /
analyzed: gsang tshig 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis te /
translated: Desiring the secret words means with the mind.

original: gsang tshig ces bya ba ni rig byed dang gsang sngags so //
analyzed: gsang tshig ces bya ba ni rig byed dang gsang sngags so //
translated: The secret words are the Vedas and mantras.

original: gsang tshig tshol ba zhes bya ba ni bya bas so //
analyzed: gsang tshig tshol ba zhes bya ba ni bya bas so //
translated: Seeking the secret words means by action.

original: rig byed ces bya ba ni nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed do //
analyzed: rig byed ces bya ba ni nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed do //
translated: The Vedas are the Ṛg Veda, the Yajur Veda, the Sāma Veda, and the Atharva Veda.

original: rig byed kyi yan lag ces bya ba ni brda sprod pa dang skar ma'i bstan bcos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi yan lag ces bya ba ni brda sprod pa dang skar ma'i bstan bcos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The branches of the Vedas are grammar, astronomy, etc.

original: pha rol du son pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol du son pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: The one who has gone to the other side means the wise one.

original: ston par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ston par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: “Teacher” means “one who is a support.”

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mi rgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mi rgod pa'o //
translated: “Tranquil” means “not agitated.”

original: spyod lam zhi ba zhes bya ba ni cha lugs kyi'o //
analyzed: spyod lam zhi ba zhes bya ba ni cha lugs kyi'o //
translated: “Tranquil deportment” means “having a good appearance.”

original: zhabs kyi srid zhu bgyid ces bya ba ni mchod pa byed par ro //
analyzed: zhabs kyi srid zhu bgyid ces bya ba ni mchod pa byed par ro //
translated: “I will serve your feet” means “I will worship you.”

original: chu ngogs zhes bya ba ni chu 'gram mo //
analyzed: chu ngogs zhes bya ba ni chu 'gram mo //
translated: “Riverbank” means “river shore.”

original: nye reg ces bya ba ni chus khrus byas pa dang / sbyin blugs bya ba la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: nye reg ces bya ba ni chus khrus byas pa dang / sbyin blugs bya ba la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: “Ablution” means “washing with water” and “the act of offering oblations.”

original: yam sreg shing zhes bya ba ni sbyin sreg bya ba'i bud shing ngo //
analyzed: yam sreg shing zhes bya ba ni sbyin sreg bya ba'i bud shing ngo //
translated: “Fuel” means “wood for the sacrificial fire.”

original: kud sa'i rigs ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bram ze'i rigs kyi sgra ste /
analyzed: kud sa'i rigs ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bram ze'i rigs kyi sgra ste /
translated: “The family of the Ṛṣis” and so on are the names of the brahmin caste.

original: drang srong kud sa la sogs pa'i rigs rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang srong kud sa la sogs pa'i rigs rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the lineage of the Ṛṣis such as Kuśa and so on.

original: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni chub pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa zhes bya ba ni chub pa'o //
translated: “Permeating” means “pervading.”

original: skye bo mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo mdzangs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo mdzangs pa'o //
translated: “Wise people” means “intelligent people.”

original: kha rje zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i don 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: kha rje zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i don 'grub pa'o //
translated: “Authority” means “accomplishing worldly goals.”

original: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba 'grub pa'o //
translated: “Meritorious” means accomplishing virtue.

original: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni sdig pa nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni sdig pa nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: “Auspicious” means destroying evil.

original: gtsang ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsang ba zhes bya ba ni rang nyid dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Pure” means being isolated by oneself.

original: gtsang ba nyid kyi gnas su grags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtsang ba nyid kyi gnas su grags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Renowned as the abode of the pure” means

original: gtsang ba'i dngos po ni gtsang ba nyid de /
analyzed: gtsang ba'i dngos po ni gtsang ba nyid de /
translated: the abode of the pure thing.

original: de'i gnas zhes bya ba ni de'i yul du grags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas zhes bya ba ni de'i yul du grags pa'o //
translated: “Renowned” means known in that place.🔽“With water flowing on both banks” means

original: 'gram gnyis na rlan 'phyo ba zhes bya ba ni ngogs gnyis kyi mu gnyis ka nas chu'i dbyings kyis gang ba'o //
analyzed: 'gram gnyis na rlan 'phyo ba zhes bya ba ni ngogs gnyis kyi mu gnyis ka nas chu'i dbyings kyis gang ba'o //
translated: the two ends of the two banks are filled with water.

original: chu dgur bco brgyad 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni gya gyur @73a * //
analyzed: chu dgur bco brgyad 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni gya gyur @73a * //
translated: “With eighteen streams flowing” means

original: 'bebs pa'i gling bco brgyad kyis mtshon pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: 'bebs pa'i gling bco brgyad kyis mtshon pa'i yul lo //
translated: the eighteen islands that are the source of the streams.

original: snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba ni mnyen par smra ba'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba ni mnyen par smra ba'o //
translated: “Pleasant to speak” means speaking gently.

original: sa dang sa gzhi zhes bya ba ni sa nyid do //
analyzed: sa dang sa gzhi zhes bya ba ni sa nyid do //
translated: “Earth and ground” means the earth itself.

original: mdzes pa mdzes pa dag ces bya ba ni bzang po dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mdzes pa mdzes pa dag ces bya ba ni bzang po dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: “Beautiful and beautiful” means the synonyms of good.

original: slob ma la rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma dga' ba'o //
analyzed: slob ma la rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma dga' ba'o //
translated: The phrase who are attached to their disciples means who are fond of their disciples.

original: 'khor nyung ba zhes bya ba ni g-yog 'khor nyung ba dag go //🔽g-yang gzhi dag ces bya ba ni ri dags la sogs pa'i pags pa dag go //
analyzed: 'khor nyung ba zhes bya ba ni g-yog 'khor nyung ba dag go // g-yang gzhi dag ces bya ba ni ri dags la sogs pa'i pags pa dag go //
translated: The phrase who have few followers means who have few attendants.🔽The phrase wearing garments of antelope hide means wearing garments made of the skin of antelopes and other animals.

original: blugs gzar dag ces bya ba ni sbyin sreg rgyu ldugs par byed pa'i gzar bu mu ba ring po'o //
analyzed: blugs gzar dag ces bya ba ni sbyin sreg rgyu ldugs par byed pa'i gzar bu mu ba ring po'o //
translated: The phrase holding sacrificial ladles means holding long ladles for pouring the sacrificial substances.

original: dgang gzar zhes bya ba ni sbyin sreg rgyus dgang bar bya ba'i gzar bu chen po'o //
analyzed: dgang gzar zhes bya ba ni sbyin sreg rgyus dgang bar bya ba'i gzar bu chen po'o //
translated: The phrase holding sacrificial vessels means holding large ladles for holding the sacrificial substances.

original: rgol ba'i shing rta zhes bya ba ni rgol ba tshar gcod pa dag gis drang bar bya ba'i shing rta'o //
analyzed: rgol ba'i shing rta zhes bya ba ni rgol ba tshar gcod pa dag gis drang bar bya ba'i shing rta'o //
translated: The phrase chariots for debate means chariots for the purpose of refuting opponents.

original: dbye tshong pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i gnas med pa'i dbye ba stong par nyo tshong byed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: dbye tshong pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i gnas med pa'i dbye ba stong par nyo tshong byed pa'i gnas so //
translated: The phrase markets for selling goods means places for buying and selling goods that are empty of the presence of people.

original: chong rdal zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i gnas med pa chu klung gi 'gram la sogs par nyo tshong byed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: chong rdal zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i gnas med pa chu klung gi 'gram la sogs par nyo tshong byed pa'i gnas so //
translated: The phrase public squares means places for buying and selling goods that are empty of the presence of people, such as riverbanks.

original: 'dul zhing zhes bya ba ni pham par byed cing ngo //
analyzed: 'dul zhing zhes bya ba ni pham par byed cing ngo //
translated: The field to be disciplined is the one to be subdued.

original: lo ma zhes bya ba ni yal ga phre'u'o //
analyzed: lo ma zhes bya ba ni yal ga phre'u'o //
translated: The leaves are the branches and twigs.

original: rgyal ba dang tshe spel bar byas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal ba dang tshe spel bar byas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having made them victorious and increased their life-span,

original: rgyal bas spel bar byas te zhes bya ba ni khyod rgyal bar gyur cig ces shis pa brjod pas spel bar byas te'o //
analyzed: rgyal bas spel bar byas te zhes bya ba ni khyod rgyal bar gyur cig ces shis pa brjod pas spel bar byas te'o //
translated: having made them victorious means having made them victorious by the benediction May you be victorious!

original: tshe spel bar byas te zhes bya ba ni khyod tshe ring bar gyur cig ces shis pa brjod pas spel bar byas te'o //
analyzed: tshe spel bar byas te zhes bya ba ni khyod tshe ring bar gyur cig ces shis pa brjod pas spel bar byas te'o //
translated: Having increased their life-span means having increased their life-span by the benediction May you live long!

original: bka' mchid rnam par gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pa'o //🔽zhugs lta bu'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni me dang 'dra ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: bka' mchid rnam par gtan la dbab pa zhes bya ba ni gtam rnam par gtan la dbab pa'o // zhugs lta bu'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni me dang 'dra ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: The discourse for determining is the conversation for determining.🔽With the knowledge like fire,

original: thams cad du mthus thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du mthus thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: like fire means like a fire, because it is unobstructed in all directions by its power.🔽Having clarified one's own speech,

original: rang gi smra ba gsal bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs rab tu bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi smra ba gsal bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs rab tu bzhag pa'o //
translated: one's own speech means one's own doctrine.

original: gzhan gyi smra bar tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dgag pa'o / phyogs zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi smra bar tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dgag pa'o / phyogs zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The refutation of others' doctrines is the refutation of the doctrines of others. The position is one's own doctrine.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dam 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs dam 'cha' ba'o //
translated: The other's position is the doctrine of others.

original: phyogs snga ma zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs dam 'cha' ba sngar byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzhung lugs dam 'cha' ba sngar byed pa'o //
translated: The prior position is the prior statement of one's own doctrine.

original: 'gron pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gron pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The guest is the opponent.

original: rgyud chags zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: rgyud chags zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gnas so //
translated: The disputation is the occasion for the disputation.

original: rigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang @73b 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang @73b 'gal ba'o //
translated: The unreasoned is that which contradicts the scriptures.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni snga phyi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni snga phyi 'gal ba'o //
translated: The incongruous is that which contradicts the order of sequence.

original: mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The unacceptable is that which contradicts the reason.

original: tshar gcod pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni pham pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshar gcod pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni pham pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The grounds for defeat are the causes of defeat.

original: lan la mi spobs pa zhes bya ba ni lan gyi skabs su cang mi smra bar 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: lan la mi spobs pa zhes bya ba ni lan gyi skabs su cang mi smra bar 'dug pa'o //
translated: The lack of confidence in reply is the failure to reply when one should.

original: rangs pa zhes bya ba ni spu gyen du 'greng ba'o //
analyzed: rangs pa zhes bya ba ni spu gyen du 'greng ba'o //
translated: The word pleased means that the hair stands on end.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word joy means that one is endowed with physical bliss.

original: mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid ba bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid ba bde ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word supreme joy means that one is endowed with mental bliss.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i 'brel ba'o //
translated: The word brahmin means that one is related to a brahmin.

original: spyod tshul zhes bya ba ni 'greng ba la sogs bya ba med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: spyod tshul zhes bya ba ni 'greng ba la sogs bya ba med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The word conduct means that one has the form of not doing such things as standing.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: The word action means such things as walking.

original: gtsang sbra zhes bya ba ni dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra zhes bya ba ni dag par byed pa'o //
translated: The word purity means that one makes oneself pure.

original: kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub pa'o //🔽thal ba blangs pa zhes bya ba ni byug ris rgyu'o //🔽bya ma bum blangs pa zhes bya ba ni chu snod do //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrub pa'o // thal ba blangs pa zhes bya ba ni byug ris rgyu'o // bya ma bum blangs pa zhes bya ba ni chu snod do //
translated: The word practice means that one accomplishes it.🔽 The word taking ashes means that one uses them for decoration.🔽 The word taking a clay pot means that one uses it as a water vessel.

original: sa blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dag rdzas rgyu'o //
analyzed: sa blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dag rdzas rgyu'o //
translated: The word taking earth means that one uses it for cleaning.

original: lag stabs zhes bya ba ni lag pa bzhag pa'i thabs so / thor tshugs zhes bya ba ni skra bcing ba'i thabs so //🔽rab bsngags bya ba zhes bya ba ni aom zhes bya ba'o //🔽kva zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: lag stabs zhes bya ba ni lag pa bzhag pa'i thabs so / thor tshugs zhes bya ba ni skra bcing ba'i thabs so // rab bsngags bya ba zhes bya ba ni aom zhes bya ba'o // kva zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: The science of medicine is the science of the means of curing the sick.🔽 The science of logic is the science of the means of knowing the valid means of knowledge.🔽 The science of grammar is the science of the means of expressing oneself correctly in speech and writing.🔽 The science of prosody is the science of the rules for arranging letters, syllables, and words in verse.🔽 The science of fine arts is the science of the means of creating various images.🔽 The science of medicine is the science of the means of curing the sick.🔽 The science of logic is the science of the means of knowing the valid means of knowledge.

original: nges brjod kyi rig byed ces bya ba ni ri tsa zhes bya tshig sbyar ba'i tshad nges par brjod pa'i rig byed de /
analyzed: nges brjod kyi rig byed ces bya ba ni ri tsa zhes bya tshig sbyar ba'i tshad nges par brjod pa'i rig byed de /
translated: The science of grammar is the science of the means of expressing oneself correctly in speech and writing.🔽 The science of prosody is the science of the rules for arranging letters, syllables, and words in verse.🔽 The science of fine arts is the science of the means of creating various images.🔽 The science of medicine is the science of the means of curing the sick.

original: shes pa bskyed pa'i tshig go //🔽mchod sbyin gyi rig byed ces bya ba ni tshig sbyar ba'i tshad nges pa med pa dag go //🔽snyan tshig gi rig byed ces bya ba ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa la bstod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa bskyed pa'i tshig go // mchod sbyin gyi rig byed ces bya ba ni tshig sbyar ba'i tshad nges pa med pa dag go // snyan tshig gi rig byed ces bya ba ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa la bstod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The science of logic is the science of the means of knowing the valid means of knowledge.🔽 The science of grammar is the science of the means of expressing oneself correctly in speech and writing.🔽 The science of prosody is the science of the rules for arranging letters, syllables, and words in verse.🔽 The science of fine arts is the science of the means of creating various images.

original: srid srung gi rig byed ces bya ba ni skye dgu bsrung ba'i thabs ston pa'o //
analyzed: srid srung gi rig byed ces bya ba ni skye dgu bsrung ba'i thabs ston pa'o //
translated: The science of medicine is the science of the means of curing the sick.🔽 The science of logic is the science of the means of knowing the valid means of knowledge.

original: 'don du bcug go zhes bya ba ni klog tu bcug pa'o //
analyzed: 'don du bcug go zhes bya ba ni klog tu bcug pa'o //
translated: The science of grammar is the

original: ri tsa zhes bya ba ni skad kyi dbyings te tshig sbyar ba'i tshad nges pa'i don to ;
analyzed: ri tsa zhes bya ba ni skad kyi dbyings te tshig sbyar ba'i tshad nges pa'i don to ;
translated: The word ca is a verbal root meaning to join and has the sense of a grammatical particle.

original: / yun ring po nas bral ba dag ste zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas lung rnam par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: / yun ring po nas bral ba dag ste zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas lung rnam par 'chad pa'o //
translated: They are separated for a long time means that they are separated for a long time from the scriptures.

original: bla ma'i tshig shes dka' ba dag ces bya ba ni yun ring po nas bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma'i tshig shes dka' ba dag ces bya ba ni yun ring po nas bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words difficult to understand means that they are separated for a long time.

original: ci dgar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci dgar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas su 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They go as they please means that they go to the place they desire.

original: ci dgar spyod pas zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i nyal ba dang / 'chag pa la sogs pa byed pas so //
analyzed: ci dgar spyod pas zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i nyal ba dang / 'chag pa la sogs pa byed pas so //
translated: They act as they please means that they do whatever they want, such as sleeping, walking, and so on.

original: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni skrag pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni skrag pa skyes pa'o //
translated: Fear means that fear arises.

original: bag tsha ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa skye bar rogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag tsha ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa skye bar rogs pa'o //
translated: Anxiety means that fear arises.

original: rgyud rgya chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lung rgya chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud rgya chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lung rgya chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They have a vast continuum means that they have a vast scripture.

original: 'khor ba dang thar pa gnyis thabs @74a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang thar pa gnyis thabs @74a * //
translated: Both cyclic existence and liberation are methods for attaining nirvana.

original: dang bcas pa dag sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang bcas pa dag sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they think about the wholesome dharmas.

original: rgyu zab mo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par dka' ba'i don la sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu zab mo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa rtogs par dka' ba'i don la sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Possessing profound causes means that they think about the meaning that is difficult to understand, such as selflessness, impermanence, and emptiness.

original: rgyud bzang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi la gnas pa'i lung dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud bzang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi la gnas pa'i lung dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Possessing a good lineage means that they have the scriptures that are the basis.

original: 'jig rten pa la phan par mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i lam la gzhan gyis pham par byed mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la phan par mi nus pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i lam la gzhan gyis pham par byed mi nus pa'o //
translated: Unable to be defeated by the world means that they cannot be defeated by others in the worldly path, such as dependent origination.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa las gting med pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa dang / thar pa'i lam la mu stegs can rnams kyi 'jug pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa las gting med pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa dang / thar pa'i lam la mu stegs can rnams kyi 'jug pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unfathomable by the supramundane means that the tīrthikas have no path to enter into liberation and the path to liberation.

original: mang ba zhes bya ba ni mthu zad pa med pas pham par mi nus pa bstan to //
analyzed: mang ba zhes bya ba ni mthu zad pa med pas pham par mi nus pa bstan to //
translated: Many shows that they cannot be defeated because their power is inexhaustible.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbye ba med pas pham par mi nus pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbye ba med pas pham par mi nus pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The term “in harmony” indicates that they cannot be defeated because they are not divided into separate parts.

original: longs spyod dang don du mi gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la bsnyen bkur byed pa med pas pham par mi nus pa nyid bsten to ;
analyzed: longs spyod dang don du mi gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la bsnyen bkur byed pa med pas pham par mi nus pa nyid bsten to ;
translated: The term “not seeking enjoyment and benefits” indicates that they cannot be defeated because they do not seek to be honored by others.

original: / shes rab kyi spobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: / shes rab kyi spobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The term “wisdom and eloquence” indicates that they are engaged in wisdom.

original: bran zhes bya ba ni khol po'o //
analyzed: bran zhes bya ba ni khol po'o //
translated: The term “slave” indicates a servant.

original: mdun du byas te zhes bya ba ni sten te'o //🔽mtsho rnams zhes bya ba ni 'bab par byed pas mtsho rnams te /
analyzed: mdun du byas te zhes bya ba ni sten te'o // mtsho rnams zhes bya ba ni 'bab par byed pas mtsho rnams te /
translated: The term “in front” indicates that they are engaged in the practice.

original: srid pa gsum po 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum po 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The term “oceans” indicates the three realms of existence, which are called “oceans” because they are agitated by the waves of the many kinds of suffering.

original: ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas su mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas su mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The term “turn back” indicates that they do not increase the latent impressions of the mental afflictions.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i 'jug pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i 'jug pa'i lam ste /
translated: The term “path” indicates the mundane path of practice.

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dag la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The term “ignorance, formations, and consciousness” indicates the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni de lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni de lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: “Reversal” means the opposite of that.

original: ma lus par ni 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma lus par ni 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: “Cease completely” means not to arise again.

original: tshig de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa la bsam pa yin pas bram ze mi shes so //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa la bsam pa yin pas bram ze mi shes so //
translated: These words refer to nirvana, so the brahmin does not understand.

original: spang ba zhes bya ba ni gya gyu dang po'o //
analyzed: spang ba zhes bya ba ni gya gyu dang po'o //
translated: “Abandon” means the first crookedness.

original: gces pa zhes bya ba ni tshig btsan pa'o //
analyzed: gces pa zhes bya ba ni tshig btsan pa'o //
translated: “Cherished” means powerful words.

original: bstabs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bstabs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Be applied” means be clarified.

original: rab tu shes pa'i bram ze zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o ;
analyzed: rab tu shes pa'i bram ze zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o ;
translated: “A brahmin who knows well” means famous.

original: / thos pas thob par bya ba zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: / thos pas thob par bya ba zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
translated: “To be attained through learning” means famous.

original: bsnyen bkur ba zhes bya ba ni legs par bsten pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ba zhes bya ba ni legs par bsten pa'o //
translated: “To be served” means to be well attended.

original: lung zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: lung zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos so //
translated: “The scriptures” means the treatises.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Realization” means the result.

original: ji tsam de tsam zhes bya ba ni cung zhig go //
analyzed: ji tsam de tsam zhes bya ba ni cung zhig go //
translated: “To that extent” means a little.

original: mdo sde'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde @74b dag ste /
analyzed: mdo sde'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde @74b dag ste /
translated: “The end of the sutras” means the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: mdo rnams kyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo rnams kyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the culmination of the sūtras.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: “Harm” means contradiction.

original: chos kyi khrid byed ces bya ba ni chos mngon pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khrid byed ces bya ba ni chos mngon pa ste /
translated: “Instruction in the Dharma” is the Abhidharma,

original: dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa'i khrid par byed pa dang / mtshon par byed pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa'i khrid par byed pa dang / mtshon par byed pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it instructs, reveals, and determines the categories of things.

original: rnam par dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni drungs dbyung ba ste mi rung bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni drungs dbyung ba ste mi rung bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Disturbance” means to be uprooted, that is, to be rendered unfit.

original: chos kyi mngal zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mngal zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba ste /
translated: “Womb of the Dharma” is the Vinaya,

original: 'bras bu'i chos de nas byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos de nas byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the resultant Dharma arises from it.

original: yang na chos kyi mngal zhes bya ba'i mdo sde dang / chos mngon par nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na chos kyi mngal zhes bya ba'i mdo sde dang / chos mngon par nyid yin te /
translated: Or else, the womb of the Dharma is the sūtras and the Abhidharma.
